translation_english: (Those who obtain guidance to His light are found) in the houses which He has enjoined to raise up and to mention His name therein. In them such people glorify Him morning and evening

arabic: رِجَالٌ لَّا تُلْهِيهِمْ تِجَارَةٌ وَلَا بَيْعٌ عَن ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ وَإِقَامِ الصَّلَاةِ وَإِيتَاءِ الزَّكَاةِ ۙ يَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا تَتَقَلَّبُ فِيهِ الْقُلُوبُ وَالْأَبْصَارُ
translation_english: as are not diverted by trade and merchandise from remembering Him and from establishing Salat and paying Zakat, for they fear the Day when the hearts will be overturned and the eyes will become petrified.

arabic: لِيَجْزِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنَ مَا عَمِلُوا وَيَزِيدَهُم مِّن فَضْلِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَرْزُقُ مَن يَشَاءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
translation_english: (And they behave like this) so that Allah may reward them for their excellent deeds and, in addition to it, show His favour to them out of His bounty: Allah provides without stint for anyone He pleases.

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَعْمَالُهُمْ كَسَرَابٍ بِقِيعَةٍ يَحْسَبُهُ الظَّمْآنُ مَاءً حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَهُ لَمْ يَجِدْهُ شَيْئًا وَوَجَدَ اللَّهَ عِندَهُ فَوَفَّاهُ حِسَابَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ
translation_english: (On the other hand,) the deeds of those who disbelieved, maybe likened to a mirage in a waterless desert, which the thirsty one took for water; but when he reached there he found nothing to drink; nay, he found there Allah Who settled his full account, and Allah is very swift at reckoning.

arabic: أَوْ كَظُلُمَاتٍ فِي بَحْرٍ لُّجِّيٍّ يَغْشَاهُ مَوْجٌ مِّن فَوْقِهِ مَوْجٌ مِّن فَوْقِهِ سَحَابٌ ۚ ظُلُمَاتٌ بَعْضُهَا فَوْقَ بَعْضٍ إِذَا أَخْرَجَ يَدَهُ لَمْ يَكَدْ يَرَاهَا ۗ وَمَن لَّمْ يَجْعَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ نُورًا فَمَا لَهُ مِن نُّورٍ
translation_english: Or (their efforts may be likened to those of a man trying to swim in) a deep dark ocean, covered with billows, one over the other, and above it a cloud: darkness upon darkness: so much so that if he stretches out his hand, he cannot see it. There is no light for the one whom Allah does not give light.

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَالطَّيْرُ صَافَّاتٍ ۖ كُلٌّ قَدْ عَلِمَ صَلَاتَهُ وَتَسْبِيحَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِمَا يَفْعَلُونَ
translation_english: Do you not observe that all those who are in the heavens and the earth, and the birds with outspread wings, glorify Allah? Each one knows the mode of its prayer and glorification, and Allah has full knowledge of all they do.

arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ الْمَصِيرُ
translation_english: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone, and all shall have to return to Him.

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُزْجِي سَحَابًا ثُمَّ يُؤَلِّفُ بَيْنَهُ ثُمَّ يَجْعَلُهُ رُكَامًا فَتَرَى الْوَدْقَ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ خِلَالِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مِن جِبَالٍ فِيهَا مِن بَرَدٍ فَيُصِيبُ بِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ وَيَصْرِفُهُ عَن مَّن يَشَاءُ ۖ يَكَادُ سَنَا بَرْقِهِ يَذْهَبُ بِالْأَبْصَارِ
translation_english: Do you not observe that Allah makes the cloud move gently then joins its pieces together: then gathers it into a mass of thick cloud: then you see that rain-drops fall down from its midst: and He sends down hail out of the high up mountains in the heaven: then He smites with it whom He wills and turns it away from whom He pleases: then a flash of lightning from it dazzles the eyes.

arabic: يُقَلِّبُ اللَّهُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّأُولِي الْأَبْصَارِ
translation_english: He alternates the day and the night: there is indeed a lesson in it for those who have observing eyes.

arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَ كُلَّ دَابَّةٍ مِّن مَّاءٍ ۖ فَمِنْهُم مَّن يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ بَطْنِهِ وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ رِجْلَيْنِ وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ أَرْبَعٍ ۚ يَخْلُقُ اللَّهُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
translation_english: And Allah created every creature from a sort of water: of them some one crawls upon its belly: another walks on two legs and still another on four; Allah creates whatever He wills for He has power over everything

arabic: لَّقَدْ أَنزَلْنَا آيَاتٍ مُّبَيِّنَاتٍ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
translation_english: We have sent down Revelations that make the reality quite plain; however, Allah guides to the straight path whomsoever He pleases.

arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَبِالرَّسُولِ وَأَطَعْنَا ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّىٰ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُم مِّن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا أُولَـٰئِكَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: These people say "We have believed in Allah and the Messenger and we have submitted"; but soon after this, some of them turn away (from obedience): such people are not true Believers.

arabic: وَإِذَا دُعُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِذَا فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
translation_english: When they are called to Allah and His Messenger so that the Messenger may judge between them, a party of them turns away.

arabic: وَإِن يَكُن لَّهُمُ الْحَقُّ يَأْتُوا إِلَيْهِ مُذْعِنِينَ
translation_english: However, if the truth be on their side, they come towards the Messenger in all obedience.

arabic: أَفِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ أَمِ ارْتَابُوا أَمْ يَخَافُونَ أَن يَحِيفَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَرَسُولُهُ ۚ بَلْ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
translation_english: Are their hearts afflicted with the disease (of hypocrisy)? Or, are they in doubt? Or, do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust to them? In fact, they themselves are unjust.

arabic: إِنَّمَا كَانَ قَوْلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِذَا دُعُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَن يَقُولُوا سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا ۚ وَأُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
translation_english: As regards the Believers, when they are called towards Allah and His Messenger so that the Messenger may judge between them, they say, "We have heard and obeyed"; such are the people who attain true success,

arabic: وَمَن يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَيَخْشَ اللَّهَ وَيَتَّقْهِ فَأُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ
translation_english: and only those attain true success who obey Allah and His Messenger and fear Allah and refrain from His disobedience.

arabic: وَأَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ لَئِنْ أَمَرْتَهُمْ لَيَخْرُجُنَّ ۖ قُل لَّا تُقْسِمُوا ۖ طَاعَةٌ مَّعْرُوفَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: They (the hypocrites) solemnly swear by Allah and say, "If you order us, we will leave our homes." Say to them, "Do not swear oaths for your `obedience' is well known; Allah is fully aware of what you are doing. "

arabic: قُلْ أَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ ۖ فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْهِ مَا حُمِّلَ وَعَلَيْكُم مَّا حُمِّلْتُمْ ۖ وَإِن تُطِيعُوهُ تَهْتَدُوا ۚ وَمَا عَلَى الرَّسُولِ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ
translation_english: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, you should note it well that the Messenger is responsible for the duty entrusted to him and you are responsible for the duty entrusted to you. If you obey him, you will be rightly guided, for the responsibility of the Messenger is only to convey the Message clearly to you.

arabic: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنكُمْ وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَيَسْتَخْلِفَنَّهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ كَمَا اسْتَخْلَفَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ وَلَيُمَكِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ دِينَهُمُ الَّذِي ارْتَضَىٰ لَهُمْ وَلَيُبَدِّلَنَّهُم مِّن بَعْدِ خَوْفِهِمْ أَمْنًا ۚ يَعْبُدُونَنِي لَا يُشْرِكُونَ بِي شَيْئًا ۚ وَمَن كَفَرَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
translation_english: Allah has promised to those among you who believe and do righteous deeds, that He will make them successors in the land just as He made those who passed away before them, and that He will establish their religion, which He has approved for them, on strong foundations and will change their (present) state of fear into peace and security. Let them worship Me and associate none with Me; and the one who disbelieves after this," shall be of those who are perverse transgressors.

arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
translation_english: Therefore, establish Salat, pay the Zakat dues and obey the Messenger; it is expected that you will be shown mercy.

arabic: لَا تَحْسَبَنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مُعْجِزِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَأْوَاهُمُ النَّارُ ۖ وَلَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
translation_english: Do not think about those who have disbelieved that they will be able to frustrate Allah in the land; their abode is Hell and it is a very evil abode.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لِيَسْتَأْذِنكُمُ الَّذِينَ مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ وَالَّذِينَ لَمْ يَبْلُغُوا الْحُلُمَ مِنكُمْ ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ ۚ مِّن قَبْلِ صَلَاةِ الْفَجْرِ وَحِينَ تَضَعُونَ ثِيَابَكُم مِّنَ الظَّهِيرَةِ وَمِن بَعْدِ صَلَاةِ الْعِشَاءِ ۚ ثَلَاثُ عَوْرَاتٍ لَّكُمْ ۚ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَا عَلَيْهِمْ جُنَاحٌ بَعْدَهُنَّ ۚ طَوَّافُونَ عَلَيْكُم بَعْضُكُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
translation_english: O Believers, your slaves and those of your children, who have not yet become sex conscious, must ask your permission before coming in to see you on three occasions: before the Fajr Prayer and at noon when you put off your clothes and after the `Isha' Prayer. These are your three times of privacy. There is no sin for you or for them if they come without permission at other times than these, for you have to visit: ne another over and over again. In this way Allah makes His Comm andments clear to you for He is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

arabic: وَإِذَا بَلَغَ الْأَطْفَالُ مِنكُمُ الْحُلُمَ فَلْيَسْتَأْذِنُوا كَمَا اسْتَأْذَنَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ آيَاتِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
translation_english: And when your children have grown sex conscious, they should receive your permission for this just as their elders get permission. In this way Allah makes His Revelations plain to you for He is All-Knowing, AllWise.

arabic: وَالْقَوَاعِدُ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ اللَّاتِي لَا يَرْجُونَ نِكَاحًا فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِنَّ جُنَاحٌ أَن يَضَعْنَ ثِيَابَهُنَّ غَيْرَ مُتَبَرِّجَاتٍ بِزِينَةٍ ۖ وَأَن يَسْتَعْفِفْنَ خَيْرٌ لَّهُنَّ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
translation_english: There is no sin for such elderly women as are past the age of marriage, if they lay aside their outer graments provided that they do not mean to display their adornment. Nevertheless, if they behave modestly, it would be better for them: for Allah hears everything and knows everything.

arabic: لَّيْسَ عَلَى الْأَعْمَىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْأَعْرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْمَرِيضِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَىٰ أَنفُسِكُمْ أَن تَأْكُلُوا مِن بُيُوتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ آبَائِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ إِخْوَانِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَخَوَاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَعْمَامِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ عَمَّاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَخْوَالِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ خَالَاتِكُمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكْتُم مَّفَاتِحَهُ أَوْ صَدِيقِكُمْ ۚ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ أَن تَأْكُلُوا جَمِيعًا أَوْ أَشْتَاتًا ۚ فَإِذَا دَخَلْتُم بُيُوتًا فَسَلِّمُوا عَلَىٰ أَنفُسِكُمْ تَحِيَّةً مِّنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ مُبَارَكَةً طَيِّبَةً ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
translation_english: There is no harm if a blind or a lame or a sick person (takes a meal at another's house): nor is there any harm for yourselves if you take meals at your own houses or at the houses of your fathers and grandfathers or at the houses of your mothers and grandmothers or at your brothers' houses or at your sisters' houses or at the houses of your paternal uncles or at the houses of your paternal aunts or at the houses of your maternal uncles or at the houses of your maternal aunts or from the houses whose keys are in your possession or at the houses of your friends. There is no harm if you take your meals together or separately; however, when you enter the houses, you should send greetings of peace on your people, for the prayer of greetings prescribed by Allah is blessed and pure. Thus Allah makes His Revelation's clear to you. It is expected that you will use your common sense to grasp these.

arabic: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَإِذَا كَانُوا مَعَهُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ جَامِعٍ لَّمْ يَذْهَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يَسْتَأْذِنُوهُ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَسْتَأْذِنُونَكَ أُولَـٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۚ فَإِذَا اسْتَأْذَنُوكَ لِبَعْضِ شَأْنِهِمْ فَأْذَن لِّمَن شِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ وَاسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمُ اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
translation_english: True Believers are those who sincerely believe in Allah and His Messenger and who do not leave him without permission when they are with the Messenger for some common good; only those who ask your permission sincerely believe in Allah and His Messenger. Therefore, when they ask your permission for a private business, you may give permission to whomever you like, and ask Allah's forgiveness for such people: Allah is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.

arabic: لَّا تَجْعَلُوا دُعَاءَ الرَّسُولِ بَيْنَكُمْ كَدُعَاءِ بَعْضِكُم بَعْضًا ۚ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ يَتَسَلَّلُونَ مِنكُمْ لِوَاذًا ۚ فَلْيَحْذَرِ الَّذِينَ يُخَالِفُونَ عَنْ أَمْرِهِ أَن تُصِيبَهُمْ فِتْنَةٌ أَوْ يُصِيبَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
translation_english: O Believers, do not consider the summoning by the Messenger like the summoning among you by one another. Allah knows well those of you who steal away, concealing themselves behind others. Let those who disobey the order of the Messenger beware lest they should be involved in some affliction, or are visited by a woeful scourge.

arabic: أَلَا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ مَا أَنتُمْ عَلَيْهِ وَيَوْمَ يُرْجَعُونَ إِلَيْهِ فَيُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوا ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
translation_english: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي نَزَّلَ الْفُرْقَانَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ لِيَكُونَ لِلْعَالَمِينَ نَذِيرًا
translation_english: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al-Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:

arabic: الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَلَمْ يَتَّخِذْ وَلَدًا وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ شَرِيكٌ فِي الْمُلْكِ وَخَلَقَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ فَقَدَّرَهُ تَقْدِيرًا
translation_english: He to Whom belongs the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth: Who has begotten no son: Who has no partner in His Sovereignty: Who created each and every thing and then ordained its destiny.

arabic: وَاتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِهِ آلِهَةً لَّا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْئًا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ لِأَنفُسِهِمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ مَوْتًا وَلَا حَيَاةً وَلَا نُشُورًا
translation_english: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.

arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا إِفْكٌ افْتَرَاهُ وَأَعَانَهُ عَلَيْهِ قَوْمٌ آخَرُونَ ۖ فَقَدْ جَاءُوا ظُلْمًا وَزُورًا
translation_english: Those who have rejected the Message of the Prophet, say, "This (Al-Furgan) is a forgery which this man himself has devised, and some others have helped him at it. " What a cruel injustice and an impudent lie!

arabic: وَقَالُوا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ اكْتَتَبَهَا فَهِيَ تُمْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
translation_english: They say, "These things are the writings of the ancients which he has got copied down for himself, and then these are recited to him in the morning and evening.''

arabic: قُلْ أَنزَلَهُ الَّذِي يَعْلَمُ السِّرَّ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفُورًا رَّحِيمًا
translation_english: O Muhammad, say to them, "This has been sent down by Him, Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth." The fact is that He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

arabic: وَقَالُوا مَالِ هَـٰذَا الرَّسُولِ يَأْكُلُ الطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشِي فِي الْأَسْوَاقِ ۙ لَوْلَا أُنزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ فَيَكُونَ مَعَهُ نَذِيرًا
translation_english: They say, "What sort of a Messenger is he that he eats food and moves about in the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to accompany him and threaten (the disbelievers)?

arabic: أَوْ يُلْقَىٰ إِلَيْهِ كَنزٌ أَوْ تَكُونُ لَهُ جَنَّةٌ يَأْكُلُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَقَالَ الظَّالِمُونَ إِن تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا رَجُلًا مَّسْحُورًا
translation_english: Or why has not at least a treasure been sent down for him or a garden given to him for (easy) sustenance?" And the wicked people say, "You are following a man bewitched."

arabic: انظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا لَكَ الْأَمْثَالَ فَضَلُّوا فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًا
translation_english: Just see what strange arguments they bring forward with regard to you! They have gone so far astray that they cannot charge any thing against you.

arabic: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي إِن شَاءَ جَعَلَ لَكَ خَيْرًا مِّن ذَٰلِكَ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ وَيَجْعَل لَّكَ قُصُورًا
translation_english: Highly blessed is He, Who, if He wills, could give you much more and better things than what they propose for you: (Not one but) many gardens, beneath which rivers flow; and big castles:

arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالسَّاعَةِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِمَن كَذَّبَ بِالسَّاعَةِ سَعِيرًا
translation_english: The fact of the matter is that these people have denied "the Hour", --And for the one who denies the coming of the Hour, We have prepared a blazing Fire.

arabic: إِذَا رَأَتْهُم مِّن مَّكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ سَمِعُوا لَهَا تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفِيرًا
translation_english: When it will see them from afar, they will hear the sounds of its raging and roaring.

arabic: وَإِذَا أُلْقُوا مِنْهَا مَكَانًا ضَيِّقًا مُّقَرَّنِينَ دَعَوْا هُنَالِكَ ثُبُورًا
translation_english: And when they are chained together and flung into a narrow space therein, they will begin to call for death.

arabic: لَّا تَدْعُوا الْيَوْمَ ثُبُورًا وَاحِدًا وَادْعُوا ثُبُورًا كَثِيرًا
translation_english: (Then it will be said to them:) "Do not call for one death today, but call for many deaths."

arabic: قُلْ أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ أَمْ جَنَّةُ الْخُلْدِ الَّتِي وُعِدَ الْمُتَّقُونَ ۚ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَزَاءً وَمَصِيرًا
translation_english: Ask them "Is this (Fire) better or the everlasting Garden which has been promised to the God-fearing righteous people?" which will be the recompense of their good deeds and the final destination of their journey

arabic: لَّهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَاءُونَ خَالِدِينَ ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعْدًا مَّسْئُولًا
translation_english: wherein they will get everything they desire and wherein they will dwell for ever. This is a promise which your Lord has taken upon Himself to fulfil.

arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ فَيَقُولُ أَأَنتُمْ أَضْلَلْتُمْ عِبَادِي هَـٰؤُلَاءِ أَمْ هُمْ ضَلُّوا السَّبِيلَ
translation_english: And on that Day (your Lord will gather these people together as well as their deities, whom they worship besides AIlah. Then He will ask them, "Did you mislead these servants of Mine, or did they themselves go astray?"

arabic: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَكَ مَا كَانَ يَنبَغِي لَنَا أَن نَّتَّخِذَ مِن دُونِكَ مِنْ أَوْلِيَاءَ وَلَـٰكِن مَّتَّعْتَهُمْ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَسُوا الذِّكْرَ وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا بُورًا
translation_english: They will answer, "Glory be to Thee! We dared not take anyguardian besides Thee: (they were misled because) Thou didst give them and their forefathers all the good things of life till they forgot the Admonition, and incurred the punishment. "

arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوكُم بِمَا تَقُولُونَ فَمَا تَسْتَطِيعُونَ صَرْفًا وَلَا نَصْرًا ۚ وَمَن يَظْلِم مِّنكُمْ نُذِقْهُ عَذَابًا كَبِيرًا
translation_english: Thus will your gods deny alI that you are professing today. Then you shall neither be able to repel your punishment nor shall get any help from anywhere; and whoso is guilty. of iniquity'' among you, We shall make him taste a severe torment.

arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا إِنَّهُمْ لَيَأْكُلُونَ الطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشُونَ فِي الْأَسْوَاقِ ۗ وَجَعَلْنَا بَعْضَكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ فِتْنَةً أَتَصْبِرُونَ ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ بَصِيرًا
translation_english: O Muhammad,, all the Messengers whom We sent before you also ate food and moved about in the streets. In fact, We have made you all a means of test for one another. Will you show patience? for your Lord sees everything.

arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَاءَنَا لَوْلَا أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةُ أَوْ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَا ۗ لَقَدِ اسْتَكْبَرُوا فِي أَنفُسِهِمْ وَعَتَوْا عُتُوًّا كَبِيرًا
translation_english: Those people, who have no fear of coming before Us, say, "Why should not the angels be sent down to us? Or else we should see our Lord. " Great arrogance have they assumed in regard to themselves, and have transgressed all limits in their rebellion.

arabic: يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ لَا بُشْرَىٰ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجْرًا مَّحْجُورًا
translation_english: The Day, when they will see the angels, will not be a day of rejoicing for the criminals; they will cry out, "May Allah save us!"

arabic: وَقَدِمْنَا إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُوا مِنْ عَمَلٍ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ هَبَاءً مَّنثُورًا
translation_english: Then We shall turn to what they had done and render it vain like scattered dust.

arabic: أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَيْرٌ مُّسْتَقَرًّا وَأَحْسَنُ مَقِيلًا
translation_english: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.

arabic: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ السَّمَاءُ بِالْغَمَامِ وَنُزِّلَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ تَنزِيلًا
translation_english: On that Day, a cloud will appear rending the sky and the angels will be senthi down rank after rank.

arabic: الْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْحَقُّ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۚ وَكَانَ يَوْمًا عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ عَسِيرًا
translation_english: The real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the Merciful, and it will be a very hard Day for the disbelievers.

arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَعَضُّ الظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيْهِ يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي اتَّخَذْتُ مَعَ الرَّسُولِ سَبِيلًا
translation_english: The unjust man will bite at his hand and say, "Would that I had stood by the Messenger!

arabic: يَا وَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًا
translation_english: O, woe to me! Would that I had not chosen so and so for a friend!

arabic: لَّقَدْ أَضَلَّنِي عَنِ الذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَاءَنِي ۗ وَكَانَ الشَّيْطَانُ لِلْإِنسَانِ خَذُولًا
translation_english: For it was he, who had deluded me to reject the Admonition which had come to me. Satan has proved very treacherous to man. "

arabic: وَقَالَ الرَّسُولُ يَا رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي اتَّخَذُوا هَـٰذَا الْقُرْآنَ مَهْجُورًا
translation_english: And the Messenger will say, "O my Lord, my people had made this Qur'an the object of their ridicule."

arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِيٍّ عَدُوًّا مِّنَ الْمُجْرِمِينَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيًا وَنَصِيرًا
translation_english: O Muhammad, in this very way We have made the criminals the enemies of every Prophet, but your Lord suffices for you as your Guide and Helper.

arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ الْقُرْآنُ جُمْلَةً وَاحِدَةً ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِ فُؤَادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلْنَاهُ تَرْتِيلًا
translation_english: The disbelievers say, "Why has not the entire Qur'an been sent down to this man all at nce?" -Well, this has been done to impress it deeply on your mind, and (for the same object) We have sent it down piecemeal by degrees.

arabic: وَلَا يَأْتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ وَأَحْسَنَ تَفْسِيرًا
translation_english: And (there is another wisdom in this: whenever they brought to you an odd thing (or a strange question), We sent its right answer to you in time and explained it all in the best manner,

arabic: الَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُولَـٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
translation_english: those who are going to be driven to Hell upon their faces, have taken an utterly wrong stand and their way is most erroneous!

arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُ أَخَاهُ هَارُونَ وَزِيرًا
translation_english: We gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron as his counsellor:

arabic: فَقُلْنَا اذْهَبَا إِلَى الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا فَدَمَّرْنَاهُمْ تَدْمِيرًا
translation_english: then We said to them, "Go to the people who have treated Our Revelations as false. " So We annihilated those people utterly.

arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ لَّمَّا كَذَّبُوا الرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ آيَةً ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
translation_english: The same was the case with the people of Noah when they charged the Messenger with imposture: We drowned them and made them a sign of warning for entire mankind, and We have prepared a painful chastisement for the unjust.

arabic: وَعَادًا وَثَمُودَ وَأَصْحَابَ الرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًا
translation_english: Likewise were destroyed the `Ad and the Thamud and the people of the Rass, and many a generation in between.

arabic: وَكُلًّا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ الْأَمْثَالَ ۖ وَكُلًّا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًا
translation_english: We admonished each one of them by citing the examples (of those who were destroyed before them) and ultimately annihilated all of them.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا عَلَى الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ السَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًا
translation_english: Surely, these people have passed by that habitation on which was rained an evil rain: have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect another life in the Hereafter.

arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَـٰذَا الَّذِي بَعَثَ اللَّهُ رَسُولًا
translation_english: When these people see you, they scoff at you, (saying), "Is this the man whom Allah has sent as His Messenger?

arabic: إِن كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ آلِهَتِنَا لَوْلَا أَن صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ الْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
translation_english: He had almost led us astray from our gods, had we not remained firm in our faith with regard to them. " The time is not far when they will see the torment and realize who had strayed far from the truth.

arabic: أَرَأَيْتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلَـٰهَهُ هَوَاهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا
translation_english: Have you ever considered the case of the person who has made his lust his god? Can you take the responsibility of guiding such a one aright?

arabic: أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَالْأَنْعَامِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
translation_english: Do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are only like the cattle; nay, even worse than the cattle.

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ الظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَاءَ لَجَعَلَهُ سَاكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا الشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًا
translation_english: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? Had He willed, He would have made it constant, but We have made the sun its pilot;

arabic: ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَاهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًا يَسِيرًا
translation_english: then (as the sun climbs up), We roll it up little by little towards Ourselves.

arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا وَالنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًا وَجَعَلَ النَّهَارَ نُشُورًا
translation_english: And it is Allah Who has ordained the night as a garment for you, and the sleep as a repose of death, and the day as the time of return to life.

arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ الرِّيَاحَ بُشْرًا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً طَهُورًا
translation_english: And it is He, Who drives the winds to be the harbingers of His mercy: then He sends down pure water from the sky

arabic: لِّنُحْيِيَ بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا وَنُسْقِيَهُ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَا أَنْعَامًا وَأَنَاسِيَّ كَثِيرًا
translation_english: so that He may revive the dead land, and quench the thirst of many of His creatures from among beasts and men.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَاهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا فَأَبَىٰ أَكْثَرُ النَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًا
translation_english: We present the same phenomenon over and over again before them so that they may learn a lesson from it; but most people decline to adopt any other attitude than of disbelief and ingratitude.

arabic: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِي كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍ نَّذِيرًا
translation_english: Had We willed, We would have raised up a separate Warner in each habitation.

arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ الْكَافِرِينَ وَجَاهِدْهُم بِهِ جِهَادًا كَبِيرًا
translation_english: So, O Prophet, do not yield to the disbelievers, but wage a Jihad against them with this Qur'an.

arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ هَـٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ وَهَـٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًا وَحِجْرًا مَّحْجُورًا
translation_english: And it is He, Who has let loose the two seas, one palatable and sweet, the other bitter and saltish, and there is a partition between them, which is an insurmountable barrier.

arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُ نَسَبًا وَصِهْرًا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًا
translation_english: And it is He, Who created man from water: then from him He caused two kinds of kindred, by blood and by marriage: your Lord is AI I-Powerful.

arabic: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ الْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِ ظَهِيرًا
translation_english: Yet they worship, instead of Allah, those who can neither benefit them nor harm them: more than this, the disbeliever has become a helper of every rebel against his Lord.

arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا
translation_english: O Muhammad, We have sent you only to proclaim good tidings and to give warning.

arabic: قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَن شَاءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
translation_english: Tell them, "I do not ask of you any recompense for this work: I only ask of the one, who will, to adopt the way of his Lord.

arabic: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْحَيِّ الَّذِي لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِ خَبِيرًا
translation_english: O Muhammad trust in that Allah Who is Ever-Living and will never die' Glorify Him with His praise, for He alone is sufficient to be aware of the sins of His servants.

arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ الرَّحْمَـٰنُ فَاسْأَلْ بِهِ خَبِيرًا
translation_english: In six days He created the earth and the heavens and all that is between them; then He established Himself on the "Throne" (of the Kingdom of the uriverse). (He is) the Merciful: as to His Glory, ask the one who knows.

arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اسْجُدُوا لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ قَالُوا وَمَا الرَّحْمَـٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًا ۩
translation_english: When it is said to them. "Prostrate yourselves before the Merciful," they retort, "What is the Merciful? Would you have us prostrate ourselves before whomsoever you will?" And this invitation only helps to increase their hatred all the more.

arabic: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَاجًا وَقَمَرًا مُّنِيرًا
translation_english: Highly blessed is He, Who has made fortified spheres in the heavens and has set in it a "lamp" and a shining moon.

arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةً لِّمَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًا
translation_english: He it is Who caused the night and the day to succeed each other so that everyone who desires may learn a lesson or become grateful.

arabic: وَعِبَادُ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجَاهِلُونَ قَالُوا سَلَامًا
translation_english: The (true) servants of the Merciful are those who walk humbly on the earth who, when the ignorant people behave insolently towards them, say, "Peace to you"

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَقِيَامًا
translation_english: who pass their nights in prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord:

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا
translation_english: who pray, "Our Lord, save us from the torment of Hell, for its torment is killing:

arabic: إِنَّهَا سَاءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
translation_english: it is an evil abode and an evil resting place":

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا أَنفَقُوا لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًا
translation_english: who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor miserly but keep the golden mean between the two (extremes):

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا آخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًا
translation_english: who do not invoke any god but Allah nor kill a soul, which Allah has forbidden, unjustly, nor commit adultery. -He who does this shall be punished for his sin,

arabic: يُضَاعَفْ لَهُ الْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِ مُهَانًا
translation_english: and his torment shall be doubled on the Day of Resurrection, and he shall abide in a state of ignominy,

arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا فَأُولَـٰئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ اللَّهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ حَسَنَاتٍ ۗ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَّحِيمًا
translation_english: except the one who may have repented (after those sins) and have believed and done righteous works, for then Allah will change his evil deeds into good deeds, and He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

arabic: وَمَن تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَإِنَّهُ يَتُوبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَتَابًا
translation_english: In fact, the one who repents and does righteous deeds, returns to Allah as one ightly should. -

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ الزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِاللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا كِرَامًا
translation_english: (And the servants of the Merciful are those:) who do not bear witness to falsehood and who; if they have ever to pass by what is vain, pass by like dignified people:

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا عَلَيْهَا صُمًّا وَعُمْيَانًا
translation_english: who do not behave like the blind and the deaf, when the Revelations of their Lord are recited to them for admonition;

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
translation_english: who pray, "Our Lord, bless us with wives and children, who may be the comfort of our eyes, and make us leaders of the righteous. " -

arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ الْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلَامًا
translation_english: Such are the people who will be rewarded with high palaces for their fortitude,, wherein they will be welcomed with due respect, honour and salutations

arabic: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
translation_english: and wherein they will live for ever: what an excellent abode and what an excellent resting place!

arabic: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَأُ بِكُمْ رَبِّي لَوْلَا دُعَاؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًا
translation_english: O Muhammad, tell the people, "MyLord does not care at all if you do not invoke Him. Now that you have denied (His Revelation), you will soon be awarded such a punishment which you will never be able to avoid."

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ طسم
translation_english: Ta'. Sin. Mim.

arabic: تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ
translation_english: These are the verses of the Clear Book.

arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: (O Muhammad), you will perhaps grieve yourself to death because these people do not believe.

arabic: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ آيَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَاقُهُمْ لَهَا خَاضِعِينَ
translation_english: If We will, We can send down a Sign to them from heaven, so their necks will be humbled to it.

arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
translation_english: Never does there come to them an admonition from the Merciful Lord but they turn away from it.

arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنبَاءُ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
translation_english: They will soon come to know the truth of that which they have been scoffing at.

arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
translation_english: Do they not look at the earth, how We caused a variety of fine vegetation to grow from it (in abundance)?

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Verily Your Lord is Infinitely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ائْتِ الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
translation_english: (Recount to them about the time) when Your Lord called Moses: "Go to the wrong-doing people,

arabic: قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ
translation_english: the people of Pharaoh: do they have no fear?"

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
translation_english: He said: "My Lord! I fear that they will brand me a liar.

arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَارُونَ
translation_english: My breast is constricted and my tongue is not fluent, so endow Messengership on Aaron.

arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَيَّ ذَنبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
translation_english: As for me, they hold the charge of a crime against me. I fear they will put me to death."

arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَاذْهَبَا بِآيَاتِنَا ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
translation_english: He said: "Certainly not! So go both of you with Our Signs. We shall be with you listening to everything.

arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: Go, then, to Pharaoh and say to him: 'The Lord of the Universe has sent us

arabic: أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
translation_english: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.'"

arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
translation_english: Pharaoh said: "Did we not bring you up among us when you were a child?

arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ الَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
translation_english: You spent many years of your life among us and then you committed that deed of yours. You are very ungrateful indeed."

arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَا إِذًا وَأَنَا مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
translation_english: Moses replied: "I committed that act erringly.

arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: Then I fled for fear of you. Then my Lord bestowed wisdom and authority on me and made me one of the Messengers.

arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
translation_english: Now this is the favour that you tauntingly remind me of: that you enslaved the Children of Israel!"

arabic: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: Pharaoh said: "And who is this Lord of the Universe?"

arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
translation_english: Moses answered: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, if you were only to believe."

arabic: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ
translation_english: Pharaoh said to those around him: "Do you hear (what he says)?"

arabic: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: Moses said: "(He is) Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of yore."

arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
translation_english: Pharaoh said to the audience: "This Messenger of yours who has been sent to you is simply mad."

arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
translation_english: Moses continued: "(He is) the Lord of the east and the west, and all between them. If you only had any understanding!"

arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ
translation_english: Pharaoh said: "If you take any god other than me, I will certainly make you one of those (who are rotting) in prison."

arabic: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَيْءٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: Moses said: "Even if I were to bring a Clear Sign to you?"

arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
translation_english: Pharaoh said: "Then bring it if you are truthful at all."

arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: (No sooner had he said this than) Moses threw down his rod and behold, it was a veritable serpent,

arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
translation_english: and he drew his hand (out of his armpit) and lo! it had become a shining object to the beholders.

arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
translation_english: Pharaoh said to the nobles around him: "Surely this man is a skilled magician

arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
translation_english: who wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. Tell us, what do you advise us?"

arabic: قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَابْعَثْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
translation_english: They said: "Detain him and his brother for a while and send forth heralds to the cities

arabic: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍ
translation_english: to mobilise all skilled magicians."

arabic: فَجُمِعَ السَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
translation_english: So the magicians were brought together on a particular day at a set time

arabic: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّجْتَمِعُونَ
translation_english: and the people were told: "Will you join the assembly?

arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ
translation_english: We may perhaps follow the religion of the magicians if they triumph."

arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ
translation_english: When the magicians came forth (for the encounter) they said to Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we triumph?"

arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ
translation_english: He said: "Yes, you will then become those near-stationed to me."

arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
translation_english: Moses said to them: "Throw down whatever you wish to throw."

arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْغَالِبُونَ
translation_english: Thereupon they threw down their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall prevail."

arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
translation_english: Thereafter, Moses threw down his rod and behold, it went about swallowing up all the false devices they had contrived.

arabic: فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سَاجِدِينَ
translation_english: Thereupon the magicians fell down in prostration,

arabic: قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: saying: "We (now) believe in the Lord of the Universe,

arabic: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
translation_english: the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

arabic: قَالَ آمَنتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
translation_english: Pharaoh said: "You accepted the word of Moses even before I granted you the leave to do so. Surely he is your chief who has taught you magic. Soon shall you come to know. I shall cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and shall crucify all of you."

arabic: قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
translation_english: They said: "We do not care, for we are bound to return to our Lord,

arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَن كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: and we surely expect that Our Lord will forgive us our sins for we are the first ones to believe."

arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
translation_english: We revealed to Moses: "Set forth with My servants by night for you will be pursued."

arabic: فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
translation_english: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities (to mobilise troops)

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌ قَلِيلُونَ
translation_english: saying: "These (Israelites) are only a small band of people

arabic: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَائِظُونَ
translation_english: who have certainly provoked our wrath.

arabic: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَاذِرُونَ
translation_english: But we are a numerous host, ever on guard."

arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَاهُم مِّن جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
translation_english: Thus did We drive them out of their gardens and springs

arabic: وَكُنُوزٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ
translation_english: and their treasures and excellent dwellings.

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
translation_english: This happened with them; (but on the other hand), We enabled the Children of Israel to inherit those bounties.

arabic: فَأَتْبَعُوهُم مُّشْرِقِينَ
translation_english: At sunrise they set off in pursuit of them

arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى الْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
translation_english: and when the groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out: "We are overtaken!"

arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
translation_english: Moses said: "Certainly not. My Lord is with me; He will direct me."

arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ اضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ الْبَحْرَ ۖ فَانفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ
translation_english: Then We revealed to Moses, (commanding him): "Strike the sea with your rod." Thereupon the sea split up, and then each became like the mass of a huge mount.

arabic: وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ الْآخَرِينَ
translation_english: We also brought the other party close to the same spot,

arabic: وَأَنجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
translation_english: and We delivered Moses and his companions, all of them,

arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
translation_english: then We drowned the others.

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

arabic: وَاتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
translation_english: And recount to them the story of Abraham:

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
translation_english: when he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

arabic: قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ
translation_english: They answered: "There are some idols that we worship and are devoted to them with constancy."

arabic: قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ
translation_english: He asked: "Do they hear you when you call them

arabic: أَوْ يَنفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ
translation_english: or do they cause you any benefit or harm?"

arabic: قَالُوا بَلْ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
translation_english: They answered: "No; but we found our forefathers doing so."

arabic: قَالَ أَفَرَأَيْتُم مَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
translation_english: Thereupon, Abraham said: "Have you seen (with your eyes) those whom you have been worshipping,

arabic: أَنتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمُ الْأَقْدَمُونَ
translation_english: you and your forefathers of yore?

arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّي إِلَّا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: They are all enemies to me; all, except the Lord of the Universe

arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَنِي فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ
translation_english: Who created me and Who guides me;

arabic: وَالَّذِي هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِي وَيَسْقِينِ
translation_english: Who gives me food and drink,

arabic: وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ
translation_english: and Who, when I am ill, heals me;

arabic: وَالَّذِي يُمِيتُنِي ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ
translation_english: Who will cause me to die and then will again restore me to life;

arabic: وَالَّذِي أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ الدِّينِ
translation_english: Who, I hope, will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgement."

arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ
translation_english: (And then Abraham prayed): "My Lord, endow me with knowledge and wisdom and join me with the righteous,

arabic: وَاجْعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: and grant me an honourable reputation among posterity,

arabic: وَاجْعَلْنِي مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعِيمِ
translation_english: and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss,

arabic: وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
translation_english: and forgive my father for he is among those who strayed,

arabic: وَلَا تُخْزِنِي يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ
translation_english: and disgrace me not on the Day when people will be raised to life,

arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
translation_english: the Day when nothing will avail, neither wealth nor offspring,

arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
translation_english: but only he that brings to Allah a sound heart will (attain to success)."

arabic: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
translation_english: (On that Day) the Garden will be brought near to the God-fearing,

arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ
translation_english: and the Fire will be uncovered for those who strayed,

arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
translation_english: and they will be asked: "Where are the gods that you worshipped

arabic: مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
translation_english: beside Allah? Can they be of any help to you, or even be of any help to themselves?"

arabic: فَكُبْكِبُوا فِيهَا هُمْ وَالْغَاوُونَ
translation_english: Then the idols and those who strayed will be hurled into the Fire headlong, one upon another,

arabic: وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ
translation_english: and so too the hosts of Iblis, all of them.

arabic: قَالُوا وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ
translation_english: There they will quarrel with one another and the erring ones will say (to their deities):

arabic: تَاللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: "By Allah, we were surely in clear error

arabic: إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُم بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: when we assigned to you a position equal to that of the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: وَمَا أَضَلَّنَا إِلَّا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
translation_english: It is none but those steeped in guilt who led us into this error,

arabic: فَمَا لَنَا مِن شَافِعِينَ
translation_english: and now we have none to intercede on our behalf,

arabic: وَلَا صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٍ
translation_english: nor do we have a truly sincere friend.

arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: If only we could return we would be among the believers."

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: The people of Noah gave the lie to the Messengers.

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation_english: Recall when their brother Noah said to them: "Do you have no fear?

arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
translation_english: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you;

arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: so fear Allah and obey me.

arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: I seek of you no reward for this: my reward is with none except the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: So fear Allah and obey me."

arabic: قَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَاتَّبَعَكَ الْأَرْذَلُونَ
translation_english: They answered: "Shall we accept you even though it is the meanest of people who follow you?"

arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: Noah said: "What knowledge do I have about their deeds?

arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
translation_english: It is only for my Lord to take account of them. Would that you made use of your understanding!

arabic: وَمَا أَنَا بِطَارِدِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: It is not for me to repel those who choose to believe.

arabic: إِنْ أَنَا إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: I am none but a plain warner."

arabic: قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ
translation_english: They said: "O Noah! If you do not desist, you will certainly become one of the accursed."

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي كَذَّبُونِ
translation_english: He said: "My Lord! My people have branded me a liar.

arabic: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: So pass a clear judgement between me and them and rescue me and the believers with me."

arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
translation_english: Thereafter We rescued him and those who were with him in the laden Ark

arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ الْبَاقِينَ
translation_english: and drowned the rest.

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: The Ad gave the lie to the Messengers.

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation_english: Recall, when their brother Hud said to them: "Have you no fear?

arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
translation_english: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: So fear Allah and obey me.

arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ آيَةً تَعْبَثُونَ
translation_english: What, you build a monument on every hill merely for fun

arabic: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ
translation_english: and erect huge palaces as though you will live for ever,

arabic: وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُم بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ
translation_english: and when you strike you strike like tyrants?

arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: So fear Allah and obey me.

arabic: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي أَمَدَّكُم بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: Have fear of Him Who has provided you with all the (good) things you know;

arabic: أَمَدَّكُم بِأَنْعَامٍ وَبَنِينَ
translation_english: Who has provided you with flocks and children

arabic: وَجَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
translation_english: and with gardens and springs.

arabic: إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
translation_english: I fear for you the chastisement of an Awesome Day."

arabic: قَالُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ الْوَاعِظِينَ
translation_english: They replied: "It is all the same for us whether you admonish us or not.

arabic: إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا خُلُقُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: This has been happening all along.

arabic: وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
translation_english: We will not be subjected to any chastisement."

arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Eventually they gave the lie to him and We destroyed them. Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: The Thamud gave the lie to the Messengers.

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation_english: Recall when their brother Salih said to them: "Have you no fear?"

arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
translation_english: "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: So fear Allah and obey me.

arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: I ask of you no reward. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِي مَا هَاهُنَا آمِنِينَ
translation_english: Do you believe that you will be left here to live securely in the present state

arabic: فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
translation_english: amidst gardens and springs

arabic: وَزُرُوعٍ وَنَخْلٍ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌ
translation_english: and cornfields and date-palms laden with juicy fruits?

arabic: وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا فَارِهِينَ
translation_english: You hew dwellings in mountains and exult in that.

arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: Fear Allah and obey me

arabic: وَلَا تُطِيعُوا أَمْرَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ
translation_english: and do not follow the biddings of those that go to excesses

arabic: الَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
translation_english: and spread mischief in the land rather than set things right."

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ
translation_english: They replied: "You are nothing but one of those who are bewitched;

arabic: مَا أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
translation_english: you are no different from a mortal like us. So produce a sign if you are truthful."

arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
translation_english: Salih said: "This is a she-camel. There is a day set for her to drink and there is a day set for you to drink.

arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
translation_english: Do not molest her lest the chastisement of an Awesome Day should seize you."

arabic: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُوا نَادِمِينَ
translation_english: But they hamstrung her and then regretted it.

arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: So the chastisement seized them. Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: The people of Lot rejected the Messengers, branding them liars.

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation_english: Recall, when their brother Lot said to them: "Have you no fear?

arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
translation_english: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: So fear Allah and obey me.

arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: I seek of you no reward. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: أَتَأْتُونَ الذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: What, of all creation will you go to (fornicate with) the males,

arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَاجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
translation_english: leaving aside those whom Allah has created for you as your mates. Nay, you are a people that has transgressed all limits."

arabic: قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا لُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُخْرَجِينَ
translation_english: They said: "O Lot! If you do not desist, you will be one of those expelled (from our towns)."

arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُم مِّنَ الْقَالِينَ
translation_english: He said: "I am one of those who abhor your practice.

arabic: رَبِّ نَجِّنِي وَأَهْلِي مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: My Lord, deliver me and my family from their wicked deeds."

arabic: فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
translation_english: Then We delivered him and all his family

arabic: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ
translation_english: except an old woman who was among those that stayed behind.

arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
translation_english: Thereafter, We utterly destroyed the rest,

arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
translation_english: and We sent upon them a rain, an evil rain that fell on those who had been warned.

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

arabic: كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: The people of Aykah also gave the lie to the Messengers.

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation_english: Recall, when Shuayb said to them: "Have you no fear?

arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
translation_english: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

arabic: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: So fear Allah and obey me.

arabic: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: I ask of you no reward for this. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ
translation_english: Fill up the measure and do not diminish the goods of people,

arabic: وَزِنُوا بِالْقِسْطَاسِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ
translation_english: weigh with an even balance

arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
translation_english: and do not deliver short, and do not go about creating mischief in the land,

arabic: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ وَالْجِبِلَّةَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: and have fear of Him Who created you and the earlier generations."

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ
translation_english: They said: "You are no more than one of those who have been bewitched,

arabic: وَمَا أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
translation_english: you are only a mortal like us. Indeed we believe that you are an utter liar.

arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
translation_english: So cause a piece of the sky to fall upon us if you are truthful."

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: Shuayb said: "My Lord knows well all what you do."

arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
translation_english: Then they branded him a liar, whereupon the chastisement of the Day of Canopy overtook them. It was the chastisement of a very awesome day.

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَنزِيلُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: Indeed this is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe;

arabic: نَزَلَ بِهِ الرُّوحُ الْأَمِينُ
translation_english: which the truthful spirit has carried down

arabic: عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُنذِرِينَ
translation_english: to your heart that you might become one of those who warn (others on behalf of Allah),

arabic: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِيٍّ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: (a revelation) in clear Arabic language,

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَفِي زُبُرِ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: (a revelation embodied) in the scriptures of the ancients.

arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ آيَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
translation_english: Is it not a Sign to them - (to wit, the Makkans) - that the learned men of the Children of Israel know that?

arabic: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ الْأَعْجَمِينَ
translation_english: (But such is their adamance) that had We revealed it to one of the non-Arabs and even if he had recited (this clear Arabic discourse) to them

arabic: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: they would still not have believed in it.

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ سَلَكْنَاهُ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
translation_english: Thus have We caused this (Admonition) to penetrate the hearts of the culprits (like a hot rod).

arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
translation_english: They will not believe in it until they clearly see the grievous chastisement.

arabic: فَيَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
translation_english: But when it comes upon them suddenly, taking them unawares,

arabic: فَيَقُولُوا هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنظَرُونَ
translation_english: they say: "Can we be granted some respite?"

arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
translation_english: Do they really want Our chastisement to be expedited?

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتَ إِن مَّتَّعْنَاهُمْ سِنِينَ
translation_english: Did you consider that if We were to let them enjoy life for many years

arabic: ثُمَّ جَاءَهُم مَّا كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ
translation_english: and then the chastisement of which they were being warned were to come upon them,

arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ
translation_english: of what avail will be the provisions of life which they have been granted to enjoy?

arabic: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
translation_english: We never destroyed any habitation but that it had warners

arabic: ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
translation_english: to admonish them. We have never been unjust.

arabic: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ الشَّيَاطِينُ
translation_english: The satans did not bring down this (Clear Book),

arabic: وَمَا يَنبَغِي لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
translation_english: nor does it behove them, nor does it lie in their power.

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ
translation_english: Indeed they are debarred from even hearing it.

arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ
translation_english: So do not call any other god beside Allah lest you become of those who will be punished,

arabic: وَأَنذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ الْأَقْرَبِينَ
translation_english: and warn your nearest kinsmen;

arabic: وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: and be meek to the believers who follow you.

arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: Then if they disobey you say to them: "I am quit of what you do."

arabic: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْعَزِيزِ الرَّحِيمِ
translation_english: And put your trust in Him Who is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate,

arabic: الَّذِي يَرَاكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
translation_english: Who observes you when you rise (to pray)

arabic: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِي السَّاجِدِينَ
translation_english: and observes your movements among those who prostrate themselves.

arabic: إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
translation_english: He is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيَاطِينُ
translation_english: O people, shall I tell you on whom it is that satans descend?

arabic: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍ
translation_english: They descend on every forgerer steeped in sin,

arabic: يُلْقُونَ السَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَاذِبُونَ
translation_english: on those who whisper hearsay in the ears of people; and most of them are liars.

arabic: وَالشُّعَرَاءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ الْغَاوُونَ
translation_english: As for poets, only the wayward follow them.

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
translation_english: Do you not see that they wander about in every valley

arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفْعَلُونَ
translation_english: and say things which they do not act upon,

arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَانتَصَرُوا مِن بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
translation_english: except those who believed and acted righteously and remembered Allah much, and when they themselves were subjected to wrong, they exacted retribution no more than to the extent of the wrong? Soon will the wrong-doers know the end that they shall reach.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ طس ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْقُرْآنِ وَكِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: Ta'. Sin. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a Clear Book;

arabic: هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: a guidance and good tidings for the believers

arabic: الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَهُم بِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
translation_english: who establish Prayer and give Zakah, and have firm faith in the Hereafter.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
translation_english: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem attractive to them so they stumble around in perplexity.

arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوءُ الْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ هُمُ الْأَخْسَرُونَ
translation_english: It is they for whom a grievous chastisement lies in store; it is they who shall be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.

arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى الْقُرْآنَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
translation_english: As for you, (O Muhammad), you are receiving the Qur'an from the Most Wise, the All-Knowing.

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِ إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا سَآتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ آتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
translation_english: (Recount to them) when Moses said to his family: "I perceive something like fire: soon will I bring to you some information from there, or I will bring you a burning brand that you may warm yourselves."

arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهَا نُودِيَ أَن بُورِكَ مَن فِي النَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: But when Moses came to the fire, a call was sounded: "Blessed is He Who is in the fire and whatever is around it. Glory be to Allah, the Sustainer of all in the Universe.

arabic: يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّهُ أَنَا اللَّهُ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
translation_english: O Moses, verily this is Me, Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise!

arabic: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَآهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَانٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَا مُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّي لَا يَخَافُ لَدَيَّ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
translation_english: Now cast your rod!" But when he saw the rod writhing as though it were a serpent, he turned his back in retreat and did not even look behind. "O Moses, have no fear. Messengers have no fear in My presence,

arabic: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًا بَعْدَ سُوءٍ فَإِنِّي غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
translation_english: except he who has committed some wrong. But if he substitutes good in place of evil, I am Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

arabic: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِي جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ ۖ فِي تِسْعِ آيَاتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
translation_english: Now put your hand into your bosom, and it will come forth shining without any blemish. (These are two of the) nine Signs to be carried to Pharaoh and his people. They are surely a wicked people."

arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَتْهُمْ آيَاتُنَا مُبْصِرَةً قَالُوا هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: But when Our Clear Signs came to them, they said: "This is plain magic."

arabic: وَجَحَدُوا بِهَا وَاسْتَيْقَنَتْهَا أَنفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًا وَعُلُوًّا ۚ فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
translation_english: They denied those Signs out of iniquity and arrogance although their hearts were convinced of their truth. So see how evil was the end of those mischief-makers!

arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا دَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ عِلْمًا ۖ وَقَالَا الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍ مِّنْ عِبَادِهِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: (On the other hand), We granted knowledge to David and Solomon and they said: "All praise be to Allah Who has exalted us above many of His believing servants!"

arabic: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَانُ دَاوُودَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنطِقَ الطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَضْلُ الْمُبِينُ
translation_english: And Solomon succeeded David and said: "O people, we have been taught the speech of birds and we have been endowed with all kinds of things. Surely this is a conspicuous favour (from Allah)."

arabic: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَانَ جُنُودُهُ مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنسِ وَالطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
translation_english: Hosts of jinn and humans and birds were marshalled for Solomon and were kept under full control.

arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَتَوْا عَلَىٰ وَادِ النَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّمْلُ ادْخُلُوا مَسَاكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَانُ وَجُنُودُهُ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
translation_english: (Solomon was once on the move with them) until when they reached a valley of ants one of the ants said: "O ants, get into your holes, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you (under their feet) without even knowing."

arabic: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًا مِّن قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
translation_english: Smiling at the ant's utterance, Solomon burst into laughter and said: "My Lord! Hold me under (Your) control that I may render thanks for the favour which You have bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may act righteously in a manner that would please You. Include me, out of Your Mercy, among Your righteous servants."

arabic: وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِيَ لَا أَرَى الْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ الْغَائِبِينَ
translation_english: (On another occasion) Solomon inspected the birds and said: "Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Is he among the absentees?

arabic: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَذْبَحَنَّهُ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّي بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: I will inflict a severe punishment on him or maybe even slaughter him unless he comes forth with a convincing reason (for his absence)."

arabic: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ وَجِئْتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ
translation_english: Not before long the hoopoe came up and said: "I have obtained a knowledge which you could not. I have brought for you sure news about Sheba.

arabic: إِنِّي وَجَدتُّ امْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ
translation_english: I found there a woman ruling over them, one who has been endowed with all things and has a mighty throne.

arabic: وَجَدتُّهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
translation_english: I found that she and her people prostrate themselves before the sun rather than Allah. " Satan has made their deeds appear attractive to them and has, thus, debarred them from the Right Path so they do not find true guidance

arabic: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ الَّذِي يُخْرِجُ الْخَبْءَ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
translation_english: that they would prostrate themselves before Allah Who brings to light all that is hidden in the heavens and the earth and knows all that you conceal and all that you reveal.

arabic: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ ۩
translation_english: Allah - none is worthy of worship save He; He is the Lord of the Mighty Throne.

arabic: قَالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
translation_english: Solomon said: "Soon shall we see whether you have spoken the truth or are one of those that lie.

arabic: اذْهَب بِّكِتَابِي هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَانظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ
translation_english: Take this letter of mine, deliver it to them, and then draw back from them, and observe what they do."

arabic: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ إِنِّي أُلْقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتَابٌ كَرِيمٌ
translation_english: The Queen said:" Know my nobles that a gracious letter has been delivered to me.

arabic: إِنَّهُ مِن سُلَيْمَانَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
translation_english: It is from Solomon, and it is: "In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate."

arabic: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا عَلَيَّ وَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
translation_english: (It says): "Do not act towards me with defiance, but come to me in submission."

arabic: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَفْتُونِي فِي أَمْرِي مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ
translation_english: (After reading the letter) the Queen said: "Nobles, let me have your counsel in this matter for I make no firm decision without you."

arabic: قَالُوا نَحْنُ أُولُو قُوَّةٍ وَأُولُو بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ وَالْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَانظُرِي مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ
translation_english: They said: "We are strong and are given to vehement fighting. But the decision is yours. Therefore, consider what you would like to command."

arabic: قَالَتْ إِنَّ الْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوا أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَا أَذِلَّةً ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
translation_english: The Queen said: "When the kings enter a country they cause corruption in it and abase those of its people who are held in honour. This is what they are wont to do.

arabic: وَإِنِّي مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
translation_english: I will send them a gift and then see with what answer my envoys return."

arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ سُلَيْمَانَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍ فَمَا آتَانِيَ اللَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّا آتَاكُم بَلْ أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
translation_english: Now, when (the envoy of the Queen) came to Solomon, he said: "Do you want to aid me with wealth? Whatever Allah has granted me is much more than what He has given you. (Keep for yourselves) your gift in which you are exulting.

arabic: ارْجِعْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٍ لَّا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِهَا وَلَنُخْرِجَنَّهُم مِّنْهَا أَذِلَّةً وَهُمْ صَاغِرُونَ
translation_english: Envoy, go back to those who sent you and we shall certainly come upon them with hosts whom they will be unable to resist. We shall drive them out from there, and they will suffer humiliation and disgrace."

arabic: قَالَ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَيُّكُمْ يَأْتِينِي بِعَرْشِهَا قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
translation_english: Solomon said: "My nobles, which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"

arabic: قَالَ عِفْرِيتٌ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ أَنَا آتِيكَ بِهِ قَبْلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَ ۖ وَإِنِّي عَلَيْهِ لَقَوِيٌّ أَمِينٌ
