arabic: مَن كَانَ يُرِيدُ الْعِزَّةَ فَلِلَّهِ الْعِزَّةُ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِلَيْهِ يَصْعَدُ الْكَلِمُ الطَّيِّبُ وَالْعَمَلُ الصَّالِحُ يَرْفَعُهُ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ يَمْكُرُونَ السَّيِّئَاتِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ ۖ وَمَكْرُ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُوَ يَبُورُ
translation_english: He who seeks glory, let him know that all glory belongs to Allah alone. To Him do good words go up, and righteous action uplifts them. But those who contrive evil deeds, a severe punishment lies in store for them, and their contriving will come to naught.

arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُم مِّن تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَكُمْ أَزْوَاجًا ۚ وَمَا تَحْمِلُ مِنْ أُنثَىٰ وَلَا تَضَعُ إِلَّا بِعِلْمِهِ ۚ وَمَا يُعَمَّرُ مِن مُّعَمَّرٍ وَلَا يُنقَصُ مِنْ عُمُرِهِ إِلَّا فِي كِتَابٍ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ
translation_english: Allah created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm, then He made you into pairs. No female conceives, nor delivers (a child) except with His knowledge. None is given a long life nor is any diminished in his life but it is written in a Book. Surely that is quite easy for Allah.

arabic: وَمَا يَسْتَوِي الْبَحْرَانِ هَـٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ سَائِغٌ شَرَابُهُ وَهَـٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ ۖ وَمِن كُلٍّ تَأْكُلُونَ لَحْمًا طَرِيًّا وَتَسْتَخْرِجُونَ حِلْيَةً تَلْبَسُونَهَا ۖ وَتَرَى الْفُلْكَ فِيهِ مَوَاخِرَ لِتَبْتَغُوا مِن فَضْلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
translation_english: The two masses of water are not alike. The one is sweet, sates thirst, and is pleasant to drink from, while the other is salt, bitter on the tongue. Yet from both you eat fresh meat, and extract from it ornaments that you wear; and you see ships cruising through it that you may seek of His Bounty and be thankful to Him.

arabic: يُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي لِأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ مَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِن قِطْمِيرٍ
translation_english: He causes the night to phase into the day and the day into the night, and He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running its course to an appointed term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs the Kingdom; but those whom you call upon, apart from Allah, possess not so much as the skin of a date-stone.

arabic: إِن تَدْعُوهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُوا دُعَاءَكُمْ وَلَوْ سَمِعُوا مَا اسْتَجَابُوا لَكُمْ ۖ وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ يَكْفُرُونَ بِشِرْكِكُمْ ۚ وَلَا يُنَبِّئُكَ مِثْلُ خَبِيرٍ
translation_english: If you call upon them, they cannot hear your prayer. And if they hear it, they cannot answer it. On the Day of Resurrection they will disown you for associating others with Allah in His Divinity. No one can inform you of the truth save the All-Aware.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ أَنتُمُ الْفُقَرَاءُ إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ وَاللَّهُ هُوَ الْغَنِيُّ الْحَمِيدُ
translation_english: O people, it is you who stand in need of Allah; as for Allah, He is Self-Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.

arabic: إِن يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْكُمْ وَيَأْتِ بِخَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
translation_english: If He wishes, He can remove you and put in your place a new creation.

arabic: وَمَا ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ بِعَزِيزٍ
translation_english: That surely is not difficult for Allah.

arabic: وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۚ وَإِن تَدْعُ مُثْقَلَةٌ إِلَىٰ حِمْلِهَا لَا يُحْمَلْ مِنْهُ شَيْءٌ وَلَوْ كَانَ ذَا قُرْبَىٰ ۗ إِنَّمَا تُنذِرُ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِالْغَيْبِ وَأَقَامُوا الصَّلَاةَ ۚ وَمَن تَزَكَّىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَتَزَكَّىٰ لِنَفْسِهِ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ الْمَصِيرُ
translation_english: No one can bear another's burden. If a heavily laden one should call another to carry his load, none of it shall be carried by the other, even though he be a near of kin. (O Prophet), you can warn only those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and establish Prayer. Whoever purifies himself does so to his own good. To Allah is the final return.

arabic: وَمَا يَسْتَوِي الْأَعْمَىٰ وَالْبَصِيرُ
translation_english: The blind and the seeing are not alike,

arabic: وَلَا الظُّلُمَاتُ وَلَا النُّورُ
translation_english: nor darkness and light;

arabic: وَلَا الظِّلُّ وَلَا الْحَرُورُ
translation_english: nor cool shade and torrid heat;

arabic: وَمَا يَسْتَوِي الْأَحْيَاءُ وَلَا الْأَمْوَاتُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُسْمِعُ مَن يَشَاءُ ۖ وَمَا أَنتَ بِمُسْمِعٍ مَّن فِي الْقُبُورِ
translation_english: nor are the living and the dead alike. Allah makes to hear whomsoever He wishes, but you, (O Prophet), cannot cause to hear those who are in their graves.

arabic: إِنْ أَنتَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ
translation_english: You are no more than a warner.

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ بَشِيرًا وَنَذِيرًا ۚ وَإِن مِّنْ أُمَّةٍ إِلَّا خَلَا فِيهَا نَذِيرٌ
translation_english: We have sent you with the Truth to proclaim good news and to warn. Never has there been a nation but a warner came to it.

arabic: وَإِن يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدْ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ جَاءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ وَبِالزُّبُرِ وَبِالْكِتَابِ الْمُنِيرِ
translation_english: If they give the lie to you now, those that went before them also gave the lie to their Messengers when they came to them with Clear Proofs, with Scriptures, and with the Illuminating Book.

arabic: ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
translation_english: Then I seized those who denied the Truth, and how terrible was My punishment!

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِ ثَمَرَاتٍ مُّخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَانُهَا ۚ وَمِنَ الْجِبَالِ جُدَدٌ بِيضٌ وَحُمْرٌ مُّخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَانُهَا وَغَرَابِيبُ سُودٌ
translation_english: Do you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky with which We brought forth fruits of diverse hues? In the mountains there are white and red, of diverse hues, and pitchy black;

arabic: وَمِنَ النَّاسِ وَالدَّوَابِّ وَالْأَنْعَامِ مُخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَانُهُ كَذَٰلِكَ ۗ إِنَّمَا يَخْشَى اللَّهَ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ الْعُلَمَاءُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ غَفُورٌ
translation_english: and human beings too, and beasts, and cattle -- diverse are their hues. From among His servants, it is only those who know that fear Allah. Verily Allah is Most Mighty, Most Forgiving.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَتْلُونَ كِتَابَ اللَّهِ وَأَقَامُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَأَنفَقُوا مِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ سِرًّا وَعَلَانِيَةً يَرْجُونَ تِجَارَةً لَّن تَبُورَ
translation_english: Surely those who recite the Book of Allah and establish Prayer and spend, privately and publicly, out of what We have provided them, look forward to a trade that shall suffer no loss;

arabic: لِيُوَفِّيَهُمْ أُجُورَهُمْ وَيَزِيدَهُم مِّن فَضْلِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ غَفُورٌ شَكُورٌ
translation_english: (a trade in which they have invested their all) so that Allah may pay them their wages in full and may add to them out of His Bounty. He is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative.

arabic: وَالَّذِي أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْكَ مِنَ الْكِتَابِ هُوَ الْحَقُّ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِعِبَادِهِ لَخَبِيرٌ بَصِيرٌ
translation_english: (O Prophet), the Book We have revealed to you is the Truth, confirming the Books that came before it. Verily Allah is well aware of His servants and sees everything.

arabic: ثُمَّ أَوْرَثْنَا الْكِتَابَ الَّذِينَ اصْطَفَيْنَا مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ۖ فَمِنْهُمْ ظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِ وَمِنْهُم مُّقْتَصِدٌ وَمِنْهُمْ سَابِقٌ بِالْخَيْرَاتِ بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَضْلُ الْكَبِيرُ
translation_english: Then We bequeathed the Book to those of Our servants that We chose. Now, some of them wrong themselves and some follow the medium course; and some, by Allah's leave, vie with each other in acts of goodness. That is the great bounty.

arabic: جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ يَدْخُلُونَهَا يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَلُؤْلُؤًا ۖ وَلِبَاسُهُمْ فِيهَا حَرِيرٌ
translation_english: They shall enter the everlasting Gardens, shall be adorned with bracelets of gold and with pearls, and their apparel therein shall be silk.

arabic: وَقَالُوا الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَذْهَبَ عَنَّا الْحَزَنَ ۖ إِنَّ رَبَّنَا لَغَفُورٌ شَكُورٌ
translation_english: They will say: “All praise be to Allah Who has taken away all sorrow from us. Surely our Lord is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative;

arabic: الَّذِي أَحَلَّنَا دَارَ الْمُقَامَةِ مِن فَضْلِهِ لَا يَمَسُّنَا فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَلَا يَمَسُّنَا فِيهَا لُغُوبٌ
translation_english: (the Lord) Who, out of His Bounty, has made us dwell in an abode wherein no toil, nor fatigue affects us.

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَهُمْ نَارُ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يُقْضَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ فَيَمُوتُوا وَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُم مِّنْ عَذَابِهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي كُلَّ كَفُورٍ
translation_english: As for those who disbelieved, the Fire of Hell awaits them. There they shall not be finished off and die; nor will the torment (of Hell) be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every thankless being.

arabic: وَهُمْ يَصْطَرِخُونَ فِيهَا رَبَّنَا أَخْرِجْنَا نَعْمَلْ صَالِحًا غَيْرَ الَّذِي كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ ۚ أَوَلَمْ نُعَمِّرْكُم مَّا يَتَذَكَّرُ فِيهِ مَن تَذَكَّرَ وَجَاءَكُمُ النَّذِيرُ ۖ فَذُوقُوا فَمَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ مِن نَّصِيرٍ
translation_english: They will cry out in Hell and say: “Our Lord, let us out so that we may act righteously, different from what we did before.” (They will be told): “Did we not grant you an age long enough for anyone to take heed if he had wanted to take heed? Besides, there came a warner to you. So have a taste of the torment now. None may come to the help of the wrong-doers.”

arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَالِمُ غَيْبِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
translation_english: Surely Allah knows the Unseen in the heavens and the earth. He even knows the secrets hidden in people's breasts.

arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَكُمْ خَلَائِفَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ فَمَن كَفَرَ فَعَلَيْهِ كُفْرُهُ ۖ وَلَا يَزِيدُ الْكَافِرِينَ كُفْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا مَقْتًا ۖ وَلَا يَزِيدُ الْكَافِرِينَ كُفْرُهُمْ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
translation_english: It is He Who made you vicegerents in the earth. So whoever disbelieves will bear the burden of his unbelief. The unbelievers' unbelief adds nothing but Allah's wrath against them. The unbelievers' unbelief adds nothing but their own loss.

arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ شُرَكَاءَكُمُ الَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ أَرُونِي مَاذَا خَلَقُوا مِنَ الْأَرْضِ أَمْ لَهُمْ شِرْكٌ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ أَمْ آتَيْنَاهُمْ كِتَابًا فَهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَتٍ مِّنْهُ ۚ بَلْ إِن يَعِدُ الظَّالِمُونَ بَعْضُهُم بَعْضًا إِلَّا غُرُورًا
translation_english: Say to them (O Prophet): “Have you ever seen those of your associates upon whom you call apart from Allah? Show me what have they created in the earth? Or do they have any partnership (with Allah) in the heavens? Or have We given them a Book so that they have a clear proof (for associating others with Allah in His Divinity)?” Nay, what these wrong-doers promise each other is nothing but delusion.

arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُمْسِكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ أَن تَزُولَا ۚ وَلَئِن زَالَتَا إِنْ أَمْسَكَهُمَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ مِّن بَعْدِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ حَلِيمًا غَفُورًا
translation_english: Surely Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they should be displaced there, for if they were displaced none would be able to hold them after Him. Surely He is Most Forbearing, Most Forgiving.

arabic: وَأَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ لَئِن جَاءَهُمْ نَذِيرٌ لَّيَكُونُنَّ أَهْدَىٰ مِنْ إِحْدَى الْأُمَمِ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ نَذِيرٌ مَّا زَادَهُمْ إِلَّا نُفُورًا
translation_english: Swearing by Allah their strongest oaths they claimed that if a warner came to them they would be better-guided than any other people. But when a warner did come to them, his coming only increased their aversion (to the Truth).

arabic: اسْتِكْبَارًا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَكْرَ السَّيِّئِ ۚ وَلَا يَحِيقُ الْمَكْرُ السَّيِّئُ إِلَّا بِأَهْلِهِ ۚ فَهَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا سُنَّتَ الْأَوَّلِينَ ۚ فَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ اللَّهِ تَبْدِيلًا ۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ اللَّهِ تَحْوِيلًا
translation_english: They began to wax even more proud on earth and contrived evil designs although the contriving of evil designs only overtakes their authors. Are they waiting, then, for anything except what happened to the nations before them? You shall not find any change in the Way of Allah; and you shall not find anything that can ever alter the Way of Allah.

arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ وَكَانُوا أَشَدَّ مِنْهُمْ قُوَّةً ۚ وَمَا كَانَ اللَّهُ لِيُعْجِزَهُ مِن شَيْءٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَلَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَلِيمًا قَدِيرًا
translation_english: Have they not journeyed in the earth to behold the end of those who went before them though they were stronger than them in might? Nothing in the heavens nor on earth can frustrate Him in the least. He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

arabic: وَلَوْ يُؤَاخِذُ اللَّهُ النَّاسَ بِمَا كَسَبُوا مَا تَرَكَ عَلَىٰ ظَهْرِهَا مِن دَابَّةٍ وَلَـٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَاءَ أَجَلُهُمْ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ بِعِبَادِهِ بَصِيرًا
translation_english: If Allah were to take people to task for their deeds, He would not leave any living creature on earth, but He grants them respite to an appointed time. When their appointed time comes to an end, surely Allah fully observes His servants.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يس
translation_english: Ya'. Sin.

arabic: وَالْقُرْآنِ الْحَكِيمِ
translation_english: By the Wise Qur'an,

arabic: إِنَّكَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: you are truly among the Messengers,

arabic: عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
translation_english: on a Straight Way,

arabic: تَنزِيلَ الْعَزِيزِ الرَّحِيمِ
translation_english: (and this Qur'an) is a revelation from the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate

arabic: لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًا مَّا أُنذِرَ آبَاؤُهُمْ فَهُمْ غَافِلُونَ
translation_english: so that you may warn a people whose ancestors were not warned before wherefore they are heedless.

arabic: لَقَدْ حَقَّ الْقَوْلُ عَلَىٰ أَكْثَرِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
translation_english: Surely most of them merit the decree of chastisement; so they do not believe.

arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا فِي أَعْنَاقِهِمْ أَغْلَالًا فَهِيَ إِلَى الْأَذْقَانِ فَهُم مُّقْمَحُونَ
translation_english: We have put fetters around their necks which reach up to their chins so that they are standing with their heads upright,

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا مِن بَيْنِ أَيْدِيهِمْ سَدًّا وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ سَدًّا فَأَغْشَيْنَاهُمْ فَهُمْ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: and We have put a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, and have covered them up, so they are unable to see.

arabic: وَسَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنذِرْهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
translation_english: It is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them for they shall not believe.

arabic: إِنَّمَا تُنذِرُ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الذِّكْرَ وَخَشِيَ الرَّحْمَـٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِمَغْفِرَةٍ وَأَجْرٍ كَرِيمٍ
translation_english: You can warn only him who follows the Admonition and fears the Merciful Lord without seeing Him. Give such a one good tidings of forgiveness and a generous reward.

arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي الْمَوْتَىٰ وَنَكْتُبُ مَا قَدَّمُوا وَآثَارَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ فِي إِمَامٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: We shall surely raise the dead to life and We record what they did and the traces of their deeds that they have left behind. We have encompassed that in a Clear Book.

arabic: وَاضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلًا أَصْحَابَ الْقَرْيَةِ إِذْ جَاءَهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ
translation_english: Recite to them, as a case in point, the story of the people of the town when the Messengers came to them.

arabic: إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهِمُ اثْنَيْنِ فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَعَزَّزْنَا بِثَالِثٍ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا إِلَيْكُم مُّرْسَلُونَ
translation_english: We sent to them two Messengers and they rejected both of them as liars. Then We strengthened them with a third (Messenger).

arabic: قَالُوا مَا أَنتُمْ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَمَا أَنزَلَ الرَّحْمَـٰنُ مِن شَيْءٍ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا تَكْذِبُونَ
translation_english: They said: “We have been sent to you as Messengers.” The people of the town said: “You are only human beings like ourselves, and the Merciful Lord has revealed nothing. You are simply lying.”

arabic: قَالُوا رَبُّنَا يَعْلَمُ إِنَّا إِلَيْكُمْ لَمُرْسَلُونَ
translation_english: The Messengers said: “Our Lord knows that we have indeed been sent to you

arabic: وَمَا عَلَيْنَا إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ
translation_english: and our duty is no more than to clearly convey the Message.”

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا تَطَيَّرْنَا بِكُمْ ۖ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهُوا لَنَرْجُمَنَّكُمْ وَلَيَمَسَّنَّكُم مِّنَّا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
translation_english: The people of the town said: “We believe you are an evil omen for us. If you do not desist, we will stone you or you will receive a grievous chastisement from us.”

arabic: قَالُوا طَائِرُكُم مَّعَكُمْ ۚ أَئِن ذُكِّرْتُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّسْرِفُونَ
translation_english: The Messengers replied: “Your evil omen is with you. (Are you saying this) because you were asked to take heed? The truth is that you are a people who have exceeded all bounds.”

arabic: وَجَاءَ مِنْ أَقْصَى الْمَدِينَةِ رَجُلٌ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اتَّبِعُوا الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: In the meantime a man came running from the far end of the town, saying: “My people, follow the Messengers;

arabic: اتَّبِعُوا مَن لَّا يَسْأَلُكُمْ أَجْرًا وَهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ
translation_english: follow those who do not ask any recompense from you and are rightly-guided.

arabic: وَمَا لِيَ لَا أَعْبُدُ الَّذِي فَطَرَنِي وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
translation_english: Why should I not serve the One Who created me and to Whom all of you shall be sent back?

arabic: أَأَتَّخِذُ مِن دُونِهِ آلِهَةً إِن يُرِدْنِ الرَّحْمَـٰنُ بِضُرٍّ لَّا تُغْنِ عَنِّي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا يُنقِذُونِ
translation_english: What! Shall I take any deities apart from Him whose intercession will not avail me the least were the Merciful One to bring any adversity upon me, nor will they be able to rescue me?

arabic: إِنِّي إِذًا لَّفِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: Surely in that case I should indeed be in evident error.

arabic: إِنِّي آمَنتُ بِرَبِّكُمْ فَاسْمَعُونِ
translation_english: I believe in your Lord; so listen to me.”

arabic: قِيلَ ادْخُلِ الْجَنَّةَ ۖ قَالَ يَا لَيْتَ قَوْمِي يَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: (Eventually they killed him and he was told): “Enter Paradise.” The man exclaimed: “Would that my people knew

arabic: بِمَا غَفَرَ لِي رَبِّي وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ
translation_english: for what reason Allah has forgiven me and placed me among the honoured ones.”

arabic: وَمَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ مِن بَعْدِهِ مِن جُندٍ مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ وَمَا كُنَّا مُنزِلِينَ
translation_english: After him, We did not send down any hosts from the heaven; We stood in no need to send down any host.

arabic: إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ خَامِدُونَ
translation_english: There was but a single Blast and suddenly they became silent and still.

arabic: يَا حَسْرَةً عَلَى الْعِبَادِ ۚ مَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
translation_english: Alas for My servants! Never does a Messenger come to them but they mock him.

arabic: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ الْقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
translation_english: Have they not seen how many nations before them did We destroy? Thereafter they never came back to them.

arabic: وَإِن كُلٌّ لَّمَّا جَمِيعٌ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ
translation_english: All of them shall (one day) be gathered before Us.

arabic: وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمُ الْأَرْضُ الْمَيْتَةُ أَحْيَيْنَاهَا وَأَخْرَجْنَا مِنْهَا حَبًّا فَمِنْهُ يَأْكُلُونَ
translation_english: Let the dead earth be a Sign for them. We gave it life and produced from it grain whereof they eat.

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا جَنَّاتٍ مِّن نَّخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَابٍ وَفَجَّرْنَا فِيهَا مِنَ الْعُيُونِ
translation_english: We made in it gardens of date-palms and vines, and We caused springs to gush forth

arabic: لِيَأْكُلُوا مِن ثَمَرِهِ وَمَا عَمِلَتْهُ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ
translation_english: that they might eat of its fruits. It was not their hands that made them. Will they not, then, give thanks?

arabic: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْأَزْوَاجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنبِتُ الْأَرْضُ وَمِنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: Holy is He Who created all things in pairs, whether it be of what the earth produces, and of themselves, and of what they do not know.

arabic: وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمُ اللَّيْلُ نَسْلَخُ مِنْهُ النَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُم مُّظْلِمُونَ
translation_english: And the night is another Sign for them. We strip the day from it and they become plunged in darkness.

arabic: وَالشَّمْسُ تَجْرِي لِمُسْتَقَرٍّ لَّهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ
translation_english: The sun is running its course to its appointed place. That is the ordaining of the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.

arabic: وَالْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَاهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَالْعُرْجُونِ الْقَدِيمِ
translation_english: We have appointed stages for the moon till it returns in the shape of a dry old branch of palm-tree.

arabic: لَا الشَّمْسُ يَنبَغِي لَهَا أَن تُدْرِكَ الْقَمَرَ وَلَا اللَّيْلُ سَابِقُ النَّهَارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ
translation_english: Neither does it lie in the sun's power to overtake the moon nor can the night outstrip the day. All glide along, each in its own orbit.

arabic: وَآيَةٌ لَّهُمْ أَنَّا حَمَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
translation_english: Another Sign for them is that We carried all their offspring in the laden vessel

arabic: وَخَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّن مِّثْلِهِ مَا يَرْكَبُونَ
translation_english: and then created for them other vessels like those on which they ride.

arabic: وَإِن نَّشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنقَذُونَ
translation_english: Should We so wish, We can drown them, and there will be none to heed their cries of distress, nor will they be rescued.

arabic: إِلَّا رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَمَتَاعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
translation_english: It is only Our Mercy (that rescues them) and enables enjoyment of life for a while.

arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّقُوا مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَمَا خَلْفَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
translation_english: When it is said to such people: “Guard yourselves against what is ahead of you and what has preceded you that mercy be shown to you” (they pay scant heed to it).

arabic: وَمَا تَأْتِيهِم مِّنْ آيَةٍ مِّنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
translation_english: Never does any Sign of their Lord come to them, but they turn away from it.

arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ أَنفِقُوا مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ قَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَنُطْعِمُ مَن لَّوْ يَشَاءُ اللَّهُ أَطْعَمَهُ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: And when it is said to them: “Spend (in the Way of Allah) out of the sustenance that Allah has provided you,” the unbelievers say to the believers: “Shall we feed him whom, Allah would have fed, had He so wished?” Say: “You are in evident error.”

arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
translation_english: They say: “When will this threat (of Resurrection) come to pass? Tell us if indeed you are truthful.”

arabic: مَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً تَأْخُذُهُمْ وَهُمْ يَخِصِّمُونَ
translation_english: The Truth is that they are waiting for nothing but a mighty Blast to seize them the while they are disputing (in their worldly affairs),

arabic: فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ تَوْصِيَةً وَلَا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
translation_english: and they will not even be able to make a testament, nor to return to their households.

arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَإِذَا هُم مِّنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَنسِلُونَ
translation_english: Then the Trumpet shall be blown and lo! they will come out of their graves and be on the move towards their Lord,

arabic: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا مَن بَعَثَنَا مِن مَّرْقَدِنَا ۜ ۗ هَـٰذَا مَا وَعَدَ الرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَصَدَقَ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
translation_english: (nervously) exclaiming. “Alas for us! Who roused us out of our sleeping-place?” “This is what the Merciful One had promised, and what (His) Messengers had said was true.”

arabic: إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ جَمِيعٌ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ
translation_english: Then there will simply be one single Blast, and all will have gathered before Us.

arabic: فَالْيَوْمَ لَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْئًا وَلَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: Today no one shall suffer the least injustice, and you shall not be recompensed except according to your deeds.

arabic: إِنَّ أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ الْيَوْمَ فِي شُغُلٍ فَاكِهُونَ
translation_english: Indeed, the people of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves:

arabic: هُمْ وَأَزْوَاجُهُمْ فِي ظِلَالٍ عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ مُتَّكِئُونَ
translation_english: they and their spouses shall be reclining on their couches in shady groves;

arabic: لَهُمْ فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَلَهُم مَّا يَدَّعُونَ
translation_english: therein there will be all kinds of fruits to eat, and they shall have all that they desire.

arabic: سَلَامٌ قَوْلًا مِّن رَّبٍّ رَّحِيمٍ
translation_english: “Peace” shall be the word conveyed to them from their Merciful Lord.

arabic: وَامْتَازُوا الْيَوْمَ أَيُّهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
translation_english: “Criminals, separate yourselves from others today!

arabic: أَلَمْ أَعْهَدْ إِلَيْكُمْ يَا بَنِي آدَمَ أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوا الشَّيْطَانَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: Children of Adam, did I not command you not to serve Satan -- he is to you an open enemy

arabic: وَأَنِ اعْبُدُونِي ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
translation_english: and serve Me alone: this is the Straight Way?

arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَضَلَّ مِنكُمْ جِبِلًّا كَثِيرًا ۖ أَفَلَمْ تَكُونُوا تَعْقِلُونَ
translation_english: Still, he misguided a whole throng of you. Did you have no sense?

arabic: هَـٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ
translation_english: Now this is the Hell of which you were warned.

arabic: اصْلَوْهَا الْيَوْمَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
translation_english: Burn in it on account of your disbelieving.

arabic: الْيَوْمَ نَخْتِمُ عَلَىٰ أَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَتُكَلِّمُنَا أَيْدِيهِمْ وَتَشْهَدُ أَرْجُلُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
translation_english: Today We shall put a seal on their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us and their feet shall bear witness to what they had been doing.

arabic: وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَطَمَسْنَا عَلَىٰ أَعْيُنِهِمْ فَاسْتَبَقُوا الصِّرَاطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: If We so willed, We would have put out their eyes, then they would rush to see the Way, but how would they be able to see?

arabic: وَلَوْ نَشَاءُ لَمَسَخْنَاهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمْ فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مُضِيًّا وَلَا يَرْجِعُونَ
translation_english: If We so willed, We would have transformed them where they were so that they would not go forward or backward.

arabic: وَمَن نُّعَمِّرْهُ نُنَكِّسْهُ فِي الْخَلْقِ ۖ أَفَلَا يَعْقِلُونَ
translation_english: Whomsoever We grant a long life, We reverse him in his constitution. Do they still not understand?

arabic: وَمَا عَلَّمْنَاهُ الشِّعْرَ وَمَا يَنبَغِي لَهُ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ وَقُرْآنٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: We did not teach him (to wit, the Messenger) poetry and it does not behove him. This is none but an Admonition, and a Clear Book

arabic: لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيًّا وَيَحِقَّ الْقَوْلُ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ
translation_english: that he may warn him who is alive and establish an argument against those that deny the Truth.

arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّا خَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّمَّا عَمِلَتْ أَيْدِينَا أَنْعَامًا فَهُمْ لَهَا مَالِكُونَ
translation_english: Do they not see Our handiwork: We created for them cattle which they own?

arabic: وَذَلَّلْنَاهَا لَهُمْ فَمِنْهَا رَكُوبُهُمْ وَمِنْهَا يَأْكُلُونَ
translation_english: We have subjected the cattle to them so that some of them they ride and eat the flesh of others.

arabic: وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ وَمَشَارِبُ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ
translation_english: They derive a variety of benefits and drinks from them. Will they, then, not give thanks?

arabic: وَاتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لَّعَلَّهُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
translation_english: They set up deities apart from Allah, hoping that they will receive help from them.

arabic: لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُمْ جُندٌ مُّحْضَرُونَ
translation_english: Those deities can render them no help. Yet these devotees act as though they were an army in waiting for them.

arabic: فَلَا يَحْزُنكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّا نَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
translation_english: Let not their words grieve you. Surely We know all things about them, what they conceal and what they reveal.

arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ الْإِنسَانُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: Does man not see that We created him of a sperm drop, and lo! he is flagrantly contentious?

arabic: وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلًا وَنَسِيَ خَلْقَهُ ۖ قَالَ مَن يُحْيِي الْعِظَامَ وَهِيَ رَمِيمٌ
translation_english: He strikes for Us a similitude and forgot his own creation. He says: “Who will quicken the bones when they have decayed?”

arabic: قُلْ يُحْيِيهَا الَّذِي أَنشَأَهَا أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلْقٍ عَلِيمٌ
translation_english: Say: “He Who first brought them into being will quicken them; He knows well about every kind of creation;

arabic: الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ الشَّجَرِ الْأَخْضَرِ نَارًا فَإِذَا أَنتُم مِّنْهُ تُوقِدُونَ
translation_english: He Who created from a green tree a fire for you, a fire to light your stoves with.”

arabic: أَوَلَيْسَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَن يَخْلُقَ مِثْلَهُم ۚ بَلَىٰ وَهُوَ الْخَلَّاقُ الْعَلِيمُ
translation_english: Has He Who created the heavens and the earth no power to create the likes of them? Yes, indeed, He is the Superb Creator.

arabic: إِنَّمَا أَمْرُهُ إِذَا أَرَادَ شَيْئًا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُ كُن فَيَكُونُ
translation_english: Whenever He wills a thing, He just commands it “Be” and it is.

arabic: فَسُبْحَانَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
translation_english: Holy is He Who has full control over everything, and to Him you shall all be recalled.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالصَّافَّاتِ صَفًّا
translation_english: By those who range themselves in rows;

arabic: فَالزَّاجِرَاتِ زَجْرًا
translation_english: by those who reprove severely,

arabic: فَالتَّالِيَاتِ ذِكْرًا
translation_english: and those who recite the Exhortation;

arabic: إِنَّ إِلَـٰهَكُمْ لَوَاحِدٌ
translation_english: surely your God is One,

arabic: رَّبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ الْمَشَارِقِ
translation_english: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of whatever lies between the two, the Lord of the Easts.

arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ الْكَوَاكِبِ
translation_english: We have adorned the lower heaven with the adornment of the stars

arabic: وَحِفْظًا مِّن كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ مَّارِدٍ
translation_english: and have protected it from every rebellious satan.

arabic: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى الْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ
translation_english: These satans cannot listen to what transpires in the High Council for they are pelted away from every side

arabic: دُحُورًا ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ وَاصِبٌ
translation_english: and are repelled. Theirs is an unceasing chastisement.

arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ الْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ
translation_english: And if any is able to snatch a fragment, he is pursued by a piercing flame.

arabic: فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَا ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍ
translation_english: So ask them (that is, human beings): “Were they harder to create than the objects We created?” We created them from sticky clay.

arabic: بَلْ عَجِبْتَ وَيَسْخَرُونَ
translation_english: You marvel (at the wondrous creations of Allah) and they scoff at it,

arabic: وَإِذَا ذُكِّرُوا لَا يَذْكُرُونَ
translation_english: and when they are admonished, they pay no heed;

arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْا آيَةً يَسْتَسْخِرُونَ
translation_english: and if they see any Sign, they laugh it away

arabic: وَقَالُوا إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: and say: “This is nothing but plain sorcery.

arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
translation_english: Is it ever possible that after we die and are reduced to dust and (a skeleton of) bones, we will be raised to life?

arabic: أَوَآبَاؤُنَا الْأَوَّلُونَ
translation_english: And so also shall our forefathers of yore be raised to life?”

arabic: قُلْ نَعَمْ وَأَنتُمْ دَاخِرُونَ
translation_english: Tell them: “Yes; and you are utterly helpless (against Allah).”

arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
translation_english: There will be a single stern rebuff and lo, they will be observing with their own eyes (all that they had been warned against).

arabic: وَقَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
translation_english: They will then say: “Woe for us. This is the Day of Judgement.”

arabic: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation_english: “Yes, this is the Day of Final Decision that you used to deny as a lie.”

arabic: احْشُرُوا الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا وَأَزْوَاجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا يَعْبُدُونَ
translation_english: (Then will the command be given): “Muster all the wrong-doers and their spouses and the deities whom they used to serve

arabic: مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ فَاهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطِ الْجَحِيمِ
translation_english: apart from Allah, and direct them to the path of Hell,

arabic: وَقِفُوهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُم مَّسْئُولُونَ
translation_english: and detain them there; they will be called to account.

arabic: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنَاصَرُونَ
translation_english: How is it that you are not helping one another?

arabic: بَلْ هُمُ الْيَوْمَ مُسْتَسْلِمُونَ
translation_english: Indeed, today they are surrendering themselves completely.”

arabic: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
translation_english: They will then turn towards each other (and start wrangling).

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ الْيَمِينِ
translation_english: (The followers will say to their leaders): “You used to come to us from the right hand.”

arabic: قَالُوا بَل لَّمْ تَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: They will say: “Nay, you yourselves were not the ones who would believe.

arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَانٍ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَاغِينَ
translation_english: We had no power over you. You were a rebellious people,

arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَا ۖ إِنَّا لَذَائِقُونَ
translation_english: and so we became deserving of the Word of our Lord that we shall be made to suffer chastisement.

arabic: فَأَغْوَيْنَاكُمْ إِنَّا كُنَّا غَاوِينَ
translation_english: So we led you astray; we ourselves were strayed.”

arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ فِي الْعَذَابِ مُشْتَرِكُونَ
translation_english: On that Day, they will all share the chastisement.

arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِالْمُجْرِمِينَ
translation_english: Thus do We treat the culprits.

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
translation_english: Whenever it was said to them: “There is no true deity apart from Allah,” they waxed proud

arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُو آلِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍ
translation_english: and said: “Shall we forsake our deities for the sake of a distracted poet?”

arabic: بَلْ جَاءَ بِالْحَقِّ وَصَدَّقَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: (They say so although) he brought the Truth and confirmed the veracity of the Messengers.

arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَذَائِقُو الْعَذَابِ الْأَلِيمِ
translation_english: (They will be told): “You shall taste the grievous chastisement.

arabic: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: You will only be recompensed according to your deeds.”

arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
translation_english: But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).

arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ لَهُمْ رِزْقٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
translation_english: For them awaits a known provision,

arabic: فَوَاكِهُ ۖ وَهُم مُّكْرَمُونَ
translation_english: a variety of delicious fruits; and they shall be honoured

arabic: فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
translation_english: in the Gardens of Bliss.

arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَابِلِينَ
translation_english: They will be seated upon couches set face to face;

arabic: يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِكَأْسٍ مِّن مَّعِينٍ
translation_english: a cup filled with wine from its springs, will be passed around to them;

arabic: بَيْضَاءَ لَذَّةٍ لِّلشَّارِبِينَ
translation_english: white, sparkling (wine), a delight to the drinkers.

arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
translation_english: There will neither be any harm in it for their body nor will it intoxicate their mind.

arabic: وَعِندَهُمْ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ عِينٌ
translation_english: Theirs shall be wide-eyed maidens with bashful, restrained glances,

arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ بَيْضٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
translation_english: so delicate as the hidden peel under an egg's shell.

arabic: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
translation_english: Then some of them will turn to others, and will ask each other.

arabic: قَالَ قَائِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٌ
translation_english: One of them will say: “I had a companion in the world

arabic: يَقُولُ أَإِنَّكَ لَمِنَ الْمُصَدِّقِينَ
translation_english: who used to say: -- Are you also one of those who confirm the Truth (of life after death)?

arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
translation_english: After we are dead and have become all dust and bones shall we still be requited?'

arabic: قَالَ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّطَّلِعُونَ
translation_english: He will say: -- Do you wish to know where he is now?'

arabic: فَاطَّلَعَ فَرَآهُ فِي سَوَاءِ الْجَحِيمِ
translation_english: Then he will look downwards, and will see him in the depths of Hell.

arabic: قَالَ تَاللَّهِ إِن كِدتَّ لَتُرْدِينِ
translation_english: He will say to him: -- By Allah, you almost ruined me.

arabic: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ الْمُحْضَرِينَ
translation_english: But for Allah's favour, I should be one of those who have been mustered here.

arabic: أَفَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَيِّتِينَ
translation_english: So, are we not going to die,

arabic: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا الْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
translation_english: except for our first death? And shall we suffer no chastisement?'”

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
translation_english: Surely this is the supreme triumph.

arabic: لِمِثْلِ هَـٰذَا فَلْيَعْمَلِ الْعَامِلُونَ
translation_english: For the like of it should the workers work.

arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ الزَّقُّومِ
translation_english: Is this a better hospitality or the tree of al-Zaqqum?

arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاهَا فِتْنَةً لِّلظَّالِمِينَ
translation_english: We have made this tree a trial for the wrong-doers.

arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِي أَصْلِ الْجَحِيمِ
translation_english: It is a tree that grows in the nethermost part of Hell.

arabic: طَلْعُهَا كَأَنَّهُ رُءُوسُ الشَّيَاطِينِ
translation_english: Its spathes are like the heads of satans.

arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَآكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِئُونَ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ
translation_english: (The people of Hell) will surely eat of it, filling their bellies with it.

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
translation_english: Then on top of it they will have a brew of boiling water.

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ مَرْجِعَهُمْ لَإِلَى الْجَحِيمِ
translation_english: Then their return will be to the same blazing Hell.

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ أَلْفَوْا آبَاءَهُمْ ضَالِّينَ
translation_english: These are the ones who found their fathers steeped in error,

arabic: فَهُمْ عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ يُهْرَعُونَ
translation_english: and they are running in their footsteps.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ ضَلَّ قَبْلَهُمْ أَكْثَرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: Before them a multitude of people of olden times had erred,

arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِم مُّنذِرِينَ
translation_english: and We had sent among them Messengers to warn them.

arabic: فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
translation_english: Observe, then, what was the end of those that had been warned,

arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
translation_english: except for the chosen servants of Allah?

arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَادَانَا نُوحٌ فَلَنِعْمَ الْمُجِيبُونَ
translation_english: Noah had called upon Us (earlier). See, how excellent We were in answering him!

arabic: وَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ
translation_english: We delivered him and his household from the great calamity;

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُ هُمُ الْبَاقِينَ
translation_english: and made his offspring the only ones to survive,

arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: and We established for him a good name among posterity.

arabic: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ نُوحٍ فِي الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.

arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
translation_english: Thus do We reward all those who do good.

arabic: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely he was one of Our truly believing servants.

arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
translation_english: Thereafter We caused the others to be drowned.

arabic: وَإِنَّ مِن شِيعَتِهِ لَإِبْرَاهِيمَ
translation_english: Abraham was on the self-same way (as Noah).

arabic: إِذْ جَاءَ رَبَّهُ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
translation_english: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart,

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
translation_english: and said to his father and his people: “Whom do you worship?

arabic: أَئِفْكًا آلِهَةً دُونَ اللَّهِ تُرِيدُونَ
translation_english: Is it false deities that you want to serve rather than Allah?

arabic: فَمَا ظَنُّكُم بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: What do you think of the Lord of the whole Universe?”

arabic: فَنَظَرَ نَظْرَةً فِي النُّجُومِ
translation_english: Then he looked carefully at the stars

arabic: فَقَالَ إِنِّي سَقِيمٌ
translation_english: and said: “I am sick.”

arabic: فَتَوَلَّوْا عَنْهُ مُدْبِرِينَ
translation_english: So turning their backs, they went away from him.

arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ آلِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
translation_english: Then he went quietly to the (temple of the deities) and said: “What is the matter with you, why do you not eat?

arabic: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنطِقُونَ
translation_english: What is the matter with you, why do you not speak?”

arabic: فَرَاغَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضَرْبًا بِالْيَمِينِ
translation_english: Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand,

arabic: فَأَقْبَلُوا إِلَيْهِ يَزِفُّونَ
translation_english: whereupon people came to him running.

arabic: قَالَ أَتَعْبُدُونَ مَا تَنْحِتُونَ
translation_english: Abraham said to them: “Do you worship what you yourselves have carved with your own hands

arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ وَمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: while it is Allah Who has created you and all that you make?”

arabic: قَالُوا ابْنُوا لَهُ بُنْيَانًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِي الْجَحِيمِ
translation_english: They spoke among themselves: “Build him a pyre and then throw him into the furnace.”

arabic: فَأَرَادُوا بِهِ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَاهُمُ الْأَسْفَلِينَ
translation_english: They had contrived an evil plan against him, but We abased them all.

arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
translation_english: Abraham said: “I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.

arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
translation_english: Lord, grant me a righteous son.”

arabic: فَبَشَّرْنَاهُ بِغُلَامٍ حَلِيمٍ
translation_english: (In response to this prayer) We gave him the good news of a prudent boy;

arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ السَّعْيَ قَالَ يَا بُنَيَّ إِنِّي أَرَىٰ فِي الْمَنَامِ أَنِّي أَذْبَحُكَ فَانظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَا أَبَتِ افْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّابِرِينَ
translation_english: and when he was old enough to go about and work with him, (one day) Abraham said to him: “My son, I see in my dream that I am slaughtering you. So consider (and tell me) what you think.” He said: “Do as you are bidden. You will find me, if Allah so wills, among the steadfast.”

arabic: فَلَمَّا أَسْلَمَا وَتَلَّهُ لِلْجَبِينِ
translation_english: When both surrendered (to Allah's command) and Abraham flung the son down on his forehead,

arabic: وَنَادَيْنَاهُ أَن يَا إِبْرَاهِيمُ
translation_english: We cried out: “O Abraham,

arabic: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ الرُّؤْيَا ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
translation_english: you have indeed fulfilled your dream. Thus do We reward the good-doers.”

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ الْبَلَاءُ الْمُبِينُ
translation_english: This was indeed a plain trial.

arabic: وَفَدَيْنَاهُ بِذِبْحٍ عَظِيمٍ
translation_english: And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,

arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: and We preserved for him a good name among posterity.

arabic: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
translation_english: Peace be upon Abraham.

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
translation_english: Thus do We reward the good-doers.

arabic: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely he was one of Our believing servants.

arabic: وَبَشَّرْنَاهُ بِإِسْحَاقَ نَبِيًّا مِّنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
translation_english: And We gave him the good news of Isaac, a Prophet and among the righteous ones.

arabic: وَبَارَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰ إِسْحَاقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِ مُبِينٌ
translation_english: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among the offspring of the two some did good and some plainly wronged themselves.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
translation_english: Verily We bestowed Our favours on Moses and Aaron

arabic: وَنَجَّيْنَاهُمَا وَقَوْمَهُمَا مِنَ الْكَرْبِ الْعَظِيمِ
translation_english: and We delivered both of them and their people from the great calamity.

arabic: وَنَصَرْنَاهُمْ فَكَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ
translation_english: We succoured them, and they gained the upper hand (against their enemies).

arabic: وَآتَيْنَاهُمَا الْكِتَابَ الْمُسْتَبِينَ
translation_english: We granted them a Clear Book,

arabic: وَهَدَيْنَاهُمَا الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ
translation_english: and showed them the Straight Way,

arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِمَا فِي الْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: and preserved for them a good name among posterity.

arabic: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
translation_english: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.

arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
translation_english: Thus do We reward the good-doers.

arabic: إِنَّهُمَا مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Surely both of them were among Our believing servants.

arabic: وَإِنَّ إِلْيَاسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: Surely, Elias too was among the Messengers.

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation_english: (Call to mind) when he said to his people: “Will you not fear Allah?

arabic: أَتَدْعُونَ بَعْلًا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحْسَنَ الْخَالِقِينَ
translation_english: Do you call upon Baal and forsake the Best of the Creators?

arabic: اللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ وَرَبَّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors of yore.”

arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
translation_english: But they denounced him as a liar, so they will surely be arraigned (for punishment),

arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
translation_english: except Allah's chosen servants.

arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: We preserved a good name for him among posterity.

arabic: سَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِلْ يَاسِينَ
translation_english: Peace be upon Elias.

arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
translation_english: Thus do We reward the good-doers.

arabic: إِنَّهُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: He was one of Our believing servants.

arabic: وَإِنَّ لُوطًا لَّمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: And Lot too was one of the Messengers.

arabic: إِذْ نَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
translation_english: (Call to mind) when We delivered him and all his kinsfolk,

arabic: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ
translation_english: except for an old woman who was among those that stayed behind.

arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
translation_english: Then We utterly destroyed the rest of them.

arabic: وَإِنَّكُمْ لَتَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهِم مُّصْبِحِينَ
translation_english: You pass by their desolate habitations in the morning

arabic: وَبِاللَّيْلِ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
translation_english: and at night. Do you still not understand?

arabic: وَإِنَّ يُونُسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: And Jonah too was one of the Messengers.

arabic: إِذْ أَبَقَ إِلَى الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
translation_english: Call to mind when he fled to the laden ship,

arabic: فَسَاهَمَ فَكَانَ مِنَ الْمُدْحَضِينَ
translation_english: cast lots, and was among the losers.

arabic: فَالْتَقَمَهُ الْحُوتُ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
translation_english: Then a fish swallowed him, and he was blameworthy.

arabic: فَلَوْلَا أَنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُسَبِّحِينَ
translation_english: Had he not been one of those who glorify Allah,

arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطْنِهِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
translation_english: he would certainly have remained in its belly till the Day of Resurrection.

arabic: فَنَبَذْنَاهُ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ سَقِيمٌ
translation_english: But We threw him on a wide bare tract of land while he was ill;

arabic: وَأَنبَتْنَا عَلَيْهِ شَجَرَةً مِّن يَقْطِينٍ
translation_english: and caused a gourd tree to grow over him,

arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ مِائَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
translation_english: and We sent him forth to a nation of a hundred thousand or more,

arabic: فَآمَنُوا فَمَتَّعْنَاهُمْ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
translation_english: and they believed. So We let them enjoy life for a while.

arabic: فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَلِرَبِّكَ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَهُمُ الْبَنُونَ
translation_english: So ask their opinion: “(Are you convinced) that your Lord should have daughters and you should have sons?

arabic: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِنَاثًا وَهُمْ شَاهِدُونَ
translation_english: Did We create the angels as females the while they witnessed?”

arabic: أَلَا إِنَّهُم مِّنْ إِفْكِهِمْ لَيَقُولُونَ
translation_english: Behold, it is one of their fabrications that they say:

arabic: وَلَدَ اللَّهُ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ
translation_english: “Allah has begotten.” They are liars!

arabic: أَصْطَفَى الْبَنَاتِ عَلَى الْبَنِينَ
translation_english: Did He choose daughters rather than sons?

arabic: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
translation_english: What is the matter with you that you make such strange judgements?

arabic: أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
translation_english: Will you then not take heed?

arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ سُلْطَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: Do you have any clear authority for such claims?

arabic: فَأْتُوا بِكِتَابِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
translation_english: Bring your Book, if you are truthful.

arabic: وَجَعَلُوا بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ الْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ الْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
translation_english: They have established a kinship between Allah and the angels; and the angels know well that these people will be arraigned (as culprits).

arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
translation_english: (They say): “Exalted be Allah above what they attribute to Him,

arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
translation_english: all of them except the chosen servants of Allah.

arabic: فَإِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ
translation_english: So you and your deities

arabic: مَا أَنتُمْ عَلَيْهِ بِفَاتِنِينَ
translation_english: shall not be able to tempt anyone away from Allah

arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ هُوَ صَالِ الْجَحِيمِ
translation_english: except him who shall roast in the Blazing Fire.

arabic: وَمَا مِنَّا إِلَّا لَهُ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
translation_english: As for us, there is none but has an appointed station.

arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الصَّافُّونَ
translation_english: Verily we range ourselves in rows (as humble servants)

arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْمُسَبِّحُونَ
translation_english: and we are of those who glorify Allah.”

arabic: وَإِن كَانُوا لَيَقُولُونَ
translation_english: They used to say before:

arabic: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: “If only we had the Reminder which had been granted to the people of yore

arabic: لَكُنَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
translation_english: we would surely have been Allah's chosen servants.”

arabic: فَكَفَرُوا بِهِ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: But when it came to them, they rejected it. They shall soon come to know (the end of such an attitude).

arabic: وَلَقَدْ سَبَقَتْ كَلِمَتُنَا لِعِبَادِنَا الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: We have already given Our promise to Our Messengers

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ لَهُمُ الْمَنصُورُونَ
translation_english: that they shall certainly be succoured,

arabic: وَإِنَّ جُندَنَا لَهُمُ الْغَالِبُونَ
translation_english: and that Our hosts shall triumph.

arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
translation_english: So, (O Prophet), leave them alone for a while,

arabic: وَأَبْصِرْهُمْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: and see, and soon they too shall see.

arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
translation_english: Do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?

arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَاءَ صَبَاحُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
translation_english: When that chastisement will descend upon their courtyard, evil shall that Day be for those who had been warned.

arabic: وَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
translation_english: Leave them alone for a while,

arabic: وَأَبْصِرْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: and see; and they too shall soon see.

arabic: سُبْحَانَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ الْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
translation_english: Exalted be your Lord, the Lord of Glory, above what they attribute to Him,

arabic: وَسَلَامٌ عَلَى الْمُرْسَلِينَ
translation_english: and peace be upon the Messengers,

arabic: وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ص ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ ذِي الذِّكْرِ
translation_english: Sad, and by the Qur'an full of exhortation!

arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ
translation_english: Nay, but the unbelievers are steeped in arrogance and stubborn defiance.

arabic: كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن قَرْنٍ فَنَادَوا وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٍ
translation_english: How many a nation did We destroy before them! (When they approached their doom) they cried out (for deliverance), but the time for deliverance was already past.

arabic: وَعَجِبُوا أَن جَاءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَـٰذَا سَاحِرٌ كَذَّابٌ
translation_english: They wondered that a warner had come to them from among themselves, and the deniers of the Truth said: “This is a sorcerer, and a big liar.

arabic: أَجَعَلَ الْآلِهَةَ إِلَـٰهًا وَاحِدًا ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ عُجَابٌ
translation_english: Has he made the gods one single God? This is truly astounding.”

arabic: وَانطَلَقَ الْمَلَأُ مِنْهُمْ أَنِ امْشُوا وَاصْبِرُوا عَلَىٰ آلِهَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ يُرَادُ
translation_english: And the elders among them went forth saying: “Go ahead and be steadfast in adhering to your deities. What is being said is with a design.”

arabic: مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَـٰذَا فِي الْمِلَّةِ الْآخِرَةِ إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا اخْتِلَاقٌ
translation_english: We have not heard this in the religious community close to our time. This is nothing but a fabrication.

arabic: أَأُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ مِن بَيْنِنَا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِّن ذِكْرِي ۖ بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُوا عَذَابِ
translation_english: Has this Exhortation been sent down among us only to him, to the exclusion of all others?” Nay, they are in doubt regarding My Exhortation, and are saying all this because they have not yet had any taste of My chastisement.

arabic: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّكَ الْعَزِيزِ الْوَهَّابِ
translation_english: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord, the Most Mighty, the Great Bestower?

arabic: أَمْ لَهُم مُّلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَلْيَرْتَقُوا فِي الْأَسْبَابِ
translation_english: Or do they possess the dominion of the heavens and the earth and of all that is in between them? If so, let them ascend the heights of the realm of causation and see!

arabic: جُندٌ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِّنَ الْأَحْزَابِ
translation_english: This is only a small army out of the several armies that will suffer defeat here.

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ ذُو الْأَوْتَادِ
translation_english: Before them the people of Noah, Ad, and Pharaoh of the tent-pegs gave the lie (to the Messengers)

arabic: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ الْأَحْزَابُ
translation_english: and so did Thamud and the people of Lot and the people of Aykah. These were all leagued together.

arabic: إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ
translation_english: Each of them gave the lie to Messengers and My decree of chastisement came upon them.

arabic: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٍ
translation_english: They are waiting for nothing except a single Cry, after which there will be no second Cry.

arabic: وَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ
translation_english: They say: “Our Lord, hasten to us our share (of chastisement) before the Day of Reckoning.”

arabic: اصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا دَاوُودَ ذَا الْأَيْدِ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
translation_english: (O Prophet), bear with patience what they say, and call to mind Our servant David, who was endowed with great strength and who constantly turned (to Allah).

arabic: إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا الْجِبَالَ مَعَهُ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِالْعَشِيِّ وَالْإِشْرَاقِ
translation_english: With him We had subjected the mountains that they join him in celebrating Allah's glory, evening and morning,

arabic: وَالطَّيْرَ مَحْشُورَةً ۖ كُلٌّ لَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
translation_english: and the birds, too, in their flocks, and turn again and again to celebrating Allah's glory.

arabic: وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ الْخِطَابِ
translation_english: And We strengthened his kingdom and endowed him with wisdom and decisive judgement.

arabic: وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ نَبَأُ الْخَصْمِ إِذْ تَسَوَّرُوا الْمِحْرَابَ
translation_english: Has the story of the litigants reached you -- of those who entered his private chambers by climbing over the wall?

arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَىٰ دَاوُودَ فَفَزِعَ مِنْهُمْ ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ خَصْمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعْضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَاحْكُم بَيْنَنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تُشْطِطْ وَاهْدِنَا إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الصِّرَاطِ
translation_english: As they came upon David -- and he was frightened of them -- they said: “Be not afraid. We are just two litigants: one of us has committed excess against the other. So judge rightly between us, and be not unjust; and guide us to the Right Way.

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا أَخِي لَهُ تِسْعٌ وَتِسْعُونَ نَعْجَةً وَلِيَ نَعْجَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَقَالَ أَكْفِلْنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِي فِي الْخِطَابِ
translation_english: Behold, this is my brother; he has ninety-nine ewes and I have only one ewe.” And yet he said: “Give her into my charge,” and he got the better of me in argument.

arabic: قَالَ لَقَدْ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعْجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ الْخُلَطَاءِ لَيَبْغِي بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَقَلِيلٌ مَّا هُمْ ۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُودُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّاهُ فَاسْتَغْفَرَ رَبَّهُ وَخَرَّ رَاكِعًا وَأَنَابَ ۩
translation_english: David said: “He has certainly wronged you in seeking to add your ewe to his ewes; and indeed many who live together commit excesses, one to the other, except those that believe and act righteously; and they are but few.” (While so saying) David realized that it is We Who have put him to test; therefore, he sought the forgiveness of his Lord, and fell down, bowing and penitently turning (to Him).

arabic: فَغَفَرْنَا لَهُ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
translation_english: Thereupon We forgave him his shortcoming and indeed (an exalted position of) nearness awaits him, and an excellent resort.

arabic: يَا دَاوُودُ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاكَ خَلِيفَةً فِي الْأَرْضِ فَاحْكُم بَيْنَ النَّاسِ بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ الْهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ بِمَا نَسُوا يَوْمَ الْحِسَابِ
translation_english: (We said to him): “O David, We have appointed you vicegerent on earth. Therefore, rule among people with justice and do not follow (your) desire lest it should lead you astray from Allah's Path. Allah's severe chastisement awaits those who stray away from Allah's Path, for they had forgotten the Day of Reckoning.

arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا بَاطِلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنَ النَّارِ
translation_english: We did not create this heaven and earth and all that lies between them in vain. That is the fancy of those who denied the Truth. So woe from the Fire to all who deny the Truth.

arabic: أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ كَالْمُفْسِدِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الْمُتَّقِينَ كَالْفُجَّارِ
translation_english: Shall We then treat alike those that believe and act righteously and those that create mischief on earth? Or treat alike the God-fearing and the wicked?

arabic: كِتَابٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ إِلَيْكَ مُبَارَكٌ لِّيَدَّبَّرُوا آيَاتِهِ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ
translation_english: This is the Blessed Book that We have revealed to you, (O Muhammad), that people with understanding may reflect over its verses and those with understanding derive a lesson.

arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لِدَاوُودَ سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ نِعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
translation_english: We bestowed upon David (an illustrious son), Solomon. How excellent a servant (of Ours he was)! Indeed he constantly turned to Us in devotion.

arabic: إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْعَشِيِّ الصَّافِنَاتُ الْجِيَادُ
translation_english: And when one evening well-trained and running horses of noble breed were brought to him

arabic: فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَحْبَبْتُ حُبَّ الْخَيْرِ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّي حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتْ بِالْحِجَابِ
translation_english: he said: “Lo! I have come to love this wealth on account of the remembrance of my Lord.” And when the horses disappeared,

arabic: رُدُّوهَا عَلَيَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًا بِالسُّوقِ وَالْأَعْنَاقِ
translation_english: (he ordered): “Bring these horses back to me,” and then he began to gently stroke their shanks and necks.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا سُلَيْمَانَ وَأَلْقَيْنَا عَلَىٰ كُرْسِيِّهِ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ
translation_english: Surely We put Solomon to the test and cast upon his throne a mere body. Thereupon he penitently turned (to Us).

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَهَبْ لِي مُلْكًا لَّا يَنبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ مِّن بَعْدِي ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْوَهَّابُ
translation_english: He said: “My Lord, forgive me and bestow upon me a kingdom such as none other after me will deserve. Surely You are the Bounteous Giver.”

arabic: فَسَخَّرْنَا لَهُ الرِّيحَ تَجْرِي بِأَمْرِهِ رُخَاءً حَيْثُ أَصَابَ
translation_english: We subjected the wind to him, so that it blew gently at his bidding, wherever he directed it,

arabic: وَالشَّيَاطِينَ كُلَّ بَنَّاءٍ وَغَوَّاصٍ
translation_english: and We also subjected the devils to him -- all kinds of builders and divers;

arabic: وَآخَرِينَ مُقَرَّنِينَ فِي الْأَصْفَادِ
translation_english: and others that were bound with chains.

arabic: هَـٰذَا عَطَاؤُنَا فَامْنُنْ أَوْ أَمْسِكْ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
translation_english: “This is Our bestowal. So give or withhold as you wish without account.”

arabic: وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
translation_english: Indeed an exalted position of nearness awaits him and an excellent resort.

arabic: وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا أَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الشَّيْطَانُ بِنُصْبٍ وَعَذَابٍ
translation_english: And remember Our servant Job: when he cried to his Lord: “Behold, Satan has afflicted me with much hardship and suffering.”

arabic: ارْكُضْ بِرِجْلِكَ ۖ هَـٰذَا مُغْتَسَلٌ بَارِدٌ وَشَرَابٌ
translation_english: (We commanded him): “Stamp your foot on earth, and here is cool water to wash with and to drink.”

arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ
translation_english: And We granted to him his family and also the like of them, as a mercy from Us, and as a reminder to people of understanding,

arabic: وَخُذْ بِيَدِكَ ضِغْثًا فَاضْرِب بِّهِ وَلَا تَحْنَثْ ۗ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَاهُ صَابِرًا ۚ نِّعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
translation_english: (and We said to him): “Take in your hand a bundle of rushes and strike with it, and do not break your oath.” Indeed We found him steadfast. How excellent a servant (of Ours) he was. Indeed he constantly turned (to his Lord).

arabic: وَاذْكُرْ عِبَادَنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ أُولِي الْأَيْدِي وَالْأَبْصَارِ
translation_english: And remember Our servants -- Abraham, Isaac and Jacob -- they were endowed with great strength and vision.

arabic: إِنَّا أَخْلَصْنَاهُم بِخَالِصَةٍ ذِكْرَى الدَّارِ
translation_english: Verily We exalted them in consideration of a sterling quality: their remembrance of the Abode of the Hereafter.

arabic: وَإِنَّهُمْ عِندَنَا لَمِنَ الْمُصْطَفَيْنَ الْأَخْيَارِ
translation_english: In Our sight they are among the chosen and excellent ones.

arabic: وَاذْكُرْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ ۖ وَكُلٌّ مِّنَ الْأَخْيَارِ
translation_english: And remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhu al-Kifl. All were of the best.

arabic: هَـٰذَا ذِكْرٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
translation_english: This was a remembrance. An excellent retreat awaits the God-fearing

arabic: جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ مُّفَتَّحَةً لَّهُمُ الْأَبْوَابُ
translation_english: -- everlasting Gardens with gates wide open for them

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَاكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ وَشَرَابٍ
translation_english: wherein they shall recline, wherein they shall ask for abundant fruit and drinks,

arabic: وَعِندَهُمْ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ أَتْرَابٌ
translation_english: and wherein there shall be with them well-matched, bashful mates.

arabic: هَـٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِيَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ
translation_english: All this is what you are promised for the Day of Judgement.

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَرِزْقُنَا مَا لَهُ مِن نَّفَادٍ
translation_english: This is Our provision for you, never to end.

arabic: هَـٰذَا ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلطَّاغِينَ لَشَرَّ مَآبٍ
translation_english: All this (is for the God-fearing). But for the transgressors, an evil resort awaits them --

arabic: جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا فَبِئْسَ الْمِهَادُ
translation_english: Hell, where they will be roasted. An evil place to dwell!

arabic: هَـٰذَا فَلْيَذُوقُوهُ حَمِيمٌ وَغَسَّاقٌ
translation_english: All this (is for them); so let them taste boiling water and pus,

arabic: وَآخَرُ مِن شَكْلِهِ أَزْوَاجٌ
translation_english: and other sufferings of the kind.

arabic: هَـٰذَا فَوْجٌ مُّقْتَحِمٌ مَّعَكُمْ ۖ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ صَالُو النَّارِ
translation_english: (Observing their followers advancing to Hell they will say, among themselves: “This is a troop rushing in to you. There is no welcome for them. They are destined to roast in the Fire.”

arabic: قَالُوا بَلْ أَنتُمْ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِكُمْ ۖ أَنتُمْ قَدَّمْتُمُوهُ لَنَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ الْقَرَارُ
translation_english: They will reply: “Rather, no welcome to you. (You will roast in Hell.) It is you who led us to this end. What an evil resort!”

arabic: قَالُوا رَبَّنَا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَـٰذَا فَزِدْهُ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا فِي النَّارِ
translation_english: They will say: “Our Lord, give twofold punishment in the Fire to him who has led us to this.”

arabic: وَقَالُوا مَا لَنَا لَا نَرَىٰ رِجَالًا كُنَّا نَعُدُّهُم مِّنَ الْأَشْرَارِ
translation_english: They will say to one another: “But why do we not see those whom we considered him among the wicked?

arabic: أَتَّخَذْنَاهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا أَمْ زَاغَتْ عَنْهُمُ الْأَبْصَارُ
translation_english: Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them; or have they disappeared from our sight?”

arabic: إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَحَقٌّ تَخَاصُمُ أَهْلِ النَّارِ
translation_english: Verily all this is true. This is how the inmates of the Fire will dispute among themselves.

arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَـٰهٍ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ
translation_english: Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am nothing but a warner. There is no deity but Allah, the One, the Supreme,

arabic: رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ
translation_english: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them, the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving.”

arabic: قُلْ هُوَ نَبَأٌ عَظِيمٌ
translation_english: Say: “This is a tiding of tremendous import

arabic: أَنتُمْ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضُونَ
translation_english: from which you are turning away.”

arabic: مَا كَانَ لِيَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ بِالْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
translation_english: (Tell them): “I had no knowledge of the High Council when they were disputing.

arabic: إِن يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ إِلَّا أَنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: I am told (about matters) by means of revelation only because I am a clear warner.”

arabic: إِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِّن طِينٍ
translation_english: When your Lord said to the angels: “Verily I am creating a human being from clay.

arabic: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ
translation_english: After I have created him and breathed into him of My spirit, fall you down, prostrating yourselves to him.”

arabic: فَسَجَدَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ
translation_english: Then the angels, all of them, prostrated themselves before Adam

arabic: إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ اسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
translation_english: except Iblis. He waxed proud and became one of the unbelievers.

arabic: قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسْجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقْتُ بِيَدَيَّ ۖ أَسْتَكْبَرْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ الْعَالِينَ
translation_english: The Lord said: “O Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating yourself before him whom I created of My Two Hands. Are you waxing proud, or fancy yourself to be too exalted?”

arabic: قَالَ أَنَا خَيْرٌ مِّنْهُ ۖ خَلَقْتَنِي مِن نَّارٍ وَخَلَقْتَهُ مِن طِينٍ
translation_english: He replied: “I am nobler than he. You created me from fire and created him from clay.”

arabic: قَالَ فَاخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ
translation_english: He said: “Get out of here; surely you are accursed,

arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ لَعْنَتِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ
translation_english: and My curse shall remain upon you till the Day of Resurrection.”

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
translation_english: Satan said: “My Lord, then grant me respite till the Day that they are raised up.”

arabic: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنظَرِينَ
translation_english: He said: “You are of those who have been granted respite

arabic: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ
translation_english: till the Day whose Hour I know.”

arabic: قَالَ فَبِعِزَّتِكَ لَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
translation_english: (Iblis) said: “By Your glory, I shall mislead them all

arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
translation_english: except those of Your servants, the chosen ones from amongst them.”

arabic: قَالَ فَالْحَقُّ وَالْحَقَّ أَقُولُ
translation_english: He (i.e. Allah) said: “This is the Truth -- and I only speak the Truth --

arabic: لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
translation_english: I will certainly fill the Gehenna with you and with all those among them who follow you.”

arabic: قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُتَكَلِّفِينَ
translation_english: (O Prophet), tell them: “I do not ask you for any recompense for the performance of this task; nor am I given to affectation.

arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: This is nothing but an Admonition for all people the world over.

arabic: وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ نَبَأَهُ بَعْدَ حِينٍ
translation_english: You will know the truth of the matter after a while.”

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَنزِيلُ الْكِتَابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ
translation_english: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

arabic: إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ بِالْحَقِّ فَاعْبُدِ اللَّهَ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ الدِّينَ
translation_english: (O Prophet), it is We Who have revealed this Book to you with Truth. So serve only Allah, consecrating your devotion to Him.

arabic: أَلَا لِلَّهِ الدِّينُ الْخَالِصُ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا مِن دُونِهِ أَوْلِيَاءَ مَا نَعْبُدُهُمْ إِلَّا لِيُقَرِّبُونَا إِلَى اللَّهِ زُلْفَىٰ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ فِي مَا هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي مَنْ هُوَ كَاذِبٌ كَفَّارٌ
translation_english: Lo, religion is exclusively devoted to Allah. Your religion is entirely consecrated to Him. As for those who have taken others than Allah for their guardians, (they say): “We worship them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah.” Allah will judge between them concerning what they differ about. Verily Allah does not guide anyone who is given to sheer lying, is an utter unbeliever.

arabic: لَّوْ أَرَادَ اللَّهُ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا لَّاصْطَفَىٰ مِمَّا يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ سُبْحَانَهُ ۖ هُوَ اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ
translation_english: If Allah had wanted to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen anyone He wanted out of those whom He creates. Glory be to Him (that He should have a son). He is Allah: the One, the Overpowering.

arabic: خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ يُكَوِّرُ اللَّيْلَ عَلَى النَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ النَّهَارَ عَلَى اللَّيْلِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي لِأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۗ أَلَا هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ
translation_english: He created the heavens and the earth with Truth, and He folds up the day over the night and folds up the night over the day. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each is running its course until an appointed time. Lo, He is the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving.

arabic: خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنْهَا زَوْجَهَا وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ الْأَنْعَامِ ثَمَانِيَةَ أَزْوَاجٍ ۚ يَخْلُقُكُمْ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ خَلْقًا مِّن بَعْدِ خَلْقٍ فِي ظُلُمَاتٍ ثَلَاثٍ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ ۖ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُصْرَفُونَ
translation_english: He it is Who created you from a single being, and He it is Who made from it its mate. He it is Who created for you eight heads of cattle in pairs. He creates you in your mothers' wombs, giving you one form after another in threefold depths of darkness. That, then, is Allah, your Lord. His is the kingdom. There is no god but He. So, whence are you being turned astray?

arabic: إِن تَكْفُرُوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ عَنكُمْ ۖ وَلَا يَرْضَىٰ لِعِبَادِهِ الْكُفْرَ ۖ وَإِن تَشْكُرُوا يَرْضَهُ لَكُمْ ۗ وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۗ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُم مَّرْجِعُكُمْ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
translation_english: If you disbelieve, know well that Allah has no need of you. Yet He does not like unbelief in His servants. But if you are thankful, your thankfulness will please Him. No one shall bear another's burden. You are destined to return to your Lord and He will tell you what you used to do. He is well aware even of what lies hidden in your breasts.

arabic: وَإِذَا مَسَّ الْإِنسَانَ ضُرٌّ دَعَا رَبَّهُ مُنِيبًا إِلَيْهِ ثُمَّ إِذَا خَوَّلَهُ نِعْمَةً مِّنْهُ نَسِيَ مَا كَانَ يَدْعُو إِلَيْهِ مِن قَبْلُ وَجَعَلَ لِلَّهِ أَندَادًا لِّيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِ ۚ قُلْ تَمَتَّعْ بِكُفْرِكَ قَلِيلًا ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ النَّارِ
translation_english: When any affliction befalls man, he cries out to his Lord, penitently turning to Him. But when his Lord bestows His favour upon him, he forgets the affliction regarding which he had cried out and sets up compeers to Allah that they may lead others astray from His Path. Say, (O Prophet): “Enjoy your unbelief for a while. Surely you will be among the inmates of the Fire.”

arabic: أَمَّنْ هُوَ قَانِتٌ آنَاءَ اللَّيْلِ سَاجِدًا وَقَائِمًا يَحْذَرُ الْآخِرَةَ وَيَرْجُو رَحْمَةَ رَبِّهِ ۗ قُلْ هَلْ يَسْتَوِي الَّذِينَ يَعْلَمُونَ وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ۗ إِنَّمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ
translation_english: Is such a person (preferable or he) who is obedient, and prostrates himself in the watches of the night, stands (in Prayer), is fearful of the Hereafter, and looks forward to the mercy of His Lord? Ask them: “Are those who know equal to those who do not know?” Only those endowed with understanding take heed.

arabic: قُلْ يَا عِبَادِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا رَبَّكُمْ ۚ لِلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا فِي هَـٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌ ۗ وَأَرْضُ اللَّهِ وَاسِعَةٌ ۗ إِنَّمَا يُوَفَّى الصَّابِرُونَ أَجْرَهُم بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
translation_english: Tell them (O Prophet): “O you servants of Mine who believe, have fear of your Lord. A good end awaits those who did good in this world. Allah's earth is spacious. Verily those who persevere shall be granted their reward beyond all reckoning.”

arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ اللَّهَ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ الدِّينَ
translation_english: Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am bidden to serve Allah, consecrating my devotion to Him,

arabic: وَأُمِرْتُ لِأَنْ أَكُونَ أَوَّلَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
translation_english: and I am bidden to be the first of those who surrender to Him.”

arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّي عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
translation_english: Say: “If I disobey my Lord, I fear the chastisement of an Awesome Day.”

arabic: قُلِ اللَّهَ أَعْبُدُ مُخْلِصًا لَّهُ دِينِي
translation_english: Say: “Allah alone shall I serve, consecrating my devotion to Him.

arabic: فَاعْبُدُوا مَا شِئْتُم مِّن دُونِهِ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ الْخَاسِرِينَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَأَهْلِيهِمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ أَلَا ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْخُسْرَانُ الْمُبِينُ
translation_english: So serve, apart from Him, whomsoever you please.” Say: “Behold, the real losers shall be those who will have lost their own selves and their kith and kin on the Day of Resurrection. Behold, that is the obvious loss.

arabic: لَهُم مِّن فَوْقِهِمْ ظُلَلٌ مِّنَ النَّارِ وَمِن تَحْتِهِمْ ظُلَلٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يُخَوِّفُ اللَّهُ بِهِ عِبَادَهُ ۚ يَا عِبَادِ فَاتَّقُونِ
translation_english: There shall be sheets of fire above them and beneath them. This is the end against which Allah warns His servants. So dread My wrath, O you servants of Mine!”

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ اجْتَنَبُوا الطَّاغُوتَ أَن يَعْبُدُوهَا وَأَنَابُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ لَهُمُ الْبُشْرَىٰ ۚ فَبَشِّرْ عِبَادِ
translation_english: (On the other hand), good tidings await those who eschew serving false gods and penitently return to Allah. (O Prophet), give good tidings to My servants,

arabic: الَّذِينَ يَسْتَمِعُونَ الْقَوْلَ فَيَتَّبِعُونَ أَحْسَنَهُ ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ هَدَاهُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ وَأُولَـٰئِكَ هُمْ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ
