translation_english: He it is Who restrained their hands from you, and your hands from them in the valley of Makkah, even though He had made you victorious against them. Allah was watching all that you did.

arabic: هُمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوكُمْ عَنِ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ وَالْهَدْيَ مَعْكُوفًا أَن يَبْلُغَ مَحِلَّهُ ۚ وَلَوْلَا رِجَالٌ مُّؤْمِنُونَ وَنِسَاءٌ مُّؤْمِنَاتٌ لَّمْ تَعْلَمُوهُمْ أَن تَطَئُوهُمْ فَتُصِيبَكُم مِّنْهُم مَّعَرَّةٌ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۖ لِّيُدْخِلَ اللَّهُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ لَوْ تَزَيَّلُوا لَعَذَّبْنَا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
translation_english: They are the ones who disbelieved and barred you from the Inviolable Mosque and prevented the animals you had designated for sacrifice from reaching the place of their offering. If it had not been for the believing men and believing women (who lived in Makkah and) whom you did not know, and had there not been the fear that you might trample on them and unwittingly incur blame on their account, (then fighting would not have been put to a stop. It was stopped so that) Allah may admit to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. Had those believers been separated from the rest, We would certainly have inflicted a grievous chastise-ment on those of them [i.e. the Makkans) who disbelieved.

arabic: إِذْ جَعَلَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ الْحَمِيَّةَ حَمِيَّةَ الْجَاهِلِيَّةِ فَأَنزَلَ اللَّهُ سَكِينَتَهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِ وَعَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَأَلْزَمَهُمْ كَلِمَةَ التَّقْوَىٰ وَكَانُوا أَحَقَّ بِهَا وَأَهْلَهَا ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمًا
translation_english: (This is why) when the unbelievers set in their hearts a fierce bigotry -- the bigotry of ignorance -- Allah bestowed inner peace upon His Messenger and upon the believers and made the word of piety binding on them. They were more deserving and worthier thereof. Allah has knowledge of everything.

arabic: لَّقَدْ صَدَقَ اللَّهُ رَسُولَهُ الرُّؤْيَا بِالْحَقِّ ۖ لَتَدْخُلُنَّ الْمَسْجِدَ الْحَرَامَ إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ آمِنِينَ مُحَلِّقِينَ رُءُوسَكُمْ وَمُقَصِّرِينَ لَا تَخَافُونَ ۖ فَعَلِمَ مَا لَمْ تَعْلَمُوا فَجَعَلَ مِن دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ فَتْحًا قَرِيبًا
translation_english: Allah indeed showed His Messenger the true vision, one fully in accord with reality. If Allah so wills you shall certainly enter the Inviolable Mosque, in full security, you will shave your heads and cut your hair short, and do so without any fear. He knew what you did not know, and He granted you a victory near at hand even before (the fulfilment of the vision).

arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُ بِالْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ الْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُ عَلَى الدِّينِ كُلِّهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا
translation_english: He it is Who sent His Messenger with the True Guidance and the Religion of Truth that He may make it prevail over every religion. Sufficient is Allah as a witness (to this).

arabic: مُّحَمَّدٌ رَّسُولُ اللَّهِ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ أَشِدَّاءُ عَلَى الْكُفَّارِ رُحَمَاءُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ تَرَاهُمْ رُكَّعًا سُجَّدًا يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًا مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضْوَانًا ۖ سِيمَاهُمْ فِي وُجُوهِهِم مِّنْ أَثَرِ السُّجُودِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مَثَلُهُمْ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ ۚ وَمَثَلُهُمْ فِي الْإِنجِيلِ كَزَرْعٍ أَخْرَجَ شَطْأَهُ فَآزَرَهُ فَاسْتَغْلَظَ فَاسْتَوَىٰ عَلَىٰ سُوقِهِ يُعْجِبُ الزُّرَّاعَ لِيَغِيظَ بِهِمُ الْكُفَّارَ ۗ وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ مِنْهُم مَّغْفِرَةً وَأَجْرًا عَظِيمًا
translation_english: Muhammad is Allah's Messenger, and those who are with him are firm with the unbelievers but compassionate with one another. You see them occupied in bowing and prostrating and in seeking Allah's bounty and good pleasure. They are distinguished from others by the marks of prostration on their faces. Thus are they described in the Torah. And their parable in the Gospel is that of a tilth that puts forth its shoot, then strengthens it so that it becomes stout and stands firmly on its stem. This is a sight pleasing to the sowers and one by which the unbelievers will be enraged. As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, Allah has promised them forgiveness and a great reward.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُقَدِّمُوا بَيْنَ يَدَيِ اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
translation_english: Believers, do not advance before Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَرْفَعُوا أَصْوَاتَكُمْ فَوْقَ صَوْتِ النَّبِيِّ وَلَا تَجْهَرُوا لَهُ بِالْقَوْلِ كَجَهْرِ بَعْضِكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ أَن تَحْبَطَ أَعْمَالُكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَشْعُرُونَ
translation_english: Believers, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and when speaking to him do not speak aloud as you speak aloud to one another, lest all your deeds are reduced to nothing without your even realising it.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَغُضُّونَ أَصْوَاتَهُمْ عِندَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ أُولَـٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ امْتَحَنَ اللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ ۚ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ
translation_english: The ones who lower their voices in the presence of the Messenger of Allah are those whose hearts Allah has tested for God-fearing. Theirs shall be forgiveness and a great reward.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُنَادُونَكَ مِن وَرَاءِ الْحُجُرَاتِ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
translation_english: Surely most of those who call out to you, (O Prophet), from behind the apartments, are devoid of understanding.

arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ صَبَرُوا حَتَّىٰ تَخْرُجَ إِلَيْهِمْ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَّهُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
translation_english: If they were patient until you went out to them, that would have been better for them. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِن جَاءَكُمْ فَاسِقٌ بِنَبَإٍ فَتَبَيَّنُوا أَن تُصِيبُوا قَوْمًا بِجَهَالَةٍ فَتُصْبِحُوا عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلْتُمْ نَادِمِينَ
translation_english: Believers, when an ungodly person brings to you a piece of news, carefully ascertain its truth, lest you should hurt a people unwittingly and thereafter repent at what you did.

arabic: وَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّ فِيكُمْ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ۚ لَوْ يُطِيعُكُمْ فِي كَثِيرٍ مِّنَ الْأَمْرِ لَعَنِتُّمْ وَلَـٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ حَبَّبَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْإِيمَانَ وَزَيَّنَهُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ وَكَرَّهَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْكُفْرَ وَالْفُسُوقَ وَالْعِصْيَانَ ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الرَّاشِدُونَ
translation_english: Know that Allah's Messenger is among you. Were he to follow you in many an affair, you yourselves would suffer. But Allah has endeared faith to you and has embellished it in your hearts, and has made unbelief and evil-doing and disobedience abhorrent to you. Such are those who are rightly guided,

arabic: فَضْلًا مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَنِعْمَةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
translation_english: by Allah's favour and bounty. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

arabic: وَإِن طَائِفَتَانِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ اقْتَتَلُوا فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَإِن بَغَتْ إِحْدَاهُمَا عَلَى الْأُخْرَىٰ فَقَاتِلُوا الَّتِي تَبْغِي حَتَّىٰ تَفِيءَ إِلَىٰ أَمْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ فَإِن فَاءَتْ فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَهُمَا بِالْعَدْلِ وَأَقْسِطُوا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُقْسِطِينَ
translation_english: If two parties of the believers happen to fight, make peace between them. But then, if one of them transgresses against the other, fight the one that transgresses until it reverts to Allah's command. And if it does revert, make peace between them with justice, and be equitable for Allah loves the equitable.

arabic: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِخْوَةٌ فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَ أَخَوَيْكُمْ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
translation_english: Surely the believers are none but brothers unto one another, so set things right between your brothers, and have fear of Allah that you may be shown mercy.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا يَسْخَرْ قَوْمٌ مِّن قَوْمٍ عَسَىٰ أَن يَكُونُوا خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَلَا نِسَاءٌ مِّن نِّسَاءٍ عَسَىٰ أَن يَكُنَّ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُنَّ ۖ وَلَا تَلْمِزُوا أَنفُسَكُمْ وَلَا تَنَابَزُوا بِالْأَلْقَابِ ۖ بِئْسَ الِاسْمُ الْفُسُوقُ بَعْدَ الْإِيمَانِ ۚ وَمَن لَّمْ يَتُبْ فَأُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
translation_english: Believers, let not a group (of men) scoff at another group, it may well be that the latter (at whom they scoff) are better than they; nor let a group of women scoff at another group, it may well be that the latter are better than they. And do not taunt one another, nor revile one another by nicknames. It is an evil thing to gain notoriety for ungodliness after belief. Those who do not repent are indeed the wrong-doers.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اجْتَنِبُوا كَثِيرًا مِّنَ الظَّنِّ إِنَّ بَعْضَ الظَّنِّ إِثْمٌ ۖ وَلَا تَجَسَّسُوا وَلَا يَغْتَب بَّعْضُكُم بَعْضًا ۚ أَيُحِبُّ أَحَدُكُمْ أَن يَأْكُلَ لَحْمَ أَخِيهِ مَيْتًا فَكَرِهْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ تَوَّابٌ رَّحِيمٌ
translation_english: Believers, avoid being excessively suspicious, for some suspicion is a sin. Do not spy, nor backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would surely detest it. Have fear of Allah. Surely Allah is much prone to accept repentance, is Most Compassionate.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاكُم مِّن ذَكَرٍ وَأُنثَىٰ وَجَعَلْنَاكُمْ شُعُوبًا وَقَبَائِلَ لِتَعَارَفُوا ۚ إِنَّ أَكْرَمَكُمْ عِندَ اللَّهِ أَتْقَاكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ خَبِيرٌ
translation_english: Human beings, We created you all from a male and a female, and made you into nations and tribes so that you may know one another. Verily the noblest of you in the sight of Allah is the most God-fearing of you. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.

arabic: قَالَتِ الْأَعْرَابُ آمَنَّا ۖ قُل لَّمْ تُؤْمِنُوا وَلَـٰكِن قُولُوا أَسْلَمْنَا وَلَمَّا يَدْخُلِ الْإِيمَانُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ ۖ وَإِن تُطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ لَا يَلِتْكُم مِّنْ أَعْمَالِكُمْ شَيْئًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
translation_english: The Bedouins say: “We believe.” (O Prophet), say to them: “You do not believe; you should rather say: 'We have submitted'”; for belief has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not diminish anything from the reward of any of your deeds. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

arabic: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَرْتَابُوا وَجَاهَدُوا بِأَمْوَالِهِمْ وَأَنفُسِهِمْ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الصَّادِقُونَ
translation_english: Indeed the ones possessed of true faith are those who believed in Allah and His Messenger and then they did not entertain any doubt and strove hard in the Way of Allah with their lives and their possessions. These are the truthful ones.

arabic: قُلْ أَتُعَلِّمُونَ اللَّهَ بِدِينِكُمْ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
translation_english: Say, (O Prophet), (to these pretenders to faith): “Are you apprising Allah of your faith? Allah knows all that is in the heavens and the earth. Allah has full knowledge of everything.”

arabic: يَمُنُّونَ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ أَسْلَمُوا ۖ قُل لَّا تَمُنُّوا عَلَيَّ إِسْلَامَكُم ۖ بَلِ اللَّهُ يَمُنُّ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ هَدَاكُمْ لِلْإِيمَانِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
translation_english: They count it as a favour to you that they accepted Islam. Say: “Do not regard your (accepting) Islam as a favour to me; rather, Allah has bestowed a favour on you by guiding you to faith, if you are truthful (in your claim to be believers).

arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ غَيْبَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بَصِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: Surely Allah knows every hidden thing of the heavens and the earth. Allah sees all that you do.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ق ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ الْمَجِيدِ
translation_english: Qaf. By the glorious Qur'an.

arabic: بَلْ عَجِبُوا أَن جَاءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ فَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَـٰذَا شَيْءٌ عَجِيبٌ
translation_english: Nay; they wondered that a warner should have come to them from among themselves. The unbelievers said: “This indeed is a strange thing.

arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌ بَعِيدٌ
translation_english: What! When we are dead and reduced to mere dust, (shall we be raised to life)? Such a return is far-fetched.”

arabic: قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا تَنقُصُ الْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَعِندَنَا كِتَابٌ حَفِيظٌ
translation_english: (Thus do they imagine, although) We know well what the earth takes away from them. With Us is a Record that preserves everything.

arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِي أَمْرٍ مَّرِيجٍ
translation_english: They gave the lie to the Truth when it came to them. So they are now in a state of great perplexity.

arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَنظُرُوا إِلَى السَّمَاءِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَاهَا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِن فُرُوجٍ
translation_english: Did they never observe the sky above them: how We built it and beautified it; and it has no cracks;

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ بَهِيجٍ
translation_english: and We have spread out the earth, and have set upon it firm mountains, and have caused it to bring out plants of all beauteous kinds?

arabic: تَبْصِرَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍ مُّنِيبٍ
translation_english: All these are to serve as eye openers and as a lesson to every being who is prone to turn (to the Truth).

arabic: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً مُّبَارَكًا فَأَنبَتْنَا بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ وَحَبَّ الْحَصِيدِ
translation_english: We also sent down blessed water from the heaven, wherewith We caused gardens and harvest-grain to grow,

arabic: وَالنَّخْلَ بَاسِقَاتٍ لَّهَا طَلْعٌ نَّضِيدٌ
translation_english: and tall palm-trees with their thickly-clustered spathes;

arabic: رِّزْقًا لِّلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ الْخُرُوجُ
translation_english: all this as sustenance for Our servants. And thus We do bring the dead land back to life with water. Such shall be the coming forth (of human beings from the earth).

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
translation_english: In the past Noah's people, and the people of Rass and Thamud gave the lie (to Messengers),

arabic: وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ وَإِخْوَانُ لُوطٍ
translation_english: and so did 'Ad, and Pharaoh and Lot's brethren,

arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
translation_english: and the people of Aykah, and the people of Tubba'. They all gave the lie to the Messengers. Thereafter My threat of chastisement against them was fulfilled.

arabic: أَفَعَيِينَا بِالْخَلْقِ الْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي لَبْسٍ مِّنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
translation_english: Did We, then, become worn out by the first creation? Not at all; but they are in doubt about a fresh creation.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِ نَفْسُهُ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ الْوَرِيدِ
translation_english: Surely We have created man, and We know the promptings of his heart, and We are nearer to him than even his jugular vein.

arabic: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى الْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ
translation_english: Moreover, there are two scribes, one each sitting on the right and the left, recording everything.

arabic: مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ
translation_english: He utters not a word, but there is a vigilant watcher at hand.

arabic: وَجَاءَتْ سَكْرَةُ الْمَوْتِ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
translation_english: Lo, the agony of death has indeed come with the Truth. That is what you had sought to avoid.

arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْوَعِيدِ
translation_english: And then the Trumpet was blown. This is the day of the promised chastisement.

arabic: وَجَاءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّعَهَا سَائِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ
translation_english: Everyone has come, each attended by one who will drive him on, and another who will bear witness.

arabic: لَّقَدْ كُنتَ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنكَ غِطَاءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ الْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ
translation_english: You were heedless of this. Now We have removed your veil and so your vision today is sharp.

arabic: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُ هَـٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ
translation_english: His companion said: “Here is he who was in my charge.”

arabic: أَلْقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
translation_english: The command was given: “Cast into Hell every hardened, stubborn unbeliever,

arabic: مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ مُّرِيبٍ
translation_english: who hinders good, exceeds the limits, is immersed in doubts,

arabic: الَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا آخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِي الْعَذَابِ الشَّدِيدِ
translation_english: and has set up another deity with Allah. Hurl him into the grievous torment.”

arabic: قَالَ قَرِينُهُ رَبَّنَا مَا أَطْغَيْتُهُ وَلَـٰكِن كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ
translation_english: His companion said: “I did not incite him to rebel; he was far gone into error of his own accord.”

arabic: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا لَدَيَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُم بِالْوَعِيدِ
translation_english: (It was said): “Do not remonstrate in My presence. I had warned you.

arabic: مَا يُبَدَّلُ الْقَوْلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَا أَنَا بِظَلَّامٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
translation_english: My Word is not changed; and never do I inflict the least wrong upon My servants.”

arabic: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ امْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِن مَّزِيدٍ
translation_english: On that Day We shall ask Hell: “Are you full?” And it will reply: “Are there any more?”

arabic: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ
translation_english: And when Paradise shall be brought close to the God-fearing, and will no longer be far away,

arabic: هَـٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ
translation_english: it will be said: “This is what you were promised, a promise made to everyone who turned much (to Allah) and was watchful of his conduct,

arabic: مَّنْ خَشِيَ الرَّحْمَـٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَجَاءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُّنِيبٍ
translation_english: to everyone who feared the Merciful One though He is beyond the reach of perception, to everyone who has come with a heart ever wont to turn (to Him).

arabic: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُلُودِ
translation_english: Enter this Paradise in peace.” That will be the Day of Eternity.

arabic: لَهُم مَّا يَشَاءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ
translation_english: Therein they shall get whatever they desire; and with Us there is even more.

arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا فِي الْبِلَادِ هَلْ مِن مَّحِيصٍ
translation_english: How many a nation did We destroy before them that were stronger in prowess than these. They searched about the lands of the world. But could they find a refuge?

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ
translation_english: Verily there is a lesson in this for everyone who has a (sound) heart and who listens with an attentive mind.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٍ
translation_english: We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, and weariness did not even touch Us.

arabic: فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ الْغُرُوبِ
translation_english: Hence bear with patience whatever they say, and celebrate your Lord's glory before the rising of the sun and before its setting;

arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَارَ السُّجُودِ
translation_english: and in the night, too, celebrate His glory, in the wake of prostration.

arabic: وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
translation_english: Hearken on the Day when the caller will call from a place nearby,

arabic: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ الصَّيْحَةَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُرُوجِ
translation_english: the Day when they shall hear the Blast in truth. That will be the Day (for the dead) to come forth.

arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا الْمَصِيرُ
translation_english: Surely it is We Who give life and cause death, and to Us shall all return

arabic: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ الْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ
translation_english: on the Day when the earth will be rent asunder and people, rising from it, will hasten forth. To assemble them all will be easy for Us.

arabic: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَا أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
translation_english: (O Prophet), We are well aware of what they say; and you are not required to force things on them. So exhort with the Qur'an all those who fear My warning.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا
translation_english: By the winds which scatter dust,

arabic: فَالْحَامِلَاتِ وِقْرًا
translation_english: which carry clouds laden with water,

arabic: فَالْجَارِيَاتِ يُسْرًا
translation_english: which then smoothly speed along,

arabic: فَالْمُقَسِّمَاتِ أَمْرًا
translation_english: and execute the great task of apportioning (rainfall):

arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ
translation_english: surely what you are being warned against is true,

arabic: وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ
translation_english: and the Judgement shall doubtlessly take place.

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْحُبُكِ
translation_english: By the heaven with its numerous forms:

arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِي قَوْلٍ مُّخْتَلِفٍ
translation_english: surely you are at variance (about the Hereafter);

arabic: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ
translation_english: though only those who are averse to the Truth will turn away from (believing in it).

arabic: قُتِلَ الْخَرَّاصُونَ
translation_english: Doomed are the conjecturers

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ
translation_english: who are steeped in ignorance and heedlessness.

arabic: يَسْأَلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
translation_english: They ask: “When will the Day of Judgement be?”

arabic: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى النَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ
translation_english: It will be the Day when they shall be scourged by the Fire

arabic: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَـٰذَا الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
translation_english: (and be told): “Taste your ordeal! This is what you were seeking to hasten.”

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
translation_english: As for the God-fearing, they shall be in the midst of gardens and fountains,

arabic: آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
translation_english: joyously receiving what their Lord will have granted them. Verily they did good works before (the coming of this Day):

arabic: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
translation_english: they used to sleep but little by night,

arabic: وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
translation_english: and would ask for forgiveness at dawn,

arabic: وَفِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِّلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ
translation_english: and in their wealth there was a rightful share for him who would ask and for the destitute.

arabic: وَفِي الْأَرْضِ آيَاتٌ لِّلْمُوقِنِينَ
translation_english: There are many Signs on earth for those of sure faith,

arabic: وَفِي أَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: and also in your own selves. Do you not see?

arabic: وَفِي السَّمَاءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
translation_english: And in heaven is your provision and also what you are being promised.

arabic: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ
translation_english: So, by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, this is certainly true, as true as the fact of your speaking.

arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ
translation_english: (O Prophet), did the story of Abraham's honoured guests reach you?

arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
translation_english: When they came to him, they said: “Peace”; he said: “Peace also be to you; (you seem to be) a group of strangers.”

arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ
translation_english: Then he went back to his family and brought a fat roasted calf

arabic: فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
translation_english: and laid it before them, saying: “Will you not eat?”

arabic: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ
translation_english: Then he became afraid of them. They said: “Fear not,” and announced to him the good news of (the birth of) a boy endowed with knowledge.

arabic: فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ
translation_english: So hearing his wife went forth shouting. She struck her face and exclaimed: “A barren old woman am I.”

arabic: قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ
translation_english: They said: “So has your Lord said (that you shall have a boy). Surely He is Most Wise, All-Knowing.”

arabic: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ
translation_english: Abraham said: “Envoys (of Allah), what is your errand?”

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
translation_english: They replied: “Behold, we have been sent to a wicked people

arabic: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن طِينٍ
translation_english: that we may unleash a shower of clay-stones

arabic: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ
translation_english: marked by your Lord upon those who go beyond the limits.”

arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Then We evacuated there from all the believers

arabic: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِّنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
translation_english: – and We did not find there any, apart from a single house of Muslims –

arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
translation_english: and We left therein a Sign for those who fear the grievous chastisement.

arabic: وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: There is also a Sign for you in the story of Moses when We sent him with a clear authority to Pharaoh.

arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
translation_english: But Pharaoh turned away, showing arrogance on account of his power, and said (about Moses): “He is either a sorcerer or a madman.”

arabic: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
translation_english: So We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea. He became an object of much blame.

arabic: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ
translation_english: There is also a Sign for you in (the story of) Ad, when We let loose upon them an ominous wind

arabic: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ
translation_english: that left nothing that it came upon without reducing it to rubble.

arabic: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
translation_english: There is also a Sign for you in (the story of) Thamud. They were told: “Enjoy yourselves for a while.”

arabic: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
translation_english: But they brazenly disobeyed their Lord's command, and then a sudden chastisement overtook them while they looked on.

arabic: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِن قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنتَصِرِينَ
translation_english: They were unable even to stand up or protect themselves.

arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
translation_english: Before all these We destroyed the people of Noah: they were a wicked people.

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
translation_english: And heaven – We made it with Our Own Power and We have the Power to do so.

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ الْمَاهِدُونَ
translation_english: And the earth – We spread it out, and how well have We smoothed it!

arabic: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
translation_english: And of everything We have created pairs; perhaps you will take heed.

arabic: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: Flee, therefore, to Allah. Surely I am a clear warner to you from Him;

arabic: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: and do not set up any deity with Allah. Surely I am a clear warner to you from Him.

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
translation_english: Thus has it been (in the past): never did a Messenger come to the nations that preceded them but they said: “(He is) a sorcerer, or a mad-man.”

arabic: أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
translation_english: Have they arrived at a common understanding concerning this? No; but they are a people given to transgression.

arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَا أَنتَ بِمَلُومٍ
translation_english: So turn your attention away from them; you shall incur no blame.

arabic: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ الذِّكْرَىٰ تَنفَعُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
translation_english: Do, however, keep exhorting them; for exhortation benefits those endowed with faith.

arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ
translation_english: I created the jinn and humans for nothing else but that they may serve Me;

arabic: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُم مِّن رِّزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَن يُطْعِمُونِ
translation_english: I desire from them no provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ
translation_english: Surely Allah is the Bestower of all provision, the Lord of all power, the Strong.

arabic: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِّثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
translation_english: The wrong-doers shall receive a portion of the chastisements as their fellows (of yore). So let them not rush Me.

arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
translation_english: Woe, then, betide those who disbelieved in that Day of theirs which they are being asked to hold in dread.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالطُّورِ
translation_english: By the Mount,

arabic: وَكِتَابٍ مَّسْطُورٍ
translation_english: and the Book inscribed

arabic: فِي رَقٍّ مَّنشُورٍ
translation_english: on fine parchment;

arabic: وَالْبَيْتِ الْمَعْمُورِ
translation_english: by the much-frequented House,

arabic: وَالسَّقْفِ الْمَرْفُوعِ
translation_english: by the elevated canopy;

arabic: وَالْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ
translation_english: and by the swelling sea:

arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَاقِعٌ
translation_english: verily your Lord's chastisement shall come to pass,

arabic: مَّا لَهُ مِن دَافِعٍ
translation_english: none can avert that.

arabic: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ السَّمَاءُ مَوْرًا
translation_english: (It shall come to pass) on the Day when the heaven will convulse in a great convulsion,

arabic: وَتَسِيرُ الْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا
translation_english: and the mountains shall violently fly about.

arabic: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe, then, on that Day to those who give the lie (to this Message)

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ
translation_english: and amuse themselves with vain argumentation.

arabic: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
translation_english: On the Day when they shall be thrust into Hell with a violent thrust (and shall be told):

arabic: هَـٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation_english: “This is the Hell which you used to give the lie to.”

arabic: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَـٰذَا أَمْ أَنتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: Is this, then, any feat of magic or are you unable to see?

arabic: اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: Go now and burn in it. It is all the same whether you bear it patiently or do not bear it with patience. You are only being recompensed for your deeds.”

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ
translation_english: Surely the God-fearing shall be in Gardens and bliss,

arabic: فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ
translation_english: enjoying what Allah will have endowed them with; and their Lord will have saved them from the torment of the Blazing Fire.

arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: (They will be told): “Eat and drink to your hearts' content as a reward for your deeds.”

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
translation_english: The God-fearing shall be reclining on couches facing each other, and We shall wed them to maidens with large, beautiful eyes.

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُم مِّنْ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ
translation_english: We shall unite the believers with those descendants of theirs who followed them in their faith, and shall not deny them any part of the reward for their good deeds. Every person is pledged to what he did.

arabic: وَأَمْدَدْنَاهُم بِفَاكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
translation_english: We shall provide them in abundance with all kinds of fruit and meat, whatever they may desire.

arabic: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ
translation_english: They shall pass on to one another a cup that will incite neither levity nor sin.

arabic: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَّهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
translation_english: Youths as fair as hidden pearls will be set apart to wait upon them; they will be running to and fro to serve them.

arabic: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
translation_english: They will turn to one another and ask (regarding the past events).

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
translation_english: They will say: “When we were living before among our kinsfolk we lived in constant fear (of Allah's displeasure).

arabic: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ
translation_english: Then Allah graced us with His favour and saved us from the chastisement of the scorching wind.

arabic: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ
translation_english: Formerly we had always prayed to Him. Surely He is Most Benign, Most Compassionate.”

arabic: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ
translation_english: So exhort (them, O Prophet), for by your Lord's Grace, you are neither a soothsayer nor a madman.

arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ
translation_english: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await an adverse turn of fortune.”

arabic: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
translation_english: Tell them: “Wait; I too am waiting with you.”

arabic: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُم بِهَـٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
translation_english: Do their minds prompt them to say such things, or are they a people immersed in transgression?”

arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَل لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
translation_english: Do they say: “He has himself fabricated the Qur'an?” No; the truth is that they are altogether averse to believing.

arabic: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِّثْلِهِ إِن كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
translation_english: (If they are truthful in this), then let them produce a discourse of similar splendour.

arabic: أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ
translation_english: Did they come into being without any creator? Or were they their own creators?

arabic: أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
translation_english: Or is it they who created the heavens and the earth? No; the truth is that they lack sure faith.

arabic: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ
translation_english: Or do they have your Lord's treasures in their keeping? Or have absolute authority over them?

arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُم بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
translation_english: Or do they have a ladder whereon they can climb and attempt to listen (to what is transpiring in the Higher Realm)? Then, let any of them who has listened to it produce a clear proof of it.

arabic: أَمْ لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَكُمُ الْبَنُونَ
translation_english: Or does Allah have daughters whereas you have sons?

arabic: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
translation_english: Or is it that you ask of them any recompense so that they should fear to be weighed down under the burden of debt?

arabic: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
translation_english: Or is it that they have access to (the Truths in) the realm beyond sense-perception which they are writing down?

arabic: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ
translation_english: Or are they contriving a stratagem against you? If so, that stratagem will rebound against the unbelievers.

arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
translation_english: Do they have any god other than Allah? Exalted be Allah above whatever they associate (with Him in His Divinity).

arabic: وَإِن يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَّرْكُومٌ
translation_english: (So obstinate are they that) even if they were to see some fragments of the sky falling down they would still say: “It is only a mass of cloud.”

arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ
translation_english: So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs when they shall be struck down,

arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
translation_english: when their stratagem shall be of no avail to them, nor shall they be succoured.

arabic: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: Surely a chastisement awaits the wrong-doers even before the coming of that Day; but most of them do not know.

arabic: وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
translation_english: Be patient, then, (O Prophet), until the judgement of your Lord comes. For surely you are before Our eyes. And celebrate the praise of your Lord when you rise,

arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَارَ النُّجُومِ
translation_english: and also celebrate His praise at night, and at the retreat of the stars.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالنَّجْمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ
translation_english: By the star when it sets:

arabic: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمْ وَمَا غَوَىٰ
translation_english: your companion has neither strayed nor is he deluded;

arabic: وَمَا يَنطِقُ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ
translation_english: nor does he speak out of his desire.

arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحْيٌ يُوحَىٰ
translation_english: This is nothing but a revelation that is conveyed to him,

arabic: عَلَّمَهُ شَدِيدُ الْقُوَىٰ
translation_english: something that a very powerful one has imparted to him,

arabic: ذُو مِرَّةٍ فَاسْتَوَىٰ
translation_english: one endowed with immense wisdom. He came forth and stood poised,

arabic: وَهُوَ بِالْأُفُقِ الْأَعْلَىٰ
translation_english: being on the higher horizon.

arabic: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ
translation_english: Then he drew near and hung above suspended,

arabic: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أَوْ أَدْنَىٰ
translation_english: until he was two bows' length away, or nearer.

arabic: فَأَوْحَىٰ إِلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ مَا أَوْحَىٰ
translation_english: Then he revealed to Allah's servant whatever he had to reveal.

arabic: مَا كَذَبَ الْفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰ
translation_english: His heart added no untruth to what he saw.

arabic: أَفَتُمَارُونَهُ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ
translation_english: Are you, then, going to contend with him regarding what he sees with his eyes?

arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ نَزْلَةً أُخْرَىٰ
translation_english: Indeed he saw him a second time,

arabic: عِندَ سِدْرَةِ الْمُنتَهَىٰ
translation_english: by the lote-tree at the farthest boundary,

arabic: عِندَهَا جَنَّةُ الْمَأْوَىٰ
translation_english: near which is the Garden of Abode.

arabic: إِذْ يَغْشَى السِّدْرَةَ مَا يَغْشَىٰ
translation_english: (This was) when the lote-tree was covered with that which covered it.

arabic: مَا زَاغَ الْبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ
translation_english: His eye did not waver, nor did it stray,

arabic: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِ الْكُبْرَىٰ
translation_english: and he certainly saw some of the greatest Signs of His Lord.

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ اللَّاتَ وَالْعُزَّىٰ
translation_english: Have you ever thought about al-Lat and al-Uzza,

arabic: وَمَنَاةَ الثَّالِثَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ
translation_english: and about the third deity, al-Manat?

arabic: أَلَكُمُ الذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ الْأُنثَىٰ
translation_english: Shall you have the male issues, and He the female issues?

arabic: تِلْكَ إِذًا قِسْمَةٌ ضِيزَىٰ
translation_english: That is indeed an unfair division!

arabic: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا أَسْمَاءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَا أَنتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُم مَّا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَانٍ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى الْأَنفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ الْهُدَىٰ
translation_english: These are nothing but names that you and your forefathers have invented, for which Allah has sent down no authority. They are merely following their conjectures and their carnal desires although guidance has come to them from their Lord.

arabic: أَمْ لِلْإِنسَانِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ
translation_english: Does man imagine that whatever he wishes for is right for him?

arabic: فَلِلَّهِ الْآخِرَةُ وَالْأُولَىٰ
translation_english: To Allah belong both the Next World and the present.

arabic: وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ لَا تُغْنِي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا إِلَّا مِن بَعْدِ أَن يَأْذَنَ اللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَاءُ وَيَرْضَىٰ
translation_english: Numerous are the angels in the heavens; yet their intercession shall be of no avail, except in regard to those whom He grants the leave of intercession and whose plea He is pleased to accept.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ الْأُنثَىٰ
translation_english: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give angels the names of females,

arabic: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِي مِنَ الْحَقِّ شَيْئًا
translation_english: although they have no knowledge regarding that. They only follow their conjecture and conjecture can never take the place of the Truth.

arabic: فَأَعْرِضْ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
translation_english: So leave alone those who turn away from the remembrance of Us and who seek nothing but the life of the world –

arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُم مِّنَ الْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ
translation_english: that being the utmost of their knowledge. Surely your Lord fully knows those who have strayed away from His Path and He also fully knows those who are rightly guided.

arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَسَاءُوا بِمَا عَمِلُوا وَيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا بِالْحُسْنَى
translation_english: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil-doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

arabic: الَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَائِرَ الْإِثْمِ وَالْفَوَاحِشَ إِلَّا اللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَاسِعُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ الْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوا أَنفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اتَّقَىٰ
translation_english: on those who avoid grave sins and shameful deeds, even if they may sometimes stumble into lesser offences. Surely your Lord is abounding in His Forgiveness. Very well is He aware of you since He produced you from the earth, and while you were still in your mothers' wombs and not yet born. So do not boastfully claim yourselves to be purified. He fully knows those that are truly Godfearing.

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ
translation_english: (O Prophet), did you see him who turned away (from the Path of Allah),

arabic: وَأَعْطَىٰ قَلِيلًا وَأَكْدَىٰ
translation_english: who gave a little, and then stopped?

arabic: أَعِندَهُ عِلْمُ الْغَيْبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰ
translation_english: Does he have any knowledge of the world beyond the ken of sense-perception, and therefore, clearly sees (the Truth)?

arabic: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
translation_english: Has he not been informed of what is in the Scrolls of Moses,

arabic: وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ الَّذِي وَفَّىٰ
translation_english: and of Abraham, who lived up to the trust?

arabic: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ
translation_english: “That no bearer of a burden shall bear the burden of another,

arabic: وَأَن لَّيْسَ لِلْإِنسَانِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
translation_english: and that man shall have nothing but what he has striven for,

arabic: وَأَنَّ سَعْيَهُ سَوْفَ يُرَىٰ
translation_english: and that (the result of) his striving shall soon be seen,

arabic: ثُمَّ يُجْزَاهُ الْجَزَاءَ الْأَوْفَىٰ
translation_english: and that he shall then be fully recompensed,

arabic: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الْمُنتَهَىٰ
translation_english: and that the final end is with your Lord,

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَضْحَكَ وَأَبْكَىٰ
translation_english: and that He it is Who causes people to laugh and to cry,

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحْيَا
translation_english: and that He it is Who causes death and grants life,

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ خَلَقَ الزَّوْجَيْنِ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنثَىٰ
translation_english: and He it is Who created the two kinds, the male and the female,

arabic: مِن نُّطْفَةٍ إِذَا تُمْنَىٰ
translation_english: from a drop of sperm when it was emitted,

arabic: وَأَنَّ عَلَيْهِ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ
translation_english: and that it is for Him to grant the second life,

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَغْنَىٰ وَأَقْنَىٰ
translation_english: that He it is Who bestowed wealth and riches,

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ رَبُّ الشِّعْرَىٰ
translation_english: that He is the Lord of Sirius,

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ أَهْلَكَ عَادًا الْأُولَىٰ
translation_english: that He it is Who destroyed the ancient 'Ad,

arabic: وَثَمُودَ فَمَا أَبْقَىٰ
translation_english: and Thamud, leaving no trace of them,

arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
translation_english: and that He it is Who destroyed the people of Noah before for they were much given to iniquity and transgression.

arabic: وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَةَ أَهْوَىٰ
translation_english: And He brought perdition upon the subverted cities

arabic: فَغَشَّاهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ
translation_english: and caused them to be covered with that which He covered them with.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ
translation_english: So, which of your Lord's bounties will you doubt?”

arabic: هَـٰذَا نَذِيرٌ مِّنَ النُّذُرِ الْأُولَىٰ
translation_english: This is a warning among the warnings of yore.

arabic: أَزِفَتِ الْآزِفَةُ
translation_english: The imminent Hour has drawn near,

arabic: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
translation_english: and none but Allah can avert it.

arabic: أَفَمِنْ هَـٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ تَعْجَبُونَ
translation_english: Will you, then, wonder at this?

arabic: وَتَضْحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبْكُونَ
translation_english: Will you laugh at it rather than weep?

arabic: وَأَنتُمْ سَامِدُونَ
translation_english: Will you occupy yourselves simply in merriment?

arabic: فَاسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ وَاعْبُدُوا ۩
translation_english: Prostrate yourselves before Allah, and serve Him.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْتَرَبَتِ السَّاعَةُ وَانشَقَّ الْقَمَرُ
translation_english: The Hour of Resurrection drew near and the moon split asunder.

arabic: وَإِن يَرَوْا آيَةً يُعْرِضُوا وَيَقُولُوا سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ
translation_english: (Regardless of any Signs these people see), they turn away and say: “This is an ongoing sorcery.”

arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
translation_english: They also gave the lie to (the splitting asunder of the moon) and only followed their desires. Yet everything is destined to reach an end.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُم مِّنَ الْأَنبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
translation_english: Surely there came to them narratives (of the ancient nations) that should suffice to deter (them from transgression),

arabic: حِكْمَةٌ بَالِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ النُّذُرُ
translation_english: narratives that are full of consummate wisdom. But warnings do not avail them.

arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ الدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيْءٍ نُّكُرٍ
translation_english: So turn away from them, (O Prophet). On the Day when a caller shall call them to a thing most terrible,

arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَارُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُّنتَشِرٌ
translation_english: with down-cast eyes they shall go forth from their graves, as though they were scattered locusts.

arabic: مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى الدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ الْكَافِرُونَ هَـٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ
translation_english: They shall be hurrying forth towards the caller, and the unbelievers (who had once denied this Day), will say: “This is a woeful Day.”

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا مَجْنُونٌ وَازْدُجِرَ
translation_english: Before them Noah's people also gave the lie (to his Message). They rejected Our servant as a liar, saying: “He is a madman”; and he was rebuffed.

arabic: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَغْلُوبٌ فَانتَصِرْ
translation_english: Then he called upon His Lord: “Verily I am vanquished; so come You to my aid.”

arabic: فَفَتَحْنَا أَبْوَابَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَاءٍ مُّنْهَمِرٍ
translation_english: Thereupon We opened the gates of the sky for water to pour down,

arabic: وَفَجَّرْنَا الْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَالْتَقَى الْمَاءُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ
translation_english: and We made the earth burst forth with springs, and all this water converged to fulfil that which had been decreed.

arabic: وَحَمَلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَاحٍ وَدُسُرٍ
translation_english: And We bore Noah on the vessel built of planks and nails,

arabic: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
translation_english: which sailed on under Our supervision: a reward for him who had been shown ingratitude.

arabic: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَاهَا آيَةً فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
translation_english: And We left the Ark as a Sign. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation_english: So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!

arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
translation_english: We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation_english: 'Ad also gave the lie (to Hud). So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِي يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُّسْتَمِرٍّ
translation_english: We sent a tumultuous wind against them on a day of unremitting misfortune,

arabic: تَنزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ
translation_english: which tore people away and hurled them as though they were trunks of uprooted palm-trees.

arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation_english: So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!

arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
translation_english: We have made the Qur'an easy to derive lessons from. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِالنُّذُرِ
translation_english: Thamud gave the lie to the warnings,

arabic: فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرًا مِّنَّا وَاحِدًا نَّتَّبِعُهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَّفِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
translation_english: saying: “Are we to follow a single mortal, one from among ourselves? If we do that, we shall surely be in error and folly.

arabic: أَأُلْقِيَ الذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِن بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ
translation_english: Was there none but he to whom the Reminder could be vouchsafed excluding all others? Nay; he is an insolent liar.”

arabic: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَّنِ الْكَذَّابُ الْأَشِرُ
translation_english: (We told Our Messenger): “Tomorrow they shall know who is the insolent liar.

arabic: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُو النَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَّهُمْ فَارْتَقِبْهُمْ وَاصْطَبِرْ
translation_english: We shall send the she-camel as a trial for them; so watch their end with patience.

arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ قِسْمَةٌ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُّحْتَضَرٌ
translation_english: Let them know that the water should be divided between them and the she-camel, each availing their turn.”

arabic: فَنَادَوْا صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
translation_english: Eventually, they summoned their companion, and he undertook the (outrageous) task and hamstrung the she-camel.

arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation_english: So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ
translation_english: Behold, We sent a single Blast against them, and they became like the trampled twigs of a sheep pen-builder.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
translation_english: Surely We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ بِالنُّذُرِ
translation_english: Lot's people also gave the lie to the warnings,

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَّجَّيْنَاهُم بِسَحَرٍ
translation_english: and behold, We let loose upon them a tempest which rained stones upon them, except upon Lot's household whom We rescued in the last hours of the night

arabic: نِّعْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَن شَكَرَ
translation_english: as a favour from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَنذَرَهُم بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا بِالنُّذُرِ
translation_english: Surely Lot warned his people that We shall seize them (with Our chastisement), but they doubted the warnings.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِ فَطَمَسْنَا أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation_english: Then they even solicited his guests from him, whereupon We blotted out their eyes, (telling them): “Now have a taste of My chastisement and My warnings.”

arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُم بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
translation_english: Indeed an abiding chastisement came upon them in the morning.

arabic: فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation_english: So have a taste of My chastisement and My warnings.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
translation_english: Surely We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَ آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ النُّذُرُ
translation_english: Warnings also came to the Pharaonites,

arabic: كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَاهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
translation_english: but they gave the lie to Our Signs, to all of them. Thereupon We seized them with the seizing of the Most Mighty, the Most Powerful.

arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أُولَـٰئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَاءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ
translation_english: Are your unbelievers (of Makkah) any better than they? Or have you been granted any immunity in the Scriptures?

arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُّنتَصِرٌ
translation_english: Or do they say: “We are a strong legion, strong enough for victory?”

arabic: سَيُهْزَمُ الْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ الدُّبُرَ
translation_english: Soon shall this legion be routed and shall turn their backs and flee.

arabic: بَلِ السَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
translation_english: Nay; the Hour of Doom is their appointed time, and the Hour shall be more calamitous and bitter.

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُجْرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
translation_english: The evil-doers are victims of error and madness.

arabic: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِي النَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ
translation_english: There shall come a Day when they will be dragged on their faces into the Fire and will be told: “Now taste the flame of Hell.”

arabic: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَاهُ بِقَدَرٍ
translation_english: We have created everything in a determined measure.

arabic: وَمَا أَمْرُنَا إِلَّا وَاحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍ بِالْبَصَرِ
translation_english: Our command consists of only one Word which is carried out in the twinkling of an eye.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
translation_english: We did indeed destroy many like you. Is there, then, any who will heed?

arabic: وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِي الزُّبُرِ
translation_english: All their deeds are recorded in the Scrolls;

arabic: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُّسْتَطَرٌ
translation_english: everything large or small, is duly inscribed.

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
translation_english: Surely those who shun disobedience will dwell amidst Gardens and running streams

arabic: فِي مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
translation_english: where they will be honourably seated in the presence of a King, Mighty in Power.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الرَّحْمَـٰنُ
translation_english: The Merciful One

arabic: عَلَّمَ الْقُرْآنَ
translation_english: has taught the Qur'an,

arabic: خَلَقَ الْإِنسَانَ
translation_english: has created man,

arabic: عَلَّمَهُ الْبَيَانَ
translation_english: and has taught him articulate speech.

arabic: الشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ بِحُسْبَانٍ
translation_english: The sun and the moon follow a reckoning,

arabic: وَالنَّجْمُ وَالشَّجَرُ يَسْجُدَانِ
translation_english: and the stars and the trees all prostrate themselves,

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ الْمِيزَانَ
translation_english: and He has raised up the heaven and has set a balance

arabic: أَلَّا تَطْغَوْا فِي الْمِيزَانِ
translation_english: that you may not transgress in the balance,

arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا الْوَزْنَ بِالْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا الْمِيزَانَ
translation_english: but weigh things equitably and skimp not in the balance.

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلْأَنَامِ
translation_english: And He has set up the earth for all beings.

arabic: فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَالنَّخْلُ ذَاتُ الْأَكْمَامِ
translation_english: Therein are fruit and palm-trees with their dates in sheaths,

arabic: وَالْحَبُّ ذُو الْعَصْفِ وَالرَّيْحَانُ
translation_english: and a variety of corn with both husk and grain.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the bounties of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: خَلَقَ الْإِنسَانَ مِن صَلْصَالٍ كَالْفَخَّارِ
translation_english: He has created man from dry, rotten clay like the potter's,

arabic: وَخَلَقَ الْجَانَّ مِن مَّارِجٍ مِّن نَّارٍ
translation_english: and has created the jinn from the flame of fire.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the wonders of your Lord's power will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقَيْنِ وَرَبُّ الْمَغْرِبَيْنِ
translation_english: Lord of the two easts and of the two wests is He.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the powers of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ
translation_english: He unleashed the two seas so that they merge together,

arabic: بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌ لَّا يَبْغِيَانِ
translation_english: and yet there is a barrier between them which they may not overstep.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the wonders of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمَا اللُّؤْلُؤُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ
translation_english: From these seas come forth pearls and coral.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the wonders of your Lord's power will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: وَلَهُ الْجَوَارِ الْمُنشَآتُ فِي الْبَحْرِ كَالْأَعْلَامِ
translation_english: His are the ships, towering on the sea like mountains.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْهَا فَانٍ
translation_english: All that is on earth will perish,

arabic: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
translation_english: only the Person of your Lord, full of majesty and splendour, will endure.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: So which of the wonders of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: يَسْأَلُهُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأْنٍ
translation_english: All in the heavens and the earth entreat Him for their needs; a new, mighty task engages Him each day.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's laudable attributes will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: سَنَفْرُغُ لَكُمْ أَيُّهَ الثَّقَلَانِ
translation_english: O you twain, who are a burden (on the earth), We shall attend to you and call you to account.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: (We shall then see), which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنسِ إِنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَن تَنفُذُوا مِنْ أَقْطَارِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ فَانفُذُوا ۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَانٍ
translation_english: O company of jinn and men, if you have the power to go beyond the bounds of the heavens and the earth, go beyond them! Yet you will be unable to go beyond them for that requires infinite power.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌ مِّن نَّارٍ وَنُحَاسٌ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
translation_english: (If you so venture) a flame of fire and smoke shall be lashed at you, which you shall be unable to withstand.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: فَإِذَا انشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَالدِّهَانِ
translation_english: (What will happen) when the heaven will be split asunder and will become crimson like leather?

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُسْأَلُ عَن ذَنبِهِ إِنسٌ وَلَا جَانٌّ
translation_english: On that Day there will be no need to ask either men or jinn about their sins.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: (We shall see) which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: يُعْرَفُ الْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَاهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِالنَّوَاصِي وَالْأَقْدَامِ
translation_english: The culprits shall be known by their marks, and shall be seized by their forelocks and their feet.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the powers of your Lord, will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: هَـٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
translation_english: (It will be said): “This is the Hell that the culprits had cried lies to.

arabic: يَطُوفُونَ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَ حَمِيمٍ آنٍ
translation_english: They will keep circling around between Hell and boiling water.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: وَلِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ جَنَّتَانِ
translation_english: For any who fears to stand before his Lord are two Gardens.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: ذَوَاتَا أَفْنَانٍ
translation_english: These Gardens will abound in green, blooming branches.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ تَجْرِيَانِ
translation_english: In each of the two Gardens are two flowing springs.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: فِيهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَاكِهَةٍ زَوْجَانِ
translation_english: In both these is a pair of every fruit.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍ بَطَائِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍ ۚ وَجَنَى الْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍ
translation_english: They shall recline on couches lined with brocade, and within reach shall hang the fruits of the two Gardens.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: فِيهِنَّ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ
translation_english: In the midst of these shall be maidens with modest, restrained glances; maidens whom no man or jinn has ever touched before.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ الْيَاقُوتُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ
translation_english: Lovely as rubies and pearls.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: هَلْ جَزَاءُ الْإِحْسَانِ إِلَّا الْإِحْسَانُ
translation_english: Can the reward of goodness be any other than goodness?

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the laudable attributes of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ
translation_english: And besides these two there shall be two other Gardens.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: مُدْهَامَّتَانِ
translation_english: Two Gardens, dark green and fresh.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ
translation_english: In them will be two gushing springs.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: فِيهِمَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَنَخْلٌ وَرُمَّانٌ
translation_english: Therein will be fruits and dates and pomegranates.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: فِيهِنَّ خَيْرَاتٌ حِسَانٌ
translation_english: In the midst of these will be maidens, good and comely.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: حُورٌ مَّقْصُورَاتٌ فِي الْخِيَامِ
translation_english: There shall be maidens sheltered in tents.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ
translation_english: No man or jinn ever touched them before.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٍ
translation_english: They shall be reclining on green cushions and splendid carpets.

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation_english: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

arabic: تَبَارَكَ اسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
translation_english: Blessed be the name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Glory.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ
translation_english: When the Event will come to pass

arabic: لَيْسَ لِوَقْعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ
translation_english: – and then there will be no one to deny its occurrence –

arabic: خَافِضَةٌ رَّافِعَةٌ
translation_english: (a calamitous Event) that shall turn things upside down:

arabic: إِذَا رُجَّتِ الْأَرْضُ رَجًّا
translation_english: when the earth will suddenly shake with a terrible shaking,

arabic: وَبُسَّتِ الْجِبَالُ بَسًّا
translation_english: and the mountains will crumble

arabic: فَكَانَتْ هَبَاءً مُّنبَثًّا
translation_english: and will scatter abroad into fine dust.

arabic: وَكُنتُمْ أَزْوَاجًا ثَلَاثَةً
translation_english: You shall then become three groups.

arabic: فَأَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ
translation_english: The People on the Right: and how fortunate will be the People on the Right!

arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ
translation_english: And the People on the Left: and how miserable will be the People on the Left!

arabic: وَالسَّابِقُونَ السَّابِقُونَ
translation_english: As for the Foremost, they will be the foremost!

arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ
translation_english: They shall be near-stationed (to their Lord),

arabic: فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
translation_english: in the Gardens of Bliss.

arabic: ثُلَّةٌ مِّنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: A throng of the ancients,

arabic: وَقَلِيلٌ مِّنَ الْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: and a few from later times.

arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّوْضُونَةٍ
translation_english: They (will be seated) on gold-encrusted couches,

arabic: مُّتَّكِئِينَ عَلَيْهَا مُتَقَابِلِينَ
translation_english: reclining on them, arrayed face to face;

arabic: يَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ
translation_english: immortal youths shall go about them

arabic: بِأَكْوَابٍ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأْسٍ مِّن مَّعِينٍ
translation_english: with goblets and ewers and a cup filled with a drink drawn from a running spring,

arabic: لَّا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنْهَا وَلَا يُنزِفُونَ
translation_english: a drink by which their minds will not be clouded nor will it cause drunkenness;

arabic: وَفَاكِهَةٍ مِّمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ
translation_english: they will also go about them with the fruits of which they may choose,

arabic: وَلَحْمِ طَيْرٍ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
translation_english: and with the flesh of any fowl that they may desire to eat;

arabic: وَحُورٌ عِينٌ
translation_english: and there shall be wide-eyed maidens,

arabic: كَأَمْثَالِ اللُّؤْلُؤِ الْمَكْنُونِ
translation_english: beautiful as pearls hidden in their shells.

arabic: جَزَاءً بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: All this shall be theirs as a reward for their deeds.

arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا
translation_english: There they shall hear no idle talk nor any sinful speech.

arabic: إِلَّا قِيلًا سَلَامًا سَلَامًا
translation_english: All talk will be sound and upright.

arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْيَمِينِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْيَمِينِ
translation_english: As for the People on the Right, how fortunate shall be the people on the Right!

arabic: فِي سِدْرٍ مَّخْضُودٍ
translation_english: They shall be in the midst of thornless lote trees,

arabic: وَطَلْحٍ مَّنضُودٍ
translation_english: and flower-clad acacias,

arabic: وَظِلٍّ مَّمْدُودٍ
translation_english: and extended shade,

arabic: وَمَاءٍ مَّسْكُوبٍ
translation_english: and gushing water,

arabic: وَفَاكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ
translation_english: and abundant fruit,

arabic: لَّا مَقْطُوعَةٍ وَلَا مَمْنُوعَةٍ
translation_english: never-ending and unforbidden.

arabic: وَفُرُشٍ مَّرْفُوعَةٍ
translation_english: They shall be on upraised couches,

arabic: إِنَّا أَنشَأْنَاهُنَّ إِنشَاءً
translation_english: and their spouses We shall have brought them into being afresh,

arabic: فَجَعَلْنَاهُنَّ أَبْكَارًا
translation_english: and shall have made them virgins,

arabic: عُرُبًا أَتْرَابًا
translation_english: intensely loving and of matching age.

arabic: لِّأَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ
translation_english: All this will be for the People on the Right;

arabic: ثُلَّةٌ مِّنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: a large throng from the ancients,

arabic: وَثُلَّةٌ مِّنَ الْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: and also a large throng from those of later times.

arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الشِّمَالِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الشِّمَالِ
translation_english: As for the People on the Left: how miserable will be the People on the Left!

arabic: فِي سَمُومٍ وَحَمِيمٍ
translation_english: They will be in the midst of scorching wind and boiling water,

arabic: وَظِلٍّ مِّن يَحْمُومٍ
translation_english: and a shade of thick, pitch-black smoke,

arabic: لَّا بَارِدٍ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ
translation_english: which will neither be cool nor soothing.

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتْرَفِينَ
translation_english: Surely they had lived before in luxury,

arabic: وَكَانُوا يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى الْحِنثِ الْعَظِيمِ
translation_english: and had persisted in the Great Sin.

arabic: وَكَانُوا يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
translation_english: They used to say: “What! Once we are dead and are reduced to dust and bones, shall we still be raised to a new life from the dead?

arabic: أَوَآبَاؤُنَا الْأَوَّلُونَ
translation_english: (We) and our fore-fathers of yore?”

arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ الْأَوَّلِينَ وَالْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: Tell them, (O Prophet): “The earlier ones and the later ones

arabic: لَمَجْمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
translation_english: shall all be brought together on an appointed Day.

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ أَيُّهَا الضَّالُّونَ الْمُكَذِّبُونَ
translation_english: Then you, the erring ones and those that gave the lie to the Truth,

arabic: لَآكِلُونَ مِن شَجَرٍ مِّن زَقُّومٍ
translation_english: shall all eat from the Tree of al-Zaqqum,

arabic: فَمَالِئُونَ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ
translation_english: filling your bellies with it;

arabic: فَشَارِبُونَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الْحَمِيمِ
translation_english: and thereupon you shall drink boiling water,

arabic: فَشَارِبُونَ شُرْبَ الْهِيمِ
translation_english: drinking it as thirsty camels do.”

arabic: هَـٰذَا نُزُلُهُمْ يَوْمَ الدِّينِ
translation_english: Thus shall they be entertained on the Day of Recompense.

arabic: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَاكُمْ فَلَوْلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ
translation_english: We have created you, then why would you not confirm it?

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُم مَّا تُمْنُونَ
translation_english: Did you ever consider the sperm that you emit?

arabic: أَأَنتُمْ تَخْلُقُونَهُ أَمْ نَحْنُ الْخَالِقُونَ
translation_english: Do you create a child out of it, or are We its creators?

arabic: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ الْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
translation_english: It is We Who ordained death upon you and We are not to be frustrated.

arabic: عَلَىٰ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمْثَالَكُمْ وَنُنشِئَكُمْ فِي مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: Had We so wished, nothing could have hindered Us from replacing you by others like yourselves, or transforming you into beings you know nothing about.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
translation_english: You are well aware of the first creation; then, do you learn no lesson from it?

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُم مَّا تَحْرُثُونَ
translation_english: Have you considered the seeds you till?

arabic: أَأَنتُمْ تَزْرَعُونَهُ أَمْ نَحْنُ الزَّارِعُونَ
translation_english: Is it you or We Who make them grow?

arabic: لَوْ نَشَاءُ لَجَعَلْنَاهُ حُطَامًا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ
translation_english: If We so wished, We could have reduced your harvest to rubble, and you would have been left wonder-struck to exclaim:

arabic: إِنَّا لَمُغْرَمُونَ
translation_english: “We have been penalised;

arabic: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ
translation_english: nay; we have been undone!”

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ الْمَاءَ الَّذِي تَشْرَبُونَ
translation_english: Did you cast a good look at the water that you drink?

arabic: أَأَنتُمْ أَنزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ الْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنزِلُونَ
translation_english: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds or is it We Who brought it down?

arabic: لَوْ نَشَاءُ جَعَلْنَاهُ أُجَاجًا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ
translation_english: If We had so pleased, We could have made it bitter. So why would you not give thanks?

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ النَّارَ الَّتِي تُورُونَ
translation_english: Did you consider the fire which you kindle?

arabic: أَأَنتُمْ أَنشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَا أَمْ نَحْنُ الْمُنشِئُونَ
translation_english: Did you make its tree grow or was it We Who made it grow?

arabic: نَحْنُ جَعَلْنَاهَا تَذْكِرَةً وَمَتَاعًا لِّلْمُقْوِينَ
translation_english: We made it a reminder and a provision for the needy.

arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الْعَظِيمِ
translation_english: Glorify, then, (O Prophet), the name of your Great Lord.

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِمَوَاقِعِ النُّجُومِ
translation_english: No! I swear by the positions of the stars –

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَقَسَمٌ لَّوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عَظِيمٌ
translation_english: and this is indeed a mighty oath, if only you knew –

arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقُرْآنٌ كَرِيمٌ
translation_english: that this indeed is a noble Qur'an,

arabic: فِي كِتَابٍ مَّكْنُونٍ
translation_english: inscribed in a well-guarded Book,

arabic: لَّا يَمَسُّهُ إِلَّا الْمُطَهَّرُونَ
translation_english: which none but the pure may touch;

arabic: تَنزِيلٌ مِّن رَّبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: أَفَبِهَـٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ أَنتُم مُّدْهِنُونَ
translation_english: Do you, then, take this discourse in light esteem,

arabic: وَتَجْعَلُونَ رِزْقَكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation_english: and your portion in it is simply that you denounce it as false?

arabic: فَلَوْلَا إِذَا بَلَغَتِ الْحُلْقُومَ
translation_english: Why, then, when the soul leaps up to the throat,

arabic: وَأَنتُمْ حِينَئِذٍ تَنظُرُونَ
translation_english: the while you are helplessly watching that he is on the verge of death,

arabic: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنكُمْ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: – at that moment when We are closer to him than you, although you do not see (Us)

arabic: فَلَوْلَا إِن كُنتُمْ غَيْرَ مَدِينِينَ
translation_english: if you are not subject to anyone's authority,

arabic: تَرْجِعُونَهَا إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
translation_english: why are you then not able to bring them back to life if you are truthful?

arabic: فَأَمَّا إِن كَانَ مِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ
translation_english: So if he is one of those who are near-stationed (to Allah),

arabic: فَرَوْحٌ وَرَيْحَانٌ وَجَنَّتُ نَعِيمٍ
translation_english: then happiness and delight and Gardens of Bliss are his.

arabic: وَأَمَّا إِن كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ
translation_english: And if he is one of the People on the Right,

arabic: فَسَلَامٌ لَّكَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الْيَمِينِ
translation_english: he will be welcomed by the words: “Peace to you” from the People on the Right.

arabic: وَأَمَّا إِن كَانَ مِنَ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ الضَّالِّينَ
translation_english: And if he is one of those who give the lie (to this Message) and go astray,

arabic: فَنُزُلٌ مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
