arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ن ۚ وَالْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ
translation_english: Nun. By the pen and what the scribes write.

arabic: مَا أَنتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ
translation_english: By your Lord's Grace, you are not afflicted with madness,

arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ
translation_english: and surely yours shall be a never-ending reward,

arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ
translation_english: and you are certainly on the most exalted standard of moral excellence.

arabic: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: So you will soon see, and they too will see,

arabic: بِأَييِّكُمُ الْمَفْتُونُ
translation_english: which of you is afflicted with madness.

arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ
translation_english: Surely your Lord knows well those who have strayed from His Way just as He knows well those who are on the Right Way.

arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Do not, then, yield to those who reject the Truth, decrying it as false;

arabic: وَدُّوا لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ
translation_english: they would wish you to be pliant so that they too may be pliant.

arabic: وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَّهِينٍ
translation_english: And do not yield to any contemptible swearer,

arabic: هَمَّازٍ مَّشَّاءٍ بِنَمِيمٍ
translation_english: the fault-finder who goes around slandering,

arabic: مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
translation_english: the hinderer of good, the transgressor, the sinful;

arabic: عُتُلٍّ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ زَنِيمٍ
translation_english: the coarse-grained, and above all mean and ignoble;

arabic: أَن كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ
translation_english: (who so acts) simply because he has wealth and sons,

arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: and whenever Our verses are rehearsed to him, he says: “These are fairy- tales of times gone by.”

arabic: سَنَسِمُهُ عَلَى الْخُرْطُومِ
translation_english: Soon shall We brand him on his snout.

arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَاهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَا أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
translation_english: We have put them [i.e., the Makkans] to test even as We put to test the owners of the orchard when they vowed that they would gather the fruit of their orchard in the morning,

arabic: وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ
translation_english: without making any allowance (for the will of Allah).

arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَائِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَائِمُونَ
translation_english: Thereupon a calamity from your Lord passed over it while they were asleep,

arabic: فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَالصَّرِيمِ
translation_english: and so by morning the orchard lay as though it had been fully harvested.

arabic: فَتَنَادَوْا مُصْبِحِينَ
translation_english: At daybreak they called out to one another:

arabic: أَنِ اغْدُوا عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَارِمِينَ
translation_english: “Hurry to your orchard if you would gather its fruit.”

arabic: فَانطَلَقُوا وَهُمْ يَتَخَافَتُونَ
translation_english: So off they went, whispering to one another:

arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا الْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
translation_english: “No destitute person shall enter it today.”

arabic: وَغَدَوْا عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍ قَادِرِينَ
translation_english: They went forth early, believing that they had the power (to gather the fruit).

arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوا إِنَّا لَضَالُّونَ
translation_english: But as soon as they beheld the orchard, (they cried out): “We have certainly lost the way;

arabic: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ
translation_english: rather, we are utterly ruined.”

arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
translation_english: The best among them said: “Did I not say to you: why do you not give glory to (your Lord)?”

arabic: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
translation_english: They cried out: “Glory be to our Lord! Certainly we were sinners.”

arabic: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَلَاوَمُونَ
translation_english: Then they began to reproach one another.

arabic: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا طَاغِينَ
translation_english: They said: “Woe to us! We had indeed transgressed.

arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَا أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَا إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَاغِبُونَ
translation_english: Maybe our Lord will give us a better orchard in its place; to our Lord do we penitently turn.”

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ الْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: Such is the chastisement; and the chastisement of the Hereafter is assuredly even greater, if only they knew.

arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
translation_english: Surely the God-fearing shall have Gardens of bliss with their Lord.

arabic: أَفَنَجْعَلُ الْمُسْلِمِينَ كَالْمُجْرِمِينَ
translation_english: What! Shall We treat those who have submitted (to Our command) like those who have acted as criminals?

arabic: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
translation_english: What is the matter with you? How ill do you judge!

arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَابٌ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ
translation_english: Or do you have a Book wherein you read

arabic: إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ
translation_english: that (in the Hereafter) you shall have all that you choose for yourselves?

arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَانٌ عَلَيْنَا بَالِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
translation_english: Or have We sworn a covenant with you which We are bound to keep till the Day of Resurrection, (a covenant requiring that whatever you ordain for yourselves shall be yours)?

arabic: سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُم بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ
translation_english: Ask them: “Which of them can guarantee that?

arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَاءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا بِشُرَكَائِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
translation_english: Or has something been guaranteed by any of those whom they associate with Allah in His Divinity?” If so, let them bring forth their associates, if they are truthful.

arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
translation_english: On the Day when the dreadful calamity will unfold, when people will be summoned to prostrate themselves, and yet they will not be able to prostrate.

arabic: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَالِمُونَ
translation_english: Their eyes shall be downcast and ignominy shall overwhelm them. For when they were safe and sound, they were summoned to prostrate themselves, (and they refused).

arabic: فَذَرْنِي وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: So leave Me, (O Prophet), to deal with him who gives the lie to this Discourse. We shall draw them little by little (to their undoing) in a way that they will not know.

arabic: وَأُمْلِي لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ كَيْدِي مَتِينٌ
translation_english: I am giving them a respite. Great is My scheme!

arabic: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
translation_english: Or are you asking them for some compensation so that they feel burdened with debt?

arabic: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
translation_english: Or do they have any knowledge of the Unseen which they are now writing down?

arabic: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ الْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
translation_english: So bear with patience until the Judgement of your Lord comes, and do not belike the man in the fish (i.e., Jonah) who called out, choking with grief:

arabic: لَّوْلَا أَن تَدَارَكَهُ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِ لَنُبِذَ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
translation_english: had his Lord not bestowed His favour upon him, he would have been cast upon that barren shore (and would have remained there) in disgrace.

arabic: فَاجْتَبَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَجَعَلَهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
translation_english: But his Lord exalted him, and included him among His righteous servants.

arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَارِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا الذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجْنُونٌ
translation_english: When the unbelievers hear this Exhortation, they look at you as though they would knock you off your feet with their (hostile) glances. They say: “Surely he is afflicted with madness”;

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: although this is nothing but an Exhortation (to goodness) for everyone in the world.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الْحَاقَّةُ
translation_english: The indubitable event!

arabic: مَا الْحَاقَّةُ
translation_english: And what is that indubitable event?

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْحَاقَّةُ
translation_english: And what do you know what that indubitable event is?

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌ بِالْقَارِعَةِ
translation_english: The Thamud and the Ad denied the (possibility of a) sudden calamity, calling it false.

arabic: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِالطَّاغِيَةِ
translation_english: Then the Thamud were destroyed by an awesome upheaval;

arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
translation_english: and the Ad were destroyed by a furiously raging wind-storm

arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَانِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى الْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
translation_english: which He let loose upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession; so that (if you had been there) you might have seen people lying prostrate, as though they were uprooted trunks of hollowed palm trees.

arabic: فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّن بَاقِيَةٍ
translation_english: Do you now see any trace of them?

arabic: وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ
translation_english: Pharaoh and those before him and the people of the overturned habitations all engaged in the same great sin.

arabic: فَعَصَوْا رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
translation_english: They did not follow the Messenger of their Lord, and so He seized them with a severe grip.

arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَى الْمَاءُ حَمَلْنَاكُمْ فِي الْجَارِيَةِ
translation_english: Verily when the water rose to great heights, We bore you upon a floating vessel (i.e. the Ark)

arabic: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ
translation_english: so that We might make it an instructive event for you, and retentive ears might preserve its memory.

arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
translation_english: So when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast

arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً
translation_english: and the earth and the mountains are carried aloft and are crushed to bits at one stroke,

arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ
translation_english: on that Day shall that indubitable event come to pass;

arabic: وَانشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَهِيَ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاهِيَةٌ
translation_english: when the sky will be rent asunder, the grip holding it together having loosened on that Day,

arabic: وَالْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰ أَرْجَائِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَانِيَةٌ
translation_english: and the angels will stand on the sides, with eight of them bearing aloft the Throne of your Lord on that Day.

arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
translation_english: That will be the Day when you shall be brought forth (before Allah) and no secret of yours shall remain hidden.

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ فَيَقُولُ هَاؤُمُ اقْرَءُوا كِتَابِيَهْ
translation_english: On that Day, he whose Record is given to him in his right hand will say: “Lo! Read my Record!

arabic: إِنِّي ظَنَنتُ أَنِّي مُلَاقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ
translation_english: Verily I was sure that I would be handed over my account.”

arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ
translation_english: Then he shall find himself in a life of bliss;

arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
translation_english: in a lofty Garden

arabic: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌ
translation_english: the clusters of whose fruit will be hanging low to be within reach (of the inmates of Paradise).

arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِي الْأَيَّامِ الْخَالِيَةِ
translation_english: (They will be told): “Eat and drink with good cheer as a reward for the good deeds you did in the days that have passed by.”

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِشِمَالِهِ فَيَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَابِيَهْ
translation_english: As for him whose Record will be given to him in his left hand, he will exclaim: “Would that I had never been given my Record,

arabic: وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ
translation_english: and had not known my account.

arabic: يَا لَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ الْقَاضِيَةَ
translation_english: Oh! Would that the death that came to me in the world had made an end of me!

arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّي مَالِيَهْ ۜ
translation_english: My riches have not availed me,

arabic: هَلَكَ عَنِّي سُلْطَانِيَهْ
translation_english: and my authority has vanished.”

arabic: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ
translation_english: (A command will be issued): “Seize him and shackle him,

arabic: ثُمَّ الْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ
translation_english: then cast him in the Fire,

arabic: ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَاسْلُكُوهُ
translation_english: then fasten him with a chain, seventy cubits long.

arabic: إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
translation_english: He would not believe in Allah, the Most Great;

arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ
translation_english: nor would he urge the feeding of the poor.

arabic: فَلَيْسَ لَهُ الْيَوْمَ هَاهُنَا حَمِيمٌ
translation_english: Today he has been left here friendless;

arabic: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍ
translation_english: and has no food except the filth from the washing of wounds,

arabic: لَّا يَأْكُلُهُ إِلَّا الْخَاطِئُونَ
translation_english: which only the sinners will eat.”

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: But no; I swear by what you see,

arabic: وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
translation_english: and by what you do not see,

arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
translation_english: that this is the speech of an honourable Messenger,

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
translation_english: not the speech of a poet. Little do you believe!

arabic: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
translation_english: Nor is this the speech of a soothsayer. Little do you reflect!

arabic: تَنزِيلٌ مِّن رَّبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: It has been revealed by the Lord of the Universe.

arabic: وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ الْأَقَاوِيلِ
translation_english: And if he [i.e., the Prophets] had forged this Discourse and thereafter ascribed it to Us,

arabic: لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِالْيَمِينِ
translation_english: We would surely have seized him by the right hand,

arabic: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ الْوَتِينَ
translation_english: and then severed his life vein;

arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ
translation_english: and not one of you would have been able to withhold Us from doing so.

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَذْكِرَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
translation_english: Surely it is a Good Counsel for the God-fearing.

arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: We certainly know that some among you will give the lie to it,

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ
translation_english: and surely it will be a cause of regret for the unbelievers.

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَحَقُّ الْيَقِينِ
translation_english: Certainly it is a Truth of absolute certainty.

arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الْعَظِيمِ
translation_english: So glorify the name of your Lord Most Great.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَأَلَ سَائِلٌ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ
translation_english: A beseecher besought the visitation of chastisement,

arabic: لِّلْكَافِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُ دَافِعٌ
translation_english: (a chastisement meant) for the unbelievers, one which none can avert;

arabic: مِّنَ اللَّهِ ذِي الْمَعَارِجِ
translation_english: a chastisement from Allah, the Lord of the ascending steps,

arabic: تَعْرُجُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِي يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
translation_english: by which the angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in one Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.

arabic: فَاصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا
translation_english: So, (O Prophet), persevere with gracious perseverance.

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُ بَعِيدًا
translation_english: Verily they think that the chastisement is far off,

arabic: وَنَرَاهُ قَرِيبًا
translation_english: while We think that it is near at hand.

arabic: يَوْمَ تَكُونُ السَّمَاءُ كَالْمُهْلِ
translation_english: It shall befall on a Day whereon the sky will become like molten brass,

arabic: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ
translation_english: and the mountains will become like dyed tufts of wool,

arabic: وَلَا يَسْأَلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًا
translation_english: and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends

arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ الْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِي مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍ بِبَنِيهِ
translation_english: although they shall be within sight of one another. The guilty one would fain ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his children,

arabic: وَصَاحِبَتِهِ وَأَخِيهِ
translation_english: and his spouse and his brother,

arabic: وَفَصِيلَتِهِ الَّتِي تُؤْوِيهِ
translation_english: and his kinsfolk who had stood by him,

arabic: وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
translation_english: and all persons of the earth, if only he could thus save himself.

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ
translation_english: By no means! It will be the fierce flame

arabic: نَزَّاعَةً لِّلشَّوَىٰ
translation_english: that will strip off the scalp.

arabic: تَدْعُو مَنْ أَدْبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
translation_english: It shall insistently summon him who turned his back and retreated,

arabic: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوْعَىٰ
translation_english: and amassed wealth and covetously hoarded it.

arabic: إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا
translation_english: Verily man is impatient by nature:

arabic: إِذَا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ جَزُوعًا
translation_english: bewailing when evil befalls him,

arabic: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ الْخَيْرُ مَنُوعًا
translation_english: and tight-fisted when good fortune visits him,

arabic: إِلَّا الْمُصَلِّينَ
translation_english: except those that pray,

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ دَائِمُونَ
translation_english: and are constant in their Prayer;

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ فِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ مَّعْلُومٌ
translation_english: and those in whose wealth there is a known right

arabic: لِّلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ
translation_english: for those that ask and those that are dispossessed,

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ
translation_english: those who firmly believe in the Day of Recompense,

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
translation_english: and fear the chastisement of their Lord –

arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمْ غَيْرُ مَأْمُونٍ
translation_english: surely the chastisement of their Lord is a thing none can feel secure from –

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَافِظُونَ
translation_english: and those who guard their private parts,

arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
translation_english: except in regard to their spouses and those whom their right hands possess, for in regard to them they are not reproachable,

arabic: فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ
translation_english: but any who seeks to go beyond that, it is indeed they who are the transgressors,

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَانَاتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَاعُونَ
translation_english: and those who fulfil their trusts and their covenants,

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُم بِشَهَادَاتِهِمْ قَائِمُونَ
translation_english: and those who are upright in their testimonies;

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
translation_english: and who take due care of their Prayer:

arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ مُّكْرَمُونَ
translation_english: all these shall live honourably in the Gardens.

arabic: فَمَالِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا قِبَلَكَ مُهْطِعِينَ
translation_english: But what is the matter with the unbelievers who are hurrying towards you

arabic: عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ
translation_english: in crowds, both on the right and on the left?

arabic: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
translation_english: Does everyone of them wish to enter the Garden of Bliss?

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُم مِّمَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: By no means! They know that which We have created them from.

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ الْمَشَارِقِ وَالْمَغَارِبِ إِنَّا لَقَادِرُونَ
translation_english: I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests that We have the power

arabic: عَلَىٰ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
translation_english: to replace them by others who would be better than they; and We shall certainly not be overpowered.

arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا وَيَلْعَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
translation_english: So leave them to engage in vain talk and to amuse themselves until they come face to face with the Day which they are promised,

arabic: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
translation_english: the Day on which they will hastily come forth from their graves, as though they were hurrying on to the altars of their deities.

arabic: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الَّذِي كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ
translation_english: Their eyes will be downcast and disgrace will overwhelm them. Such is the Day that they were promised.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
translation_english: We sent Noah to his people (and directed him): “Warn your people before a grievous chastisement comes upon them.”

arabic: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ إِنِّي لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
translation_english: Noah said: “My people, I have certainly been sent as a clear warner to you,

arabic: أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation_english: that you serve Allah and fear Him, and follow me;

arabic: يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ اللَّهِ إِذَا جَاءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: He will forgive your sins and will grant you respite until an appointed term. Indeed when Allah's appointed term comes, it cannot be deferred; if you only knew!”

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِي لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
translation_english: He said: “My Lord, I called my people by night and by day,

arabic: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَائِي إِلَّا فِرَارًا
translation_english: but the more I called, the farther they fled.

arabic: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوا أَصَابِعَهُمْ فِي آذَانِهِمْ وَاسْتَغْشَوْا ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا اسْتِكْبَارًا
translation_english: And every time I called them so that You might forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears and wrapped up their faces with their garments and obstinately clung to their attitude, and waxed very proud.

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا
translation_english: Then I summoned them openly,

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّي أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا
translation_english: and preached to them in public, and also addressed them in secret.

arabic: فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
translation_english: I said to them: “Ask forgiveness from your Lord; surely He is Most Forgiving.

arabic: يُرْسِلِ السَّمَاءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًا
translation_english: He will shower upon you torrents from heaven,

arabic: وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَالٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَارًا
translation_english: and will provide you with wealth and children, and will bestow upon you gardens and rivers.

arabic: مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا
translation_english: What is amiss with you that you do not look forward to the majesty of Allah

arabic: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
translation_english: when He has created you in stages?

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا كَيْفَ خَلَقَ اللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا
translation_english: Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one upon the other,

arabic: وَجَعَلَ الْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ الشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
translation_english: and has placed the moon in them as a light, and the sun as a radiant lamp?

arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَنبَتَكُم مِّنَ الْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا
translation_english: And Allah has caused you to grow out of the earth so wondrously,

arabic: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا
translation_english: and He will later cause you to return to it and will then again bring you out of it.

arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا
translation_english: Allah has made the earth a wide expanse for you

arabic: لِّتَسْلُكُوا مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا
translation_english: so that you may tread its spacious paths.”

arabic: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِي وَاتَّبَعُوا مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُ وَوَلَدُهُ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
translation_english: Noah said: “My Lord, they did not pay heed to what I said, and followed those (nobles) whose possession of wealth and children has led them to an even greater loss.

arabic: وَمَكَرُوا مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا
translation_english: They contrived a plot of great magnitude.

arabic: وَقَالُوا لَا تَذَرُنَّ آلِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا
translation_english: They said: “Do not abandon your deities; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yaghuth, nor Yauq, nor Nasr.

arabic: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا كَثِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَالًا
translation_english: They have misled many. So do not enable these evildoers to increase in anything except straying (from the Right Way).”

arabic: مِّمَّا خَطِيئَاتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا فَأُدْخِلُوا نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا لَهُم مِّن دُونِ اللَّهِ أَنصَارًا
translation_english: And so they were drowned on account of their sins, and then cast into the Fire, and did not find any other than Allah, to come forth to their help.

arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
translation_english: Noah said: “My Lord, do not leave out of these unbelievers even a single dweller on earth,

arabic: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوا إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا
translation_english: for certainly if You should leave them (alive), they will mislead Your servants, and will beget none but sinners and utter unbelievers.

arabic: رَّبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِيَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًا
translation_english: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and forgive all believers, both men and women, and do not increase the wrong-doers in anything except perdition.”

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ اسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْآنًا عَجَبًا
translation_english: Say, (O Prophet), it was revealed to me that a band of jinn attentively listened to (the recitation of the Qur'an) and then (went back to their people) and said:

arabic: يَهْدِي إِلَى الرُّشْدِ فَآمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَا أَحَدًا
translation_english: “We have indeed heard a wonderful Qur'an which guides to the Right Way; so we have come to believe in it, and we will not associate aught with Our Lord in His Divinity”;

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ تَعَالَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا اتَّخَذَ صَاحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا
translation_english: and that “He – exalted be His Majesty – has not taken to Himself either a wife or a son”;

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا
translation_english: and that “the foolish among us have been wont to say outrageous things about Allah”;

arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَن لَّن تَقُولَ الْإِنسُ وَالْجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
translation_english: and that “we had thought that men and jinn would never speak a lie about Allah”,

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ الْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا
translation_english: and that “some from among the humans used to seek protection of some among the jinn, and thus they increased the arrogance of the jinn”;

arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ اللَّهُ أَحَدًا
translation_english: and that “they thought, even as you thought, that Allah would never raise anyone (as a Messenger)”;

arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا السَّمَاءَ فَوَجَدْنَاهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا
translation_english: and that “we tried to pry (the secrets of) the heaven, but we found it full of terrible guards and shooting meteors”;

arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَاعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ الْآنَ يَجِدْ لَهُ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا
translation_english: and that “we would take up stations in the heaven to try to hear but anyone who now attempts to listen finds a shooting meteor in wait for him”;

arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِي أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا
translation_english: and that “we do not know whether evil is intended for those on the earth, or whether their Lord intends to direct them to the Right Way”;

arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ كُنَّا طَرَائِقَ قِدَدًا
translation_english: and that “some of us are upright and some of us are otherwise for we follow widely divergent paths”;

arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ اللَّهَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُ هَرَبًا
translation_english: and that “we thought that we will neither be able to frustrate Allah on earth, nor frustrate Him by flight”;

arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا الْهُدَىٰ آمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ فَمَن يُؤْمِن بِرَبِّهِ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا
translation_english: and that “when we heard the teaching of the Right Way we came to believe in it; he who believes in His Lord shall have no fear of suffering loss or being subjected to any injustice”;

arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُولَـٰئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا رَشَدًا
translation_english: and that “among us some are Muslims (Those who have submitted to Allah), and some of us are deviant. So those who became Muslims found the Right Course;

arabic: وَأَمَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا
translation_english: but those who deviated from the Truth, will be the fuel for Hell.”

arabic: وَأَن لَّوِ اسْتَقَامُوا عَلَى الطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَاهُم مَّاءً غَدَقًا
translation_english: If people were to keep firmly to the Right Way, We would have vouchsafed them abundant rain

arabic: لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا
translation_english: so that We might try them through this bounty. Whoso turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to suffer a grievous chastisement;

arabic: وَأَنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ أَحَدًا
translation_english: and that “mosques belong to Allah, so do not invoke anyone with Him”;

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا
translation_english: and when Allah's servant stood up to call on Him, they well-nigh swarmed him.

arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَدْعُو رَبِّي وَلَا أُشْرِكُ بِهِ أَحَدًا
translation_english: Say, (O Prophet): “I call on my Lord alone, and I do not associate aught with Him in His Divinity.”

arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي لَا أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا
translation_english: Say: “Surely neither it is in my power to hurt you nor to bring you to the Right Way.”

arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ اللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِ مُلْتَحَدًا
translation_english: Say: “None can protect me from Allah, nor can I find a refuge apart from Him.

arabic: إِلَّا بَلَاغًا مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَرِسَالَاتِهِ ۚ وَمَن يَعْصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ فَإِنَّ لَهُ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا
translation_english: (My task is no more than) to deliver Allah's proclamation and His messages. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, surely the Fire of Hell awaits him; therein he will abide in perpetuity.”

arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
translation_english: (They shall not change their ways) until they see that against which they had been warned, and then they will know whose helpers are weaker and whose supporters are fewer in number.

arabic: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِي أَقَرِيبٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُ رَبِّي أَمَدًا
translation_english: Say: “I know not whether what you are promised is near or whether my Lord will prolong its term.

arabic: عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِ أَحَدًا
translation_english: He is the Knower of the Unseen, and He does not disclose His Unseen to anyone

arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُ يَسْلُكُ مِن بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِ رَصَدًا
translation_english: other than to a Messenger whom He chooses (for the bestowal of any part of the knowledge of the Unseen), whereafter He appoints guards who go before him and behind him,

arabic: لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عَدَدًا
translation_english: so that He may know that they have delivered the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge their surroundings and keeps a count of all things.”

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُزَّمِّلُ
translation_english: O you the (sleeping) enwrapped one!

arabic: قُمِ اللَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
translation_english: Stand up in Prayer by night, all but a small part of it;

arabic: نِّصْفَهُ أَوِ انقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا
translation_english: half of it, or reduce it a little;

arabic: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ الْقُرْآنَ تَرْتِيلًا
translation_english: or add to it a little; and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.

arabic: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِي عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا
translation_english: Behold, We shall cast upon you a Weighty Word.

arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ اللَّيْلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطْئًا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
translation_english: Surely getting up at night is the best means of subduing the self and is more suitable for uprightness in speech.

arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي النَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا
translation_english: You are indeed much occupied during the day with the affairs of the world.

arabic: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا
translation_english: So remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with exclusive devotion.

arabic: رَّبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَاتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا
translation_english: He is the Lord of the East and the West; there is no god but He. So take Him alone for your Guardian,

arabic: وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا
translation_english: And bear patiently the vain things they utter, and gracefully forsake them.

arabic: وَذَرْنِي وَالْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُولِي النَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا
translation_english: Leave it to Me to deal with the affluent ones who give the lie (to the Truth), and bear with them for a while.

arabic: إِنَّ لَدَيْنَا أَنكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا
translation_english: We have heavy fetters and a blazing Fire in store for them;

arabic: وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
translation_english: and a food that chokes, and a grievous chastisement.

arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ الْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَّهِيلًا
translation_english: (They will come across all this) on the Day when the earth and the mountains shall tremble violently and the mountains shall crumble into heaps of scattered sand.

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَاهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا
translation_english: Surely We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness over you, just as We had sent a Messenger to Pharaoh.

arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ الرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَاهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا
translation_english: But Pharaoh disobeyed Our Messenger, so We seized him with a terrible seizing.

arabic: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ الْوِلْدَانَ شِيبًا
translation_english: If you persist in disbelieving, how will you guard yourself against the (woe of the) Day that will turn children grey-haired,

arabic: السَّمَاءُ مُنفَطِرٌ بِهِ ۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَفْعُولًا
translation_english: the Day whose severity shall cause the heaven to split asunder? Allah's promise is ever bound to be fulfilled.

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
translation_english: Indeed this is nothing but a Good Counsel; so let him who will take a way leading to his Lord.

arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ اللَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُ وَثُلُثَهُ وَطَائِفَةٌ مِّنَ الَّذِينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرْضَىٰ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِن فَضْلِ اللَّهِ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يُقَاتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ ۚ وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا ۚ وَاسْتَغْفِرُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
translation_english: (O Prophet), your Lord knows that you sometimes stand up in Prayer nearly two-thirds of the night, and sometimes half or one-third of it, and so does a party of those with you; Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He has shown mercy to you. So now recite as much of the Qur'an as you can. He knows that there are among you those who are sick and others who are journeying in the land in quest of Allah's bounty, and still others who are fighting in the cause of Allah. So recite as much of the Qur'an as you easily can, and establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and give Allah a goodly loan. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you shall find it with Allah. That is better and its reward is greater. And ask for Allah's forgiveness; surely He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُدَّثِّرُ
translation_english: O you enveloped in your cloak!

arabic: قُمْ فَأَنذِرْ
translation_english: Arise, and warn,

arabic: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ
translation_english: and magnify the glory of your Lord,

arabic: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ
translation_english: and purify your robes,

arabic: وَالرُّجْزَ فَاهْجُرْ
translation_english: and shun uncleanness,

arabic: وَلَا تَمْنُن تَسْتَكْثِرُ
translation_english: and bestow not favour in order to seek from others a greater return,

arabic: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَاصْبِرْ
translation_english: and persevere for your Lord's sake.

arabic: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِي النَّاقُورِ
translation_english: When the Trumpet shall be sounded,

arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ
translation_english: that will surely be a hard day,

arabic: عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍ
translation_english: not an easy day for the unbelievers.

arabic: ذَرْنِي وَمَنْ خَلَقْتُ وَحِيدًا
translation_english: Leave Me with him whom I alone have created,

arabic: وَجَعَلْتُ لَهُ مَالًا مَّمْدُودًا
translation_english: whom I have endowed with abundant riches,

arabic: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودًا
translation_english: and sons ever present with him,

arabic: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُ تَمْهِيدًا
translation_english: and for whom I have smoothed the way (to power and riches),

arabic: ثُمَّ يَطْمَعُ أَنْ أَزِيدَ
translation_english: and who still greedily desires that I should bestow upon him more.

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّهُ كَانَ لِآيَاتِنَا عَنِيدًا
translation_english: By no means; he is stubbornly opposed to Our Signs.

arabic: سَأُرْهِقُهُ صَعُودًا
translation_english: I shall soon constrain him to a hard ascent.

arabic: إِنَّهُ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
translation_english: He reflected and then hatched a scheme.

arabic: فَقُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
translation_english: Ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?

arabic: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
translation_english: Again, ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?

arabic: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ
translation_english: He looked (at others);

arabic: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ
translation_english: then frowned and scowled;

arabic: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ وَاسْتَكْبَرَ
translation_english: then he retreated and waxed proud,

arabic: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ
translation_english: and said: “This (Qur'an) is merely a sorcery of yore;

arabic: إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا قَوْلُ الْبَشَرِ
translation_english: this is nothing but the word of a mere mortal!”

arabic: سَأُصْلِيهِ سَقَرَ
translation_english: Him shall I soon roast in Hell.

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا سَقَرُ
translation_english: And what do you know what Hell is?

arabic: لَا تُبْقِي وَلَا تَذَرُ
translation_english: It spares nothing; it leaves nothing intact;

arabic: لَوَّاحَةٌ لِّلْبَشَرِ
translation_english: it scorches (even) the skin.

arabic: عَلَيْهَا تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ
translation_english: Over it are nineteen keepers.

arabic: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا أَصْحَابَ النَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَائِكَةً ۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَيَزْدَادَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِيمَانًا ۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۙ وَلِيَقُولَ الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ وَالْكَافِرُونَ مَاذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِهَـٰذَا مَثَلًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ
translation_english: We have appointed none but angels as the keepers of the Fire, and We have not made their number but as a trial for the unbelievers so that those who have been endowed with the Book will be convinced and the believers' faith will increase, and neither those who have been endowed with the Book nor the believers will fall into any doubt. As for those in whose hearts there is a sickness as well as the unbelievers, they will say: “What did Allah aim at by this strange parable?” Thus does Allah let whomsoever He pleases to go astray, and directs whomsoever He pleases to the Right Way. And none knows the hosts of your Lord but He. (And Hell has only been mentioned here) that people may take heed.

arabic: كَلَّا وَالْقَمَرِ
translation_english: Nay, by the moon,

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذْ أَدْبَرَ
translation_english: and by the night when it recedes,

arabic: وَالصُّبْحِ إِذَا أَسْفَرَ
translation_english: and by the day when it dawns (with its radiance),

arabic: إِنَّهَا لَإِحْدَى الْكُبَرِ
translation_english: surely (Hell) is one of the greatest Signs,

arabic: نَذِيرًا لِّلْبَشَرِ
translation_english: a warning to humankind,

arabic: لِمَن شَاءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
translation_english: a warning to everyone of you whether he would like to come forward or lag behind.

arabic: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ رَهِينَةٌ
translation_english: Each one is a hostage to one's deeds,

arabic: إِلَّا أَصْحَابَ الْيَمِينِ
translation_english: save the People of the Right Hand

arabic: فِي جَنَّاتٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
translation_english: who shall be in the Gardens, and shall ask

arabic: عَنِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
translation_english: about the guilty ones:

arabic: مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِي سَقَرَ
translation_english: “What drove you to Hell?”

arabic: قَالُوا لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ الْمُصَلِّينَ
translation_english: They will answer: “We were not among those who observed Prayer,

arabic: وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ الْمِسْكِينَ
translation_english: and we did not feed the poor,

arabic: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ الْخَائِضِينَ
translation_english: and we indulged in vain talk with those who indulged in vain talk,

arabic: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ
translation_english: and we gave the lie to the Day of Judgement

arabic: حَتَّىٰ أَتَانَا الْيَقِينُ
translation_english: until the inevitable event overtook us.”

arabic: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمْ شَفَاعَةُ الشَّافِعِينَ
translation_english: The intercession of the intercessors shall then be of no avail to them.

arabic: فَمَا لَهُمْ عَنِ التَّذْكِرَةِ مُعْرِضِينَ
translation_english: What is the matter with people that they are turning away from this Exhortation,

arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ حُمُرٌ مُّسْتَنفِرَةٌ
translation_english: as though they were frightened wild asses,

arabic: فَرَّتْ مِن قَسْوَرَةٍ
translation_english: fleeing from a lion?

arabic: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُّنَشَّرَةً
translation_english: No indeed; each one of them desires that open letters be sent to each of them.

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ الْآخِرَةَ
translation_english: No indeed; the truth is that they have no fear of the Hereafter.

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهُ تَذْكِرَةٌ
translation_english: Nay; this is an Exhortation.

arabic: فَمَن شَاءَ ذَكَرَهُ
translation_english: So, whoever wills may benefit from it.

arabic: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ التَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ
translation_english: But they will not benefit from it unless Allah Himself so wills. He is worthy to be feared; and He is worthy to forgive (those that fear Him).

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ
translation_english: Nay, I swear by the Day of Resurrection;

arabic: وَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالنَّفْسِ اللَّوَّامَةِ
translation_english: and nay, I swear by the self-reproaching soul!

arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ الْإِنسَانُ أَلَّن نَّجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُ
translation_english: Does man imagine that We will not be able to bring his bones together again?

arabic: بَلَىٰ قَادِرِينَ عَلَىٰ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُ
translation_english: Yes indeed; We have the power to remould even his finger-tips.

arabic: بَلْ يُرِيدُ الْإِنسَانُ لِيَفْجُرَ أَمَامَهُ
translation_english: But man desires to persist in his evil ways.

arabic: يَسْأَلُ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الْقِيَامَةِ
translation_english: He asks: “When will the Day of Resurrection be?”

arabic: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ الْبَصَرُ
translation_english: When the sight is dazed,

arabic: وَخَسَفَ الْقَمَرُ
translation_english: and the moon is eclipsed,

arabic: وَجُمِعَ الشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ
translation_english: and the sun and the moon are joined together,

arabic: يَقُولُ الْإِنسَانُ يَوْمَئِذٍ أَيْنَ الْمَفَرُّ
translation_english: on that Day will man say: “Whither the refuge?”

arabic: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ
translation_english: No, there is no refuge.

arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْمُسْتَقَرُّ
translation_english: With your Lord alone will be the retreat that Day.

arabic: يُنَبَّأُ الْإِنسَانُ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
translation_english: On that Day will man be apprised of his deeds, both the earlier and the later.

arabic: بَلِ الْإِنسَانُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ بَصِيرَةٌ
translation_english: But lo, man is well aware of himself,

arabic: وَلَوْ أَلْقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُ
translation_english: even though he might make up excuses.

arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِ
translation_english: (O Prophet), do not stir your tongue hastily (to commit the Revelation to memory).

arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا جَمْعَهُ وَقُرْآنَهُ
translation_english: Surely it is for Us to have you commit it to memory and to recite it.

arabic: فَإِذَا قَرَأْنَاهُ فَاتَّبِعْ قُرْآنَهُ
translation_english: And so when We recite it, follow its recitation attentively;

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا بَيَانَهُ
translation_english: then it will be for Us to explain it.

arabic: كَلَّا بَلْ تُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ
translation_english: Nay; the truth is that you love ardently (the good of this world) that can be obtained hastily,

arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ الْآخِرَةَ
translation_english: and are oblivious of the Hereafter.

arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاضِرَةٌ
translation_english: Some faces on that Day will be fresh and resplendent,

arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٌ
translation_english: and will be looking towards their Lord;

arabic: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ بَاسِرَةٌ
translation_english: and some faces on that Day will be gloomy,

arabic: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفْعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٌ
translation_english: believing that a crushing calamity is about to strike them.

arabic: كَلَّا إِذَا بَلَغَتِ التَّرَاقِيَ
translation_english: Nay; when a man's soul reaches up to the throat,

arabic: وَقِيلَ مَنْ ۜ رَاقٍ
translation_english: and it is said: “Is there any enchanter who can step forward and help (by his chanting)?”

arabic: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ الْفِرَاقُ
translation_english: and he realises that the hour of parting is come,

arabic: وَالْتَفَّتِ السَّاقُ بِالسَّاقِ
translation_english: and calf is inter-twined with calf.

arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْمَسَاقُ
translation_english: On that Day you will be driven to your Lord.

arabic: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ
translation_english: But he did not verify the Truth, nor did he observe Prayer;

arabic: وَلَـٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
translation_english: on the contrary, he gave the lie to the Truth and turned his back upon it,

arabic: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ يَتَمَطَّىٰ
translation_english: then he went back to his kinsfolk, elated with pride.

arabic: أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ
translation_english: This (attitude) is worthy of you, altogether worthy;

arabic: ثُمَّ أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ
translation_english: again, it is worthy of you, altogether worthy.

arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ الْإِنسَانُ أَن يُتْرَكَ سُدًى
translation_english: Does man think that he will be left alone, unquestioned?

arabic: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِّن مَّنِيٍّ يُمْنَىٰ
translation_english: Was he not a drop of ejaculated semen,

arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
translation_english: then he became a clot, and then Allah made it into a living body and proportioned its parts,

arabic: فَجَعَلَ مِنْهُ الزَّوْجَيْنِ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنثَىٰ
translation_english: and then He made of him a pair, male and female?

arabic: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَن يُحْيِيَ الْمَوْتَىٰ
translation_english: Does He, then, not have the power to bring back the dead to life?

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى الْإِنسَانِ حِينٌ مِّنَ الدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْئًا مَّذْكُورًا
translation_english: Was there a period of time when man was not even worthy of a mention?

arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ سَمِيعًا بَصِيرًا
translation_english: Verily We created man out of a drop of intermingled sperm so that We might try him, and We therefore endowed him with hearing and sight.

arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَاهُ السَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
translation_english: Surely We showed him the Right Path, regardless of whether he chooses to be thankful or unthankful (to his Lord).

arabic: إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَافِرِينَ سَلَاسِلَ وَأَغْلَالًا وَسَعِيرًا
translation_english: For the unbelievers, We have kept ready chains and fetters and a Blazing Fire.

arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
translation_english: The virtuous shall drink from a cup tempered with camphor water.

arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ اللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
translation_english: This will be a gushing spring wherefrom Allah's servants shall drink wine, a spring from which they will take out channels wherever they wish.

arabic: يُوفُونَ بِالنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُ مُسْتَطِيرًا
translation_english: These will be the ones who fulfil their vows and dread the Day whose woe shall be spread far and wide;

arabic: وَيُطْعِمُونَ الطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا
translation_english: those who, for the love of Him, feed the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,

arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ اللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَاءً وَلَا شُكُورًا
translation_english: (saying): “We feed you only for Allah's sake; we do not seek of you any recompense or thanks,

arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا
translation_english: we fear from our Lord a Day that shall be long and distressful.”

arabic: فَوَقَاهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّاهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا
translation_english: So Allah shall guard them against the woe of that Day, and will procure them freshness and joy,

arabic: وَجَزَاهُم بِمَا صَبَرُوا جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا
translation_english: and will reward them for their steadfastness with Paradise and robes of silk.

arabic: مُّتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا
translation_english: There they will recline on elevated couches and will be subjected neither to the burning heat of the sun nor to bitter cold.

arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَالُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا
translation_english: The shades of Paradise will bend over them, and its fruits will be brought within their easy reach;

arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِآنِيَةٍ مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا
translation_english: and there shall be passed around them vessels of silver and goblets of crystal,

arabic: قَوَارِيرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا
translation_english: goblets bright as crystal but made of silver, filled to exact measure.

arabic: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
translation_english: Therein they shall be served a cup flavoured with ginger,

arabic: عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا
translation_english: drawn from a spring (in Paradise) called Salsabil.

arabic: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَّنثُورًا
translation_english: There boys of everlasting youth shall go about attending them: when you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.

arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا
translation_english: Whitherto you look around, you will see an abundance of bliss and the glories of a great kingdom.

arabic: عَالِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ ۖ وَحُلُّوا أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا
translation_english: They [i.e., the virtuous] shall be attired in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade and will be adorned with bracelets of silver. Their Lord will give them a pure wine to drink.

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَاءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُم مَّشْكُورًا
translation_english: Behold, this is your recompense and your endeavour has been appreciated.

arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ تَنزِيلًا
translation_english: (O Prophet), indeed We have revealed the Qur'an to you in portions.

arabic: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ آثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا
translation_english: So persevere with the command of your Lord and do not pay any heed to the wicked and the unbelieving,

arabic: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
translation_english: and remember the name of your Lord, morning and evening;

arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَاسْجُدْ لَهُ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا
translation_english: and prostrate yourself before Him at night, and extol His Glory during the long watches of the night.

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ يُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَاءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا
translation_english: Verily they love (the good of this world) that is hastily obtainable and are oblivious of the burdensome Day ahead of them.

arabic: نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَاهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَا أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَا أَمْثَالَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
translation_english: We created them and strengthened their joints; and whenever We wish, We can change their faces entirely.

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
translation_english: Verily this is an Exhortation; so let him who so will take a way to his Lord.

arabic: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
translation_english: But your willing shall be of no avail until Allah Himself so wills. Surely Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.

arabic: يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَاءُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَالظَّالِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
translation_english: He admits to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. As for the wrong-doers, He has prepared for them a grievous chastisement.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْمُرْسَلَاتِ عُرْفًا
translation_english: By the (winds) sent forth in quick succession,

arabic: فَالْعَاصِفَاتِ عَصْفًا
translation_english: which then blow tempestuously

arabic: وَالنَّاشِرَاتِ نَشْرًا
translation_english: and raise (clouds) and scatter them around,

arabic: فَالْفَارِقَاتِ فَرْقًا
translation_english: then winnow them thoroughly,

arabic: فَالْمُلْقِيَاتِ ذِكْرًا
translation_english: and then cast (Allah's) remembrance (in people's hearts),

arabic: عُذْرًا أَوْ نُذْرًا
translation_english: to serve as an excuse or a warning.

arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَاقِعٌ
translation_english: Surely what you are promised shall come to pass.

arabic: فَإِذَا النُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ
translation_english: So when the stars are extinguished,

arabic: وَإِذَا السَّمَاءُ فُرِجَتْ
translation_english: and the sky is rent asunder,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْجِبَالُ نُسِفَتْ
translation_english: and the mountains are blown away,

arabic: وَإِذَا الرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتْ
translation_english: and the appointed time to bring the Messengers together arrives, (then shall the promised event come to pass).

arabic: لِأَيِّ يَوْمٍ أُجِّلَتْ
translation_english: To which Day has this task been deferred?

arabic: لِيَوْمِ الْفَصْلِ
translation_english: To the Day of Judgement.

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ
translation_english: What do you know what the Day of Judgement is?

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: أَلَمْ نُهْلِكِ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: Did We not destroy many a nation of the earlier times?

arabic: ثُمَّ نُتْبِعُهُمُ الْآخِرِينَ
translation_english: And We shall cause those of later times to follow them.

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِالْمُجْرِمِينَ
translation_english: Thus do We deal with the guilty.

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: أَلَمْ نَخْلُقكُّم مِّن مَّاءٍ مَّهِينٍ
translation_english: Did We not create you of a mean fluid,

arabic: فَجَعَلْنَاهُ فِي قَرَارٍ مَّكِينٍ
translation_english: which We then placed in a secure repository

arabic: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
translation_english: until an appointed time?

arabic: فَقَدَرْنَا فَنِعْمَ الْقَادِرُونَ
translation_english: See that We had the power to do so. Great indeed is Our power to do what We will.

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ الْأَرْضَ كِفَاتًا
translation_english: Did We not make the earth a receptacle,

arabic: أَحْيَاءً وَأَمْوَاتًا
translation_english: for the living and the dead,

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ شَامِخَاتٍ وَأَسْقَيْنَاكُم مَّاءً فُرَاتًا
translation_english: and did We not firmly fix towering mountains on it and give you sweet water to drink?

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: انطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation_english: Proceed now towards that which you were wont to deny as false;

arabic: انطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِي ثَلَاثِ شُعَبٍ
translation_english: proceed towards the three-pronged shadow,

arabic: لَّا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِنَ اللَّهَبِ
translation_english: which neither provides (cooling) shade nor protection against the flames;

arabic: إِنَّهَا تَرْمِي بِشَرَرٍ كَالْقَصْرِ
translation_english: it indeed throws up sparks like castles,

arabic: كَأَنَّهُ جِمَالَتٌ صُفْرٌ
translation_english: which seem as though they are yellow-coloured camels.

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ لَا يَنطِقُونَ
translation_english: That will be the Day on which they will not (be able to) utter a word,

arabic: وَلَا يُؤْذَنُ لَهُمْ فَيَعْتَذِرُونَ
translation_english: nor will they be allowed to proffer excuses.

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ ۖ جَمَعْنَاكُمْ وَالْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: That is the Day of Judgement on which We have assembled you as well as all those who went before you.

arabic: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ
translation_english: So if you have any ploy, try it against Me!

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي ظِلَالٍ وَعُيُونٍ
translation_english: Behold, today the God-fearing will be amidst shades and springs,

arabic: وَفَوَاكِهَ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
translation_english: and the fruits that they desire (will be ready at hand).

arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
translation_english: Eat and drink and may every joy attend you as a reward for your deeds.

arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
translation_english: Thus do We reward those that do good.

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: كُلُوا وَتَمَتَّعُوا قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجْرِمُونَ
translation_english: Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while. Surely you are evil-doers.

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ارْكَعُوا لَا يَرْكَعُونَ
translation_english: When it is said to them: “Bow down (before Allah),” they do not bow down.

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثٍ بَعْدَهُ يُؤْمِنُونَ
translation_english: In what discourse after this (Qur'an) will they, then, believe?

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ عَمَّ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
translation_english: About what are they asking one another?

arabic: عَنِ النَّبَإِ الْعَظِيمِ
translation_english: Is it about the awesome tiding

arabic: الَّذِي هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ
translation_english: that they are in utter disagreement?

arabic: كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: No indeed; soon will they come to know;

arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: again, no indeed; soon will they come to know.

arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ الْأَرْضَ مِهَادًا
translation_english: Have We not spread the earth like a bed,

arabic: وَالْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا
translation_english: and fixed the mountains like pegs,

arabic: وَخَلَقْنَاكُمْ أَزْوَاجًا
translation_english: and created you in pairs (as men and women),

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتًا
translation_english: and made your sleep a means of repose,

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا
translation_english: and made the night a covering,

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا النَّهَارَ مَعَاشًا
translation_english: and made the day to seek livelihood,

arabic: وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعًا شِدَادًا
translation_english: and built above you seven strong firmaments,

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا سِرَاجًا وَهَّاجًا
translation_english: and placed therein a hot, shining lamp,

arabic: وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ الْمُعْصِرَاتِ مَاءً ثَجَّاجًا
translation_english: and sent down abundant water from the clouds

arabic: لِّنُخْرِجَ بِهِ حَبًّا وَنَبَاتًا
translation_english: so that We may thereby bring forth grain and vegetation,

arabic: وَجَنَّاتٍ أَلْفَافًا
translation_english: and gardens dense with foliage?

arabic: إِنَّ يَوْمَ الْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَاتًا
translation_english: Surely the Day of Judgement has an appointed time;

arabic: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا
translation_english: the Day when the Trumpet shall be blown, and you will come forth in multitudes;

arabic: وَفُتِحَتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَابًا
translation_english: and when the sky shall be opened up and will become all doors;

arabic: وَسُيِّرَتِ الْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَابًا
translation_english: and the mountains will be set in motion and become a mirage.

arabic: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا
translation_english: Surely the Hell is an ambush,

arabic: لِّلطَّاغِينَ مَآبًا
translation_english: a resort for the rebellious;

arabic: لَّابِثِينَ فِيهَا أَحْقَابًا
translation_english: therein they shall abide for ages,

arabic: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا
translation_english: they shall taste in it no coolness, nor any pleasant drink

arabic: إِلَّا حَمِيمًا وَغَسَّاقًا
translation_english: save boiling water and wash of the wounds;

arabic: جَزَاءً وِفَاقًا
translation_english: a befitting recompense for their deeds.

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ حِسَابًا
translation_english: For indeed they did not look forward to any reckoning,

arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كِذَّابًا
translation_english: and roundly denied Our Signs as false.

arabic: وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ كِتَابًا
translation_english: And everything have We recorded in a Book.

arabic: فَذُوقُوا فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمْ إِلَّا عَذَابًا
translation_english: So taste (the fruit of your deeds). We shall only increase your torment.

arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا
translation_english: Surely the state of triumph awaits the God-fearing:

arabic: حَدَائِقَ وَأَعْنَابًا
translation_english: gardens and vineyards,

arabic: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتْرَابًا
translation_english: and youthful maidens of like age,

arabic: وَكَأْسًا دِهَاقًا
translation_english: and an overflowing cup.

arabic: لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّابًا
translation_english: Therein they shall hear no idle talk, nor any falsehood;

arabic: جَزَاءً مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَاءً حِسَابًا
translation_english: a recompense from your Lord and an ample reward

arabic: رَّبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا
translation_english: from the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of that which is between them; the Most Merciful Lord before Whom none dare utter a word.

arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الرُّوحُ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ صَفًّا ۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا
translation_english: The Day when the Spirit and the angels are ranged row on row. None shall speak save he whom the Merciful Lord will permit; and he too will speak what is right.

arabic: ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَن شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ مَآبًا
translation_english: That Day is sure to come. So let him who will seek a resort with his Lord.

arabic: إِنَّا أَنذَرْنَاكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنظُرُ الْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ الْكَافِرُ يَا لَيْتَنِي كُنتُ تُرَابًا
translation_english: Lo! We warn you of a chastisement near at hand; the Day when a man will look on what his own hands have sent forth, and the unbelievers shall say: “Oh would that I were utter dust.”

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالنَّازِعَاتِ غَرْقًا
translation_english: By those (angels) that pluck out the soul from depths,

arabic: وَالنَّاشِطَاتِ نَشْطًا
translation_english: and gently take it away;

arabic: وَالسَّابِحَاتِ سَبْحًا
translation_english: and by those that speedily glide along (the cosmos),

arabic: فَالسَّابِقَاتِ سَبْقًا
translation_english: and vie with the others (in carrying out their Lord's behests);

arabic: فَالْمُدَبِّرَاتِ أَمْرًا
translation_english: and then manage the affairs of the Universe (according to their Lord's commands).

arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الرَّاجِفَةُ
translation_english: The Day when the quaking will cause a violent convulsion,

arabic: تَتْبَعُهَا الرَّادِفَةُ
translation_english: and will be followed by another quaking.

arabic: قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ
translation_english: On that Day some hearts shall tremble (with fright),

arabic: أَبْصَارُهَا خَاشِعَةٌ
translation_english: and their eyes shall be downcast with dread.

arabic: يَقُولُونَ أَإِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِي الْحَافِرَةِ
translation_english: They say: “Shall we indeed be restored to life,

arabic: أَإِذَا كُنَّا عِظَامًا نَّخِرَةً
translation_english: even after we have been reduced to bones, hollow and rotten?”

arabic: قَالُوا تِلْكَ إِذًا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٌ
translation_english: They say: “That will then be a return with a great loss!”

arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
translation_english: Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,

arabic: فَإِذَا هُم بِالسَّاهِرَةِ
translation_english: and lo, they will all be in the open plain.

arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ
translation_english: Has Moses' story reached you?

arabic: إِذْ نَادَاهُ رَبُّهُ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
translation_english: When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,

arabic: اذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
translation_english: and directed him: “Go to Pharaoh, he has rebelled,

arabic: فَقُلْ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ
translation_english: and say to him: 'Are you willing to be purified,

arabic: وَأَهْدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخْشَىٰ
translation_english: that I may direct you to your Lord and then you hold Him in awe?'”

arabic: فَأَرَاهُ الْآيَةَ الْكُبْرَىٰ
translation_english: Then Moses (went to Pharaoh and) showed him the Great Sign;

arabic: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ
translation_english: but he denied it as false and disobeyed,

arabic: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ يَسْعَىٰ
translation_english: and then he turned back to have recourse to his craftiness,

arabic: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ
translation_english: and gathered his people and declared:

arabic: فَقَالَ أَنَا رَبُّكُمُ الْأَعْلَىٰ
translation_english: “I am the supreme lord of you all.”

arabic: فَأَخَذَهُ اللَّهُ نَكَالَ الْآخِرَةِ وَالْأُولَىٰ
translation_english: Thereupon Allah seized him for the chastisement of the World to Come as well as of the present.

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰ
translation_english: Surely there is a great lesson in it for whoever would fear (Allah).

arabic: أَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ السَّمَاءُ ۚ بَنَاهَا
translation_english: Is it harder to create you or the heaven? But Allah built it,

arabic: رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا فَسَوَّاهَا
translation_english: and raised its vault high and proportioned it;

arabic: وَأَغْطَشَ لَيْلَهَا وَأَخْرَجَ ضُحَاهَا
translation_english: and covered its night with darkness and brought forth from it its day;

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَاهَا
translation_english: and thereafter spread out the earth,

arabic: أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَاءَهَا وَمَرْعَاهَا
translation_english: and brought out of it its water and its pasture,

arabic: وَالْجِبَالَ أَرْسَاهَا
translation_english: and firmly fixed in it mountains;

arabic: مَتَاعًا لَّكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَامِكُمْ
translation_english: all this as provision for you and your cattle.

arabic: فَإِذَا جَاءَتِ الطَّامَّةُ الْكُبْرَىٰ
translation_english: But when the great calamity will come about

arabic: يَوْمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنسَانُ مَا سَعَىٰ
translation_english: on the Day when man will recall all his strivings,

arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ
translation_english: and Hell will be brought in sight for anyone to see:

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ
translation_english: then he who transgressed

arabic: وَآثَرَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
translation_english: and preferred the life of this world,

arabic: فَإِنَّ الْجَحِيمَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ
translation_english: most surely his abode shall be Hell.

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ وَنَهَى النَّفْسَ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ
translation_english: But he who feared to stand before his Lord, and restrained himself from evil desires,

arabic: فَإِنَّ الْجَنَّةَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ
translation_english: most surely his abode shall be Paradise.

arabic: يَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ السَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَاهَا
translation_english: They ask you about the Hour: “When will it be?”

arabic: فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكْرَاهَا
translation_english: What concern do you have to speak about that?

arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَاهَا
translation_english: Its knowledge rests with your Lord.

arabic: إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخْشَاهَا
translation_english: You are only a warner to him who has a fear of it.

arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوا إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَاهَا
translation_english: On the Day they see it, they will feel as though they had stayed (in the grave) no more than one evening or one morning.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
translation_english: He frowned and turned away

arabic: أَن جَاءَهُ الْأَعْمَىٰ
translation_english: that the blind man came to him.

arabic: وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُ يَزَّكَّىٰ
translation_english: How could you know? Perhaps he would cleanse himself,

arabic: أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ
translation_english: or he might be mindful and good counsel might avail him.

arabic: أَمَّا مَنِ اسْتَغْنَىٰ
translation_english: Now he who waxes indifferent,

arabic: فَأَنتَ لَهُ تَصَدَّىٰ
translation_english: you attend to him,

arabic: وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ
translation_english: though you are not to blame if he would not cleanse himself.

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَن جَاءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ
translation_english: But he who comes to you running,

arabic: وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ
translation_english: and fears (Allah),

arabic: فَأَنتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ
translation_english: you pay no heed to him.

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهَا تَذْكِرَةٌ
translation_english: No indeed; this is only a Reminder.

arabic: فَمَن شَاءَ ذَكَرَهُ
translation_english: So whoso wills may give heed to it.

arabic: فِي صُحُفٍ مُّكَرَّمَةٍ
translation_english: It is contained in scrolls highly honoured,

arabic: مَّرْفُوعَةٍ مُّطَهَّرَةٍ
translation_english: most exalted and purified,

arabic: بِأَيْدِي سَفَرَةٍ
translation_english: borne by the hands of scribes,

arabic: كِرَامٍ بَرَرَةٍ
translation_english: noble and purified.

arabic: قُتِلَ الْإِنسَانُ مَا أَكْفَرَهُ
translation_english: Accursed be man! How stubbornly he denies the Truth.

arabic: مِنْ أَيِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقَهُ
translation_english: Out of what did Allah create him?

arabic: مِن نُّطْفَةٍ خَلَقَهُ فَقَدَّرَهُ
translation_english: Out of a sperm-drop did He create him and then determined a measure for him,

arabic: ثُمَّ السَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُ
translation_english: and then made the course of life easy for him,

arabic: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُ فَأَقْبَرَهُ
translation_english: then He caused him to die and brought him to the grave,

arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَاءَ أَنشَرَهُ
translation_english: and then, whenever He wishes, He will raise him back to life.

arabic: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقْضِ مَا أَمَرَهُ
translation_english: Nay, but man did not fulfil what Allah had enjoined upon him.

arabic: فَلْيَنظُرِ الْإِنسَانُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِ
translation_english: So let man just consider his food:

arabic: أَنَّا صَبَبْنَا الْمَاءَ صَبًّا
translation_english: We poured water, pouring it in great abundance,

arabic: ثُمَّ شَقَقْنَا الْأَرْضَ شَقًّا
translation_english: and cleaved the earth, cleaving it asunder;

arabic: فَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا حَبًّا
translation_english: then caused the grain to grow out of it,

arabic: وَعِنَبًا وَقَضْبًا
translation_english: together with grapes and vegetables,

arabic: وَزَيْتُونًا وَنَخْلًا
translation_english: and olives and palms,

arabic: وَحَدَائِقَ غُلْبًا
translation_english: and dense orchards,

arabic: وَفَاكِهَةً وَأَبًّا
translation_english: and fruits and pastures –

arabic: مَّتَاعًا لَّكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَامِكُمْ
translation_english: all this as a provision for you and your cattle.

arabic: فَإِذَا جَاءَتِ الصَّاخَّةُ
translation_english: But when the deafening cry shall be sounded

arabic: يَوْمَ يَفِرُّ الْمَرْءُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ
translation_english: on the Day when each man shall flee from his brother,

arabic: وَأُمِّهِ وَأَبِيهِ
translation_english: and his mother and his father;

arabic: وَصَاحِبَتِهِ وَبَنِيهِ
translation_english: and his consort and his children;

arabic: لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ
translation_english: on that Day each will be occupied with his own business, making him oblivious of all save himself.

arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُّسْفِرَةٌ
translation_english: Some faces on that Day shall be beaming with happiness,

arabic: ضَاحِكَةٌ مُّسْتَبْشِرَةٌ
translation_english: and be cheerful and joyous.

arabic: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَلَيْهَا غَبَرَةٌ
translation_english: Some faces on that Day shall be dust-ridden,

arabic: تَرْهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ
translation_english: enveloped by darkness.

arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمُ الْكَفَرَةُ الْفَجَرَةُ
translation_english: These will be the unbelievers, the wicked.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا الشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ
translation_english: When the sun shall be folded up,

arabic: وَإِذَا النُّجُومُ انكَدَرَتْ
translation_english: when the stars shall scatter away,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ
translation_english: when the mountains shall be set in motion,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ
translation_english: when the ten-months pregnant camels shall be abandoned,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ
translation_english: when the savage beasts shall be brought together,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ
translation_english: when the seas shall be set boiling,

arabic: وَإِذَا النُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ
translation_english: when the souls shall be rejoined (with their bodies),

arabic: وَإِذَا الْمَوْءُودَةُ سُئِلَتْ
translation_english: and when the girl-child buried alive shall be asked:

arabic: بِأَيِّ ذَنبٍ قُتِلَتْ
translation_english: for what offence was she killed?

arabic: وَإِذَا الصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ
translation_english: and when the scrolls of (men's) deeds shall be unfolded,

arabic: وَإِذَا السَّمَاءُ كُشِطَتْ
translation_english: and when Heaven is laid bare;

arabic: وَإِذَا الْجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتْ
translation_english: and Hell is stoked,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْجَنَّةُ أُزْلِفَتْ
translation_english: and Paradise brought nigh:

arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّا أَحْضَرَتْ
translation_english: then shall each person know what he has brought along.

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالْخُنَّسِ
translation_english: No indeed; I swear by the alternating stars

arabic: الْجَوَارِ الْكُنَّسِ
translation_english: that hide,

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا عَسْعَسَ
translation_english: and by the night as it recedes,

arabic: وَالصُّبْحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ
translation_english: and the morn as it breathes.

arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
translation_english: Verily this is the word of a noble message-bearer;

arabic: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي الْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ
translation_english: one mighty and held in honour with the Lord of the Throne;

arabic: مُّطَاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمِينٍ
translation_english: there he is obeyed and held trustworthy.

arabic: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجْنُونٍ
translation_english: (O people of Makkah), your companion is not mad;

arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ بِالْأُفُقِ الْمُبِينِ
translation_english: he indeed saw the message-bearer on the clear horizon;

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى الْغَيْبِ بِضَنِينٍ
translation_english: nor does he grudge (conveying this knowledge about) the Unseen;
