arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَانٍ رَّجِيمٍ
translation_english: nor is it a word of an accursed Satan.

arabic: فَأَيْنَ تَذْهَبُونَ
translation_english: Where to are you then heading?

arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: It is nothing but Good Counsel for everyone in the world,

arabic: لِمَن شَاءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَسْتَقِيمَ
translation_english: for everyone of you who wishes to follow the Straight Way;

arabic: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: but your wishing will not avail unless Allah, the Lord of the Universe, so wishes.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انفَطَرَتْ
translation_english: When the heaven is split asunder,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْكَوَاكِبُ انتَثَرَتْ
translation_english: when the stars are scattered,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ
translation_english: when the seas are made to burst forth,

arabic: وَإِذَا الْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ
translation_english: and when graves are laid open,

arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ
translation_english: everyone shall know all his deeds, both the earlier and the later.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنسَانُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ الْكَرِيمِ
translation_english: O man! What has deceived you about your generous Lord

arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّاكَ فَعَدَلَكَ
translation_english: Who created you, shaped you, and made you well-proportioned,

arabic: فِي أَيِّ صُورَةٍ مَّا شَاءَ رَكَّبَكَ
translation_english: and set you in whatever form He pleased?

arabic: كَلَّا بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِالدِّينِ
translation_english: No indeed; (the fact is that) you deny the Reckoning, declaring it a lie;

arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَافِظِينَ
translation_english: you do so the while there are watchers over you;

arabic: كِرَامًا كَاتِبِينَ
translation_english: noble scribes,

arabic: يَعْلَمُونَ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ
translation_english: who know what you do.

arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ
translation_english: Surely the virtuous shall be in Bliss,

arabic: وَإِنَّ الْفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٍ
translation_english: and the wicked shall be in the Blazing Fire.

arabic: يَصْلَوْنَهَا يَوْمَ الدِّينِ
translation_english: They shall enter it on the Day of Recompense

arabic: وَمَا هُمْ عَنْهَا بِغَائِبِينَ
translation_english: and then shall never come out of it.

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
translation_english: What do you know what the Day of Recompense is?

arabic: ثُمَّ مَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
translation_english: Again, what do you know what the Day of Recompense is?

arabic: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِّنَفْسٍ شَيْئًا ۖ وَالْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلَّهِ
translation_english: It is the Day when no one shall have the power to do anything for another, and all command shall be Allah's.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِّلْمُطَفِّفِينَ
translation_english: Woe to the stinters;

arabic: الَّذِينَ إِذَا اكْتَالُوا عَلَى النَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
translation_english: those who, when they take from others by measure, take their full share;

arabic: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ
translation_english: but who, when they measure or weigh for others, give less than their due.

arabic: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُولَـٰئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبْعُوثُونَ
translation_english: Do they not realise that they will be raised to life

arabic: لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
translation_english: on a Great Day,

arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ النَّاسُ لِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
translation_english: a Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the Universe?

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٍ
translation_english: No indeed! Verily the deeds of the wicked are in the Record locked up in the prison-house!

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ
translation_english: And how would you know what the Record of the prison-house is?

arabic: كِتَابٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
translation_english: It is a Book inscribed.

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation_english: Woe, then, to those that give the lie,

arabic: الَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ
translation_english: those that give the lie to the Day of Recompense.

arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
translation_english: Yet none gives the lie to it except the transgressor immersed in sin;

arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
translation_english: who, when Our verses are recited to him, says: “Mere tales of olden times!”

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
translation_english: No indeed! The truth is that their hearts have become rusted on account of their evil deeds.

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
translation_english: No indeed! On that Day they will be screened off from seeing their Lord,

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُو الْجَحِيمِ
translation_english: and then they shall enter Hell,

arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَـٰذَا الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation_english: whereafter they will be told: “This is what you used to give the lie to.”

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْأَبْرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ
translation_english: No indeed! Verily, the deeds of the virtuous shall be in the record of the exalted ones.

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ
translation_english: And what do you know what the Record of the exalted ones is?

arabic: كِتَابٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
translation_english: It is a Book inscribed,

arabic: يَشْهَدُهُ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ
translation_english: which the angels placed near Allah to safeguard.

arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ
translation_english: Verily the virtuous shall be in Bliss;

arabic: عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
translation_english: resting on couches, looking around.

arabic: تَعْرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمْ نَضْرَةَ النَّعِيمِ
translation_english: You shall see upon their faces the glow of bliss.

arabic: يُسْقَوْنَ مِن رَّحِيقٍ مَّخْتُومٍ
translation_english: They will be served a drink of the finest sealed wine,

arabic: خِتَامُهُ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ الْمُتَنَافِسُونَ
translation_english: whose seal is musk – so let all aspirants aspire after that –

arabic: وَمِزَاجُهُ مِن تَسْنِيمٍ
translation_english: a wine whose mixture is Tasnim,

arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا الْمُقَرَّبُونَ
translation_english: a fountain at which the chosen ones shall drink.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا كَانُوا مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَضْحَكُونَ
translation_english: Behold, the wicked were wont to laugh at the believers:

arabic: وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِهِمْ يَتَغَامَزُونَ
translation_english: when they passed by them they winked,

arabic: وَإِذَا انقَلَبُوا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمُ انقَلَبُوا فَكِهِينَ
translation_english: and when they went back to their families, they went back jesting,

arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوا إِنَّ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ لَضَالُّونَ
translation_english: and when they saw the believers, they said: “Lo! These are the erring ones”;

arabic: وَمَا أُرْسِلُوا عَلَيْهِمْ حَافِظِينَ
translation_english: (they said so although) they had not been appointed watchers over them.

arabic: فَالْيَوْمَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنَ الْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
translation_english: But today the believers are laughing at the unbelievers;

arabic: عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
translation_english: seated upon their couches, they are looking around.

arabic: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ الْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ
translation_english: Have the unbelievers been duly rewarded for their deeds?

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انشَقَّتْ
translation_english: When the sky is rent asunder

arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
translation_english: and hearkens to the command of its Lord, doing what it should;

arabic: وَإِذَا الْأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ
translation_english: and when the earth is stretched out

arabic: وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ
translation_english: and casts out what is within it and is emptied,

arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
translation_english: and hearkens to the command of its Lord, doing what it should.

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنسَانُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَاقِيهِ
translation_english: O man, you are striving unto your Lord and you will meet Him.

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ
translation_english: Whoever is given the Record in his right hand

arabic: فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابًا يَسِيرًا
translation_english: shall be called to an easy accounting,

arabic: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا
translation_english: and shall return to his people joyfully.

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ وَرَاءَ ظَهْرِهِ
translation_english: But he who is given the Record behind his back,

arabic: فَسَوْفَ يَدْعُو ثُبُورًا
translation_english: shall cry for “perdition,”

arabic: وَيَصْلَىٰ سَعِيرًا
translation_english: and will enter the Blazing Fire.

arabic: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فِي أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا
translation_english: He used to live joyfully among his people,

arabic: إِنَّهُ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ
translation_english: thinking he would never revert (to Us).

arabic: بَلَىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كَانَ بِهِ بَصِيرًا
translation_english: But no; (how would he not revert)? His Lord was ever watching him.

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالشَّفَقِ
translation_english: Nay; I swear by the twilight;

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ
translation_english: and by the night and what it enfolds,

arabic: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا اتَّسَقَ
translation_english: and by the moon, when it reaches its fullness:

arabic: لَتَرْكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٍ
translation_english: you shall proceed onwards from stage to stage.

arabic: فَمَا لَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
translation_english: So, what is the matter with them that they do not believe,

arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقُرْآنُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ ۩
translation_english: and when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate themselves?

arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يُكَذِّبُونَ
translation_english: Instead, the unbelievers reject it, calling it a lie.

arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ
translation_english: Allah knows best what they are accumulating (in their Record).

arabic: فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
translation_english: So give them the good news of a painful chastisement,

arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
translation_english: except for those who believe and do good deeds. Theirs shall be an unending reward.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْبُرُوجِ
translation_english: By the heaven with its impregnable castles;

arabic: وَالْيَوْمِ الْمَوْعُودِ
translation_english: by the Promised Day,

arabic: وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ
translation_english: and by the witness and what is witnessed:

arabic: قُتِلَ أَصْحَابُ الْأُخْدُودِ
translation_english: the people of the pit were destroyed

arabic: النَّارِ ذَاتِ الْوَقُودِ
translation_english: with fire abounding in fuel,

arabic: إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ
translation_english: while they sat around it,

arabic: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ
translation_english: and were witnessing what they did to the believers.

arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُوا مِنْهُمْ إِلَّا أَن يُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَمِيدِ
translation_english: Against these they had no grudge except that they believed in Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Praiseworthy,

arabic: الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
translation_english: to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Allah witnesses everything.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ الْحَرِيقِ
translation_english: Surely those who tormented the believing men and the believing women and then did not repent, theirs shall be the chastisement of Hell, and theirs shall be the chastisement of burning.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْكَبِيرُ
translation_english: As for those who believed and acted righteously, theirs shall be Gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great triumph.

arabic: إِنَّ بَطْشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ
translation_english: Stern indeed is your Lord's punishment.

arabic: إِنَّهُ هُوَ يُبْدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ
translation_english: He it is Who creates for the first time and He it is Who will create again,

arabic: وَهُوَ الْغَفُورُ الْوَدُودُ
translation_english: and He is the Ever Forgiving, the Most Loving

arabic: ذُو الْعَرْشِ الْمَجِيدُ
translation_english: – the Lord of the Glorious Throne,

arabic: فَعَّالٌ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ
translation_english: the Executor of what He wills.

arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْجُنُودِ
translation_english: Has the story of the armies reached you,

arabic: فِرْعَوْنَ وَثَمُودَ
translation_english: the armies of Pharaoh and Thamud?

arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي تَكْذِيبٍ
translation_english: The unbelievers are indeed engaged in denying it, calling it a lie,

arabic: وَاللَّهُ مِن وَرَائِهِم مُّحِيطٌ
translation_english: although Allah surrounds them.

arabic: بَلْ هُوَ قُرْآنٌ مَّجِيدٌ
translation_english: Nay; but this is a glorious Qur'an,

arabic: فِي لَوْحٍ مَّحْفُوظٍ
translation_english: inscribed on a well-guarded Tablet.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالسَّمَاءِ وَالطَّارِقِ
translation_english: By the heaven, and the night-visitor,

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الطَّارِقُ
translation_english: what do you know what the night-visitor is?

arabic: النَّجْمُ الثَّاقِبُ
translation_english: It is the piercing star.

arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَّمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
translation_english: There is no living being but there is a protector over it.

arabic: فَلْيَنظُرِ الْإِنسَانُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ
translation_english: So let man consider of what he was created.

arabic: خُلِقَ مِن مَّاءٍ دَافِقٍ
translation_english: He was created of a gushing fluid,

arabic: يَخْرُجُ مِن بَيْنِ الصُّلْبِ وَالتَّرَائِبِ
translation_english: emanating from between the loins and the ribs.

arabic: إِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَجْعِهِ لَقَادِرٌ
translation_english: Surely He (the Creator) has the power to bring him back (to life).

arabic: يَوْمَ تُبْلَى السَّرَائِرُ
translation_english: On the Day when man's deepest secrets shall be put to the test

arabic: فَمَا لَهُ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ
translation_english: he shall have no power, and no helper.

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الرَّجْعِ
translation_english: By the heaven with its recurring cycle of rain,

arabic: وَالْأَرْضِ ذَاتِ الصَّدْعِ
translation_english: and by the earth ever bursting with verdure,

arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلٌ فَصْلٌ
translation_english: this (Qur'an) is surely a decisive Word,

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِالْهَزْلِ
translation_english: not a flippant jest.

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْدًا
translation_english: They are devising a guile,

arabic: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْدًا
translation_english: and I too am devising a guile.

arabic: فَمَهِّلِ الْكَافِرِينَ أَمْهِلْهُمْ رُوَيْدًا
translation_english: So leave the unbelievers to themselves; respite them awhile.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَبِّحِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ الْأَعْلَى
translation_english: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High,

arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
translation_english: Who created all things and fashioned them in good proportion;

arabic: وَالَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ
translation_english: Who determined and guided them,

arabic: وَالَّذِي أَخْرَجَ الْمَرْعَىٰ
translation_english: Who brought forth the pasture,

arabic: فَجَعَلَهُ غُثَاءً أَحْوَىٰ
translation_english: and then made it into a blackish straw.

arabic: سَنُقْرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰ
translation_english: We shall make you recite and then you will not forget,

arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ الْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
translation_english: except what Allah should wish. He knows all that is manifest and all that is hidden.

arabic: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
translation_english: We shall ease you to follow the way of Ease.

arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِن نَّفَعَتِ الذِّكْرَىٰ
translation_english: So render good counsel if good counsel will avail.

arabic: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰ
translation_english: He who fears (Allah) shall heed it,

arabic: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا الْأَشْقَى
translation_english: but the wretched will turn away from it.

arabic: الَّذِي يَصْلَى النَّارَ الْكُبْرَىٰ
translation_english: He will be cast into the Great Fire.

arabic: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
translation_english: Then he will neither die in it, nor live.

arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ
translation_english: He who purified himself shall prosper,

arabic: وَذَكَرَ اسْمَ رَبِّهِ فَصَلَّىٰ
translation_english: remembering his Lord's name and praying.

arabic: بَلْ تُؤْثِرُونَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
translation_english: No; but you prefer the present life,

arabic: وَالْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ
translation_english: whereas the Hereafter is better and more enduring.

arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَفِي الصُّحُفِ الْأُولَىٰ
translation_english: This, indeed, was in the ancient Scrolls,

arabic: صُحُفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ
translation_english: the Scrolls of Abraham and Moses.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْغَاشِيَةِ
translation_english: Has the news of the overwhelming event reached you?

arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَاشِعَةٌ
translation_english: Some faces that Day shall be downcast with fear,

arabic: عَامِلَةٌ نَّاصِبَةٌ
translation_english: be toiling and worn-out;

arabic: تَصْلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةً
translation_english: they shall burn in a Scorching Fire;

arabic: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ آنِيَةٍ
translation_english: their drink shall be from a boiling spring.

arabic: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍ
translation_english: They shall have no food except bitter dry thorns

arabic: لَّا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِن جُوعٍ
translation_english: that will neither nourish nor satisfy their hunger.

arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاعِمَةٌ
translation_english: On that very Day some faces shall be radiant with joy,

arabic: لِّسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ
translation_english: well-pleased with their striving.

arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
translation_english: They will be in a lofty Garden

arabic: لَّا تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا لَاغِيَةً
translation_english: wherein they shall hear no vain talk.

arabic: فِيهَا عَيْنٌ جَارِيَةٌ
translation_english: In it there shall be a flowing spring,

arabic: فِيهَا سُرُرٌ مَّرْفُوعَةٌ
translation_english: and couches raised high,

arabic: وَأَكْوَابٌ مَّوْضُوعَةٌ
translation_english: and goblets laid out,

arabic: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصْفُوفَةٌ
translation_english: and cushions arrayed in rows,

arabic: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ
translation_english: and rich carpets levelled out.

arabic: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى الْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
translation_english: Do (these unbelievers) not observe the camels: how they were created?

arabic: وَإِلَى السَّمَاءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ
translation_english: And the sky: how it was raised high?

arabic: وَإِلَى الْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ
translation_english: And the mountains: how they were fixed?

arabic: وَإِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ
translation_english: And the earth: how it was spread out?

arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٌ
translation_english: So render good counsel, for you are simply required to counsel,

arabic: لَّسْتَ عَلَيْهِم بِمُصَيْطِرٍ
translation_english: and are not invested with the authority to compel them.

arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
translation_english: But whoever will turn away (from the Truth),

arabic: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ اللَّهُ الْعَذَابَ الْأَكْبَرَ
translation_english: Allah will chastise him with the most terrible chastisement.

arabic: إِنَّ إِلَيْنَا إِيَابَهُمْ
translation_english: Surely to Us is their return;

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا حِسَابَهُم
translation_english: and then it is for Us to call them to account.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْفَجْرِ
translation_english: By the dawn,

arabic: وَلَيَالٍ عَشْرٍ
translation_english: and the ten nights,

arabic: وَالشَّفْعِ وَالْوَتْرِ
translation_english: and the even and the odd,

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ
translation_english: and by the night when it departs.

arabic: هَلْ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِي حِجْرٍ
translation_english: Is there in this an oath for one endowed with understanding?

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
translation_english: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with Ad

arabic: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ الْعِمَادِ
translation_english: of Iram, known for their lofty columns,

arabic: الَّتِي لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِي الْبِلَادِ
translation_english: the like of whom no nation was ever created in the lands of the world?

arabic: وَثَمُودَ الَّذِينَ جَابُوا الصَّخْرَ بِالْوَادِ
translation_english: And how did He deal with Thamud who hewed out rocks in the valley?

arabic: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِي الْأَوْتَادِ
translation_english: And with Pharaoh of the tent pegs

arabic: الَّذِينَ طَغَوْا فِي الْبِلَادِ
translation_english: who transgressed in the countries of the world

arabic: فَأَكْثَرُوا فِيهَا الْفَسَادَ
translation_english: spreading in them much corruption?

arabic: فَصَبَّ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّكَ سَوْطَ عَذَابٍ
translation_english: Then their Lord unloosed upon them the lash of chastisement.

arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِالْمِرْصَادِ
translation_english: Truly your Lord is ever watchful.

arabic: فَأَمَّا الْإِنسَانُ إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكْرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَكْرَمَنِ
translation_english: As for man, when his Lord tests him by exalting him and bestowing His bounties upon him, he says: “My Lord has exalted me.”

arabic: وَأَمَّا إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَهَانَنِ
translation_english: But when He tests him by straitening his sustenance, he says: “My Lord has humiliated me.”

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَل لَّا تُكْرِمُونَ الْيَتِيمَ
translation_english: But no; you do not treat the orphan honourably,

arabic: وَلَا تَحَاضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ
translation_english: and do not urge one another to feed the poor,

arabic: وَتَأْكُلُونَ التُّرَاثَ أَكْلًا لَّمًّا
translation_english: and greedily devour the entire inheritance,

arabic: وَتُحِبُّونَ الْمَالَ حُبًّا جَمًّا
translation_english: and love the riches, loving them ardently.

arabic: كَلَّا إِذَا دُكَّتِ الْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
translation_english: But no; when the earth is ground to powder,

arabic: وَجَاءَ رَبُّكَ وَالْمَلَكُ صَفًّا صَفًّا
translation_english: and when your Lord appears with rows upon rows of angels,

arabic: وَجِيءَ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنسَانُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ
translation_english: and when Hell is brought near that Day. On that Day will man understand, but of what avail will that understanding be?

arabic: يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي قَدَّمْتُ لِحَيَاتِي
translation_english: He will say: “Would that I had sent ahead what would be of avail for this life of mine!”

arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُ أَحَدٌ
translation_english: Then on that Day Allah will chastise as none other can chastise;

arabic: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُ أَحَدٌ
translation_english: and Allah will bind as none other can bind.

arabic: يَا أَيَّتُهَا النَّفْسُ الْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ
translation_english: (On the other hand it will be said): “O serene soul!

arabic: ارْجِعِي إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَّرْضِيَّةً
translation_english: Return to your Lord well-pleased (with your blissful destination), well-pleasing (to your Lord).

arabic: فَادْخُلِي فِي عِبَادِي
translation_english: So enter among My (righteous) servants

arabic: وَادْخُلِي جَنَّتِي
translation_english: and enter My Paradise.”

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِهَـٰذَا الْبَلَدِ
translation_english: Nay! I swear by this city

arabic: وَأَنتَ حِلٌّ بِهَـٰذَا الْبَلَدِ
translation_english: – this city wherein you have been rendered violable–

arabic: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ
translation_english: and I swear by the parent and his offspring:

arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ فِي كَبَدٍ
translation_english: Verily We have created man into toil and hardship.

arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
translation_english: Does he think that no one can overpower him?

arabic: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالًا لُّبَدًا
translation_english: He says: “I have squandered enormous wealth.”

arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّمْ يَرَهُ أَحَدٌ
translation_english: Does he believe that none has seen him?

arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُ عَيْنَيْنِ
translation_english: Did We not grant him two eyes,

arabic: وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ
translation_english: and a tongue and two lips?

arabic: وَهَدَيْنَاهُ النَّجْدَيْنِ
translation_english: And did We not show him the two highroads (of good and evil)?

arabic: فَلَا اقْتَحَمَ الْعَقَبَةَ
translation_english: But he did not venture to scale the difficult steep.

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْعَقَبَةُ
translation_english: And what do you know what that difficult steep is?

arabic: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
translation_english: It is freeing someone's neck from slavery;

arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ
translation_english: or giving food on a day of hunger

arabic: يَتِيمًا ذَا مَقْرَبَةٍ
translation_english: to an orphan near of kin;

arabic: أَوْ مِسْكِينًا ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ
translation_english: or to a destitute lying in dust;

arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ
translation_english: and, then besides this, he be one of those who believed, and enjoined upon one another steadfastness and enjoined upon one another compassion.

arabic: أُولَـٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ
translation_english: These are the People of the Right Hand.

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ
translation_english: As for those who rejected Our Signs, they are the People of the Left Hand.

arabic: عَلَيْهِمْ نَارٌ مُّؤْصَدَةٌ
translation_english: Upon them shall be a Fire that will hem them in.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالشَّمْسِ وَضُحَاهَا
translation_english: By the sun and its heat and brightness,

arabic: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَاهَا
translation_english: and by the moon as it follows it;

arabic: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّاهَا
translation_english: and by the day as it displays the sun's glory,

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَاهَا
translation_english: and by the night as it envelopes the sun;

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ وَمَا بَنَاهَا
translation_english: and by the sky and by Him Who made it;

arabic: وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَاهَا
translation_english: and by the earth and by Him Who stretched it out;

arabic: وَنَفْسٍ وَمَا سَوَّاهَا
translation_english: and by the soul and by Him Who perfectly proportioned it,

arabic: فَأَلْهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقْوَاهَا
translation_english: and imbued it with (the consciousness of) its evil and its piety:

arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن زَكَّاهَا
translation_english: He who purifies it will prosper,

arabic: وَقَدْ خَابَ مَن دَسَّاهَا
translation_english: and he who suppresses it will be ruined.

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِطَغْوَاهَا
translation_english: In their presumptuous insolence the Thamud called the Truth a lie

arabic: إِذِ انبَعَثَ أَشْقَاهَا
translation_english: when their arch-criminal rose up in rage.

arabic: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ نَاقَةَ اللَّهِ وَسُقْيَاهَا
translation_english: Then Allah's Messenger warned them: “Hands off the she-camel and her drink!”

arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُم بِذَنبِهِمْ فَسَوَّاهَا
translation_english: But they rejected his statement as a lie and hamstrung the she-camel. For that crime their Lord rumbled down upon them, utterly razing them to the ground.

arabic: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقْبَاهَا
translation_english: He has no fear of its sequel.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ
translation_english: By the night when it enshrouds,

arabic: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ
translation_english: and by the day when it breaks in its glory,

arabic: وَمَا خَلَقَ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنثَىٰ
translation_english: and by Him Who created the male and the female:

arabic: إِنَّ سَعْيَكُمْ لَشَتَّىٰ
translation_english: surely your strivings are divergent.

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَاتَّقَىٰ
translation_english: As for him who gave out his wealth (for Allah's sake) and abstained (from disobeying Him),

arabic: وَصَدَّقَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ
translation_english: and affirmed the Truth of goodness:

arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
translation_english: We shall facilitate for him the Way to Bliss.

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَن بَخِلَ وَاسْتَغْنَىٰ
translation_english: As for him who was a miser and behaved with aversion (to Allah),

arabic: وَكَذَّبَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ
translation_english: and denied the Truth of goodness:

arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْعُسْرَىٰ
translation_english: We shall facilitate for him the way to Hardship,

arabic: وَمَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُ مَالُهُ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰ
translation_english: and his wealth shall be of no avail to him when he perishes.

arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا لَلْهُدَىٰ
translation_english: Surely it is for Us to show the Right Way,

arabic: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلْآخِرَةَ وَالْأُولَىٰ
translation_english: and to Us belong the Next Life and the present.

arabic: فَأَنذَرْتُكُمْ نَارًا تَلَظَّىٰ
translation_english: I have now warned you of a Blazing Fire,

arabic: لَا يَصْلَاهَا إِلَّا الْأَشْقَى
translation_english: where none shall burn except the most wicked,

arabic: الَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
translation_english: who rejected the Truth, calling it falsehood and turned his back on it.

arabic: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا الْأَتْقَى
translation_english: But the God-fearing shall be kept away from it,

arabic: الَّذِي يُؤْتِي مَالَهُ يَتَزَكَّىٰ
translation_english: the Godfearing who spends his wealth to purify himself;

arabic: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُ مِن نِّعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰ
translation_english: not as payment for any favours that he received,

arabic: إِلَّا ابْتِغَاءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِ الْأَعْلَىٰ
translation_english: but only to seek the good pleasure of his Lord Most High.

arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يَرْضَىٰ
translation_english: He will surely be well-pleased (with him).

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالضُّحَىٰ
translation_english: By the bright forenoon,

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
translation_english: and by the night when it covers the world with peace:

arabic: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ
translation_english: (O Prophet), your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased.

arabic: وَلَلْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَّكَ مِنَ الْأُولَىٰ
translation_english: Indeed what is to come will be better for you than what has gone by.

arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰ
translation_english: Verily your Lord will soon give you so amply that you will be well-pleased.

arabic: أَلَمْ يَجِدْكَ يَتِيمًا فَآوَىٰ
translation_english: Did He not find you an orphan and then gave you shelter?

arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَالًّا فَهَدَىٰ
translation_english: Did He not find you unaware of the Right Way, and then directed you to it?

arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ عَائِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ
translation_english: And did He not find you in want, and then enriched you?

arabic: فَأَمَّا الْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ
translation_english: Therefore, be not harsh with the orphan;

arabic: وَأَمَّا السَّائِلَ فَلَا تَنْهَرْ
translation_english: and chide not him who asks,

arabic: وَأَمَّا بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثْ
translation_english: and proclaim the bounty of your Lord.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ
translation_english: (O Prophet), Did We not lay open your breast

arabic: وَوَضَعْنَا عَنكَ وِزْرَكَ
translation_english: and relieve you of the burden

arabic: الَّذِي أَنقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ
translation_english: that had well-nigh broken your back?

arabic: وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ
translation_english: And did We not exalt your fame?

arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
translation_english: Indeed, there is ease with hardship.

arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
translation_english: Most certainly, there is ease with hardship.

arabic: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَانصَبْ
translation_english: So, whenever you are free, strive in devotion,

arabic: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَارْغَب
translation_english: and turn to your Lord with longing.

arabic: بِّسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالتِّينِ وَالزَّيْتُونِ
translation_english: By the fig and the olive;

arabic: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ
translation_english: and by the Mount Sinai,

arabic: وَهَـٰذَا الْبَلَدِ الْأَمِينِ
translation_english: and by this city (of Makkah), a haven of peace:

arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ فِي أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
translation_english: surely We created man in the best mould;

arabic: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَاهُ أَسْفَلَ سَافِلِينَ
translation_english: then We reverted him to the lowest of the low,

arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
translation_english: except those who have faith and do righteous deeds. Theirs is a never ending reward.

arabic: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِالدِّينِ
translation_english: Who, then, can give the lie to you, (O Prophet), about the Reward and the Punishment?

arabic: أَلَيْسَ اللَّهُ بِأَحْكَمِ الْحَاكِمِينَ
translation_english: Is not Allah the Greatest of all sovereigns?

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْرَأْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ
translation_english: Recite in the name of your Lord Who created,

arabic: خَلَقَ الْإِنسَانَ مِنْ عَلَقٍ
translation_english: created man from a clot of congealed blood.

arabic: اقْرَأْ وَرَبُّكَ الْأَكْرَمُ
translation_english: Recite: and your Lord is Most Generous,

arabic: الَّذِي عَلَّمَ بِالْقَلَمِ
translation_english: Who taught by the pen,

arabic: عَلَّمَ الْإِنسَانَ مَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ
translation_english: taught man what he did not know.

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لَيَطْغَىٰ
translation_english: Nay, surely man transgresses;

arabic: أَن رَّآهُ اسْتَغْنَىٰ
translation_english: for he believes himself to be self-sufficient.

arabic: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الرُّجْعَىٰ
translation_english: Surely to your Lord is your return.

arabic: أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يَنْهَىٰ
translation_english: Did you see him who forbids

arabic: عَبْدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰ
translation_english: a servant (of Allah) when he prays?

arabic: أَرَأَيْتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى الْهُدَىٰ
translation_english: Did you consider: what if he is on the Right Way,

arabic: أَوْ أَمَرَ بِالتَّقْوَىٰ
translation_english: and enjoins piety?

arabic: أَرَأَيْتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
translation_english: Did you consider: what if he gives the lie (to the Truth) and turns away (from it)?

arabic: أَلَمْ يَعْلَم بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَرَىٰ
translation_english: Does he not know that Allah sees everything?

arabic: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًا بِالنَّاصِيَةِ
translation_english: No indeed; if he does not desist, We shall drag him by the forelock;

arabic: نَاصِيَةٍ كَاذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٍ
translation_english: by the lying forelock steeped in sin.

arabic: فَلْيَدْعُ نَادِيَهُ
translation_english: So let him summon his helpmates;

arabic: سَنَدْعُ الزَّبَانِيَةَ
translation_english: We too shall summon the guards of Hell.

arabic: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعْهُ وَاسْجُدْ وَاقْتَرِب ۩
translation_english: No, not at all. Never obey him. But prostrate yourself and become nigh (to your Lord).

arabic: بِّسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ
translation_english: Behold, We revealed this (Qur'an) on the Night of Power.

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ
translation_english: And what do you know what the Night of Power is?

arabic: لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
translation_english: The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.

arabic: تَنَزَّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
translation_english: The angels along with the Spirit descend in it by the permission of their Lord with all kinds of decrees.

arabic: سَلَامٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطْلَعِ الْفَجْرِ
translation_english: All peace is that night until the rise of dawn.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَمْ يَكُنِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
translation_english: Those who disbelieved – be they from the People of the Book or from those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity – will not desist from unbelief until the Clear Proof should come to them;

arabic: رَسُولٌ مِّنَ اللَّهِ يَتْلُو صُحُفًا مُّطَهَّرَةً
translation_english: a Messenger from Allah, reciting from Purified Scrolls;

arabic: فِيهَا كُتُبٌ قَيِّمَةٌ
translation_english: in writings wherein are scriptures, absolutely true and unerring.

arabic: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا مِن بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَتْهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
translation_english: Nor did those to whom the Book had been given split up until after the Proof (of the Right Way) had come to them.

arabic: وَمَا أُمِرُوا إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ حُنَفَاءَ وَيُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُوا الزَّكَاةَ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ الْقَيِّمَةِ
translation_english: Yet all that they had been commanded was that they serve Allah, with utter sincerity, devoting themselves exclusively to Him, and that they establish Prayer and pay Zakah. That is the Right Faith.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ الْبَرِيَّةِ
translation_english: Those who disbelieved – be they from among the People of the Book or among those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity– shall be in the Fire, and will abide in it. They are the worst of creatures.

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ أُولَـٰئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ الْبَرِيَّةِ
translation_english: But those that believe and work righteous deeds, they are the best of creatures.

arabic: جَزَاؤُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ رَّضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُ
translation_english: Their recompense lies with their Lord: Gardens of eternity beneath which rivers flow; therein they shall dwell, forever and ever. Allah is well-pleased with them, and they are well-pleased with Him. All this is for him who fears his Lord.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا
translation_english: When the earth will be shaken with a mighty shaking,

arabic: وَأَخْرَجَتِ الْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا
translation_english: and the earth will throw up all her burdens,

arabic: وَقَالَ الْإِنسَانُ مَا لَهَا
translation_english: and man will cry out: “What is the matter with her?”

arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُحَدِّثُ أَخْبَارَهَا
translation_english: On that Day it will relate all her news,

arabic: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوْحَىٰ لَهَا
translation_english: for your Lord will have commanded her (to do so).

arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ النَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِّيُرَوْا أَعْمَالَهُمْ
translation_english: On that Day people will go forth in varying states so that they be shown their deeds.

arabic: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ
translation_english: So, whoever does an atom's weight of good shall see it;

arabic: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ
translation_english: and whoever does an atom's weight of evil shall see it.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْعَادِيَاتِ ضَبْحًا
translation_english: By (the horses) that charge snorting,

arabic: فَالْمُورِيَاتِ قَدْحًا
translation_english: then raise sparks of fire (by their hoofs),

arabic: فَالْمُغِيرَاتِ صُبْحًا
translation_english: then raid by the dawn,

arabic: فَأَثَرْنَ بِهِ نَقْعًا
translation_english: and blaze a trail of dust,

arabic: فَوَسَطْنَ بِهِ جَمْعًا
translation_english: and penetrate deep into a host.

arabic: إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لِرَبِّهِ لَكَنُودٌ
translation_english: Verily man is most ungrateful to his Lord;

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٌ
translation_english: and he himself is a witness to that,

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لِحُبِّ الْخَيْرِ لَشَدِيدٌ
translation_english: and surely he loves riches with a passionate loving.

arabic: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِي الْقُبُورِ
translation_english: Is he not aware that when whatever lies (buried) in the graves is overthrown;

arabic: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي الصُّدُورِ
translation_english: and the secrets of the hearts are laid bare (and examined)?

arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّخَبِيرٌ
translation_english: Surely on that Day will their Lord be fully informed about them.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الْقَارِعَةُ
translation_english: The Calamity!

arabic: مَا الْقَارِعَةُ
translation_english: What is the Calamity?

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْقَارِعَةُ
translation_english: And what do you know what the Calamity is?

arabic: يَوْمَ يَكُونُ النَّاسُ كَالْفَرَاشِ الْمَبْثُوثِ
translation_english: On that Day human beings shall be like scattered moths,

arabic: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ الْمَنفُوشِ
translation_english: and the mountains shall be like fluffs of carded wool in varying colours.

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَازِينُهُ
translation_english: Then he whose scales weigh heavier

arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ
translation_english: shall have a blissful life;

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَازِينُهُ
translation_english: but he whose scales weigh lighter,

arabic: فَأُمُّهُ هَاوِيَةٌ
translation_english: his shall be the deep pit for a dwelling.

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا هِيَهْ
translation_english: And what do you know what that is?

arabic: نَارٌ حَامِيَةٌ
translation_english: A Blazing Fire!

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلْهَاكُمُ التَّكَاثُرُ
translation_english: The craving for ever-greater worldly gains and to excel others in that regard keeps you occupied

arabic: حَتَّىٰ زُرْتُمُ الْمَقَابِرَ
translation_english: until you reach your graves.

arabic: كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: Nay, you will soon come to know;

arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
translation_english: nay, again, you shall soon come to know.

arabic: كَلَّا لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عِلْمَ الْيَقِينِ
translation_english: Nay, would that you knew with certainty of knowledge (what your attitude will lead to, you would never have acted the way you do).

arabic: لَتَرَوُنَّ الْجَحِيمَ
translation_english: You will surely end up seeing Hell;

arabic: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيْنَ الْيَقِينِ
translation_english: again, you shall most certainly end up seeing it with absolute certainty.

arabic: ثُمَّ لَتُسْأَلُنَّ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَنِ النَّعِيمِ
translation_english: Then, on that Day, you will be called to account for all the bounties you enjoyed.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْعَصْرِ
translation_english: By the time!

arabic: إِنَّ الْإِنسَانَ لَفِي خُسْرٍ
translation_english: Lo! Man is in a state of loss;

arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ
translation_english: save those who have faith and do righteous deeds, and counsel each other to hold on to truth and counsel each other to be steadfast.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةٍ لُّمَزَةٍ
translation_english: Woe to every fault-finding backbiter;

arabic: الَّذِي جَمَعَ مَالًا وَعَدَّدَهُ
translation_english: who amasses wealth and counts it over and again.

arabic: يَحْسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُ أَخْلَدَهُ
translation_english: He thinks that his wealth will immortalise him forever.

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ لَيُنبَذَنَّ فِي الْحُطَمَةِ
translation_english: Nay, he shall be thrown into the Crusher.

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْحُطَمَةُ
translation_english: And what do you know what the Crusher is?

arabic: نَارُ اللَّهِ الْمُوقَدَةُ
translation_english: It is the Fire kindled by Allah,

arabic: الَّتِي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى الْأَفْئِدَةِ
translation_english: the Fire that shall rise to the hearts (of criminals).

arabic: إِنَّهَا عَلَيْهِم مُّؤْصَدَةٌ
translation_english: Verily it will close in upon them,

arabic: فِي عَمَدٍ مُّمَدَّدَةٍ
translation_english: in outstretched columns.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَابِ الْفِيلِ
translation_english: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephants?

arabic: أَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ كَيْدَهُمْ فِي تَضْلِيلٍ
translation_english: Did He not bring their plan to naught?

arabic: وَأَرْسَلَ عَلَيْهِمْ طَيْرًا أَبَابِيلَ
translation_english: And He sent against them swarms of birds

arabic: تَرْمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٍ مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
translation_english: which smote them with stones of baked clay,

arabic: فَجَعَلَهُمْ كَعَصْفٍ مَّأْكُولٍ
translation_english: and made them like straw eaten up (by cattle).

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لِإِيلَافِ قُرَيْشٍ
translation_english: Since the Quraysh became accustomed,

arabic: إِيلَافِهِمْ رِحْلَةَ الشِّتَاءِ وَالصَّيْفِ
translation_english: accustomed to the journey of winter and summer,

arabic: فَلْيَعْبُدُوا رَبَّ هَـٰذَا الْبَيْتِ
translation_english: therefore, let them worship the Lord of this House;

arabic: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَآمَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍ
translation_english: Who fed them against hunger, and secured them against fear.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِالدِّينِ
translation_english: Did you see him who gives the lie to the Reward and Punishment of the Hereafter?

arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ الَّذِي يَدُعُّ الْيَتِيمَ
translation_english: Such is the one who repulses the orphans away,

arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ
translation_english: and urges not the feeding of the needy.

arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلْمُصَلِّينَ
translation_english: Woe, then, to those who pray,

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَن صَلَاتِهِمْ سَاهُونَ
translation_english: but are heedless in their Prayers,

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ يُرَاءُونَ
translation_english: those who do good (in order) to be seen,

arabic: وَيَمْنَعُونَ الْمَاعُونَ
translation_english: and deny people the articles of common necessity.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَعْطَيْنَاكَ الْكَوْثَرَ
translation_english: (O Prophet), We have surely bestowed upon you good in abundance.

arabic: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَانْحَرْ
translation_english: So offer Prayer and sacrifice to your Lord alone.

arabic: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ الْأَبْتَرُ
translation_english: Verily your enemy alone has been cut off from the roots.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْكَافِرُونَ
translation_english: Say: “O unbelievers!”

arabic: لَا أَعْبُدُ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
translation_english: I do not worship those that you worship

arabic: وَلَا أَنتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ
translation_english: neither do you worship Him Whom I worship;

arabic: وَلَا أَنَا عَابِدٌ مَّا عَبَدتُّمْ
translation_english: nor will I worship those whom you have worshipped;

arabic: وَلَا أَنتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ
translation_english: nor are you going to worship Him Whom I worship.

arabic: لَكُمْ دِينُكُمْ وَلِيَ دِينِ
translation_english: To you is your religion, and to me, my religion.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا جَاءَ نَصْرُ اللَّهِ وَالْفَتْحُ
translation_english: When the help comes from Allah, and victory (is granted),

arabic: وَرَأَيْتَ النَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
translation_english: and you see people entering Allah's religion in multitudes,

arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَاسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ تَوَّابًا
translation_english: then extol the praise of your Lord and pray to Him for forgiveness. For He indeed is ever disposed to accept repentance.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَّتْ يَدَا أَبِي لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ
translation_english: Destroyed were the hands of Abu Lahab, and he lay utterly doomed.

arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ
translation_english: His wealth did not avail him, nor his acquisitions.

arabic: سَيَصْلَىٰ نَارًا ذَاتَ لَهَبٍ
translation_english: Surely, he will be cast into a Flaming Fire

arabic: وَامْرَأَتُهُ حَمَّالَةَ الْحَطَبِ
translation_english: along with his wife, that carrier of slanderous tales;

arabic: فِي جِيدِهَا حَبْلٌ مِّن مَّسَدٍ
translation_english: upon her neck shall be a rope of palm-fibre.

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
translation_english: Say: “He is Allah, the One and Unique;

arabic: اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ
translation_english: Allah, Who is in need of none and of Whom all are in need;

arabic: لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ
translation_english: He neither begot any nor was He begotten,

arabic: وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
translation_english: and none is comparable to Him.”

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ
translation_english: Say: “I seek refuge with the Lord of the rising day;

arabic: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
translation_english: from the evil of all that He created;

arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ
translation_english: from the evil of night's darkness when it spreads around;

arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ
translation_english: from the evil of the women who blow on knots;

arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
translation_english: and from the evil of the envier when he envies.”

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ
translation_english: Say: “I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind;

arabic: مَلِكِ النَّاسِ
translation_english: the King of mankind,

arabic: إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ
translation_english: the True God of mankind,

arabic: مِن شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ
translation_english: from the mischief of the whispering, elusive prompter who returns again and again,

arabic: الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ
translation_english: who whispers in the hearts of people;

arabic: مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ
translation_english: whether he be from the jinn or humans.”
